Review_Text: Things I liked in the university premises is not about University it about meeting new friends  University infrastructure is good like good Lab facilities and neat ambience of college classes and premises. The effectiveness of placement services and support provided from career development is very good

Name: Mukunda Krishna Dasiga
Review_Text: Things I disliked is about that the college is in construction mode  Things I disliked is that about college ffcs process in which we can't make or made good communication with others  Things I disliked in this is about food is average in taste in hostels

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: infrastructure is good,interaction between professors and students is really attractive thing in this college. Nothing till now,but you will get the services which are required in time the campus life in the college is very good.

Name: Ansh Sisodiya
Review_Text: the most i liked was the sports which include all the games. the way they set the classes to know more about ourselves. the maintance in the hostel mess i don't like it.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: constuctin work which is going on now i don't like. some of the faculty who do overaction i don't like. The one thing I liked it the encouragement of research and making more research paper and faculties even help you out of they liked the ideas

Name: Rakshita shri
Review_Text: Online reach of the college and online network opportunities. Medicore couses and less offline  social and networking opportunities besides the one that come to the college cause of colleges location  Fest and events on small scale cause campus still under construction

Name: Ayushi Nag
Review_Text: Good infrastructure, Nice hostel facilities Nice coding culture and good placements, 100 % Phd faculties, FFCS(You can make your time table), supporting faculties.

Name: Aman Prasad
Review_Text: Till now i didn't disliked anything in the college. All the facilities and culture of our college is very nice. One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: S Roshan Prabu
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des A lot of Clubs & Societies in College to keep you engaged Good Connection with Universities Abroad. If you want to do your masters abroad and not worried about placements this college is a right choice for you

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: FFCS (Fully Flexible Credit System) it allows you select your choice of time table and faculty .  The college is between no where No place to hangout nearby for even slightest of things u need to go to Vijaywada.  Infrastructure - as the college is still under its development phase  Construction all around.

Name: Rakshit Yadav
Review_Text: Restrictions that are quite unnecessary. As if wearing ID all day, Permission and  Approvals for everything.  The campus is big and quite good hygene a.d cleanliness is maintained here. Faculties are good and are graduated from IIT'S so it's a good point Good teaching and also friendly nature of professors can be seen here.

Name: Arbind Agarwal
Review_Text: Communication skills in english can be inproved here and can learn lots of things here Food needed to be improve. Place to sit in mess is less. Wifi services is not all good here. Needed to look after it.

Name: Karthi
Review_Text: Hot water should be available 24 x 7. Quantity of food should be served more. The infrastructure and the classrooms are Appreciable . The thing which need improvement is the Wifi speed and the Overpriced Canteens . The social life is very evergreen . I quite like the garden , the buildings , the views and the fresh air I get since it is not in the middle of any industrialized area.

Name: SAI DHEERAJ
Review_Text: The faculties are really all PHD fr. A very few (I mean really few) faculties are like blacklisted type cuz they are super strict but rest are really helpful and engaging .They provide a whole 4rth year as internship year and the don't conduct classe It's location is kind of offside a little bit ..m I mean it's named VIT bhopal but is 70 kms away . The Canteen is Overpriced. I don't live in hostel nor do I have any close hostel friends so I don't really know about hostel Life much ... It's also 1st year so I'll know probably later on...

Name: Naman Tolasaria
Review_Text: The thing is I am hearing some inside things that the centralised placenta are getting closed from next year ... If this happens I'll really hate this  The FFCS system in which you could chose your own slot or class timings The FFCS system also allows you to chose your Faculty

Name: Divyesh Tripathi
Review_Text: Internship opportunities are too goood and better than any other college. VIT AP doesn't give you a holiday break. Great enviroment to grow and learn, can be a little lenient with timings

Name: Smera MA
Review_Text: Great social interaction if you join any clubs without it is is a bit harder wide variety of faculties from great to bad we get to choose  Strict differences for co-ed interaction and language barrier

Name: Abhay Kumar
Review_Text: timings regulation for going out or coming in and biometric everywhere Strict attendance policy and disciplinary actions Their Infrastructure is So Good and their Availability of canteen facilitates they also have Domino's and Nescafe inside their Campus

Name: Cheppuru Amrutha
Review_Text: I like the flexibility of time table , We can choose class timings according to our convenience  All the faculty members are phd Holders from top universities mostly from IIM They don't have proper ground for playing

Name: Rohan
Review_Text: They don't have more fest and Events rather than Riviera and Gravitas The arrear fees was 6000 per subject and have to attend classes in weekends and Summer vacations  Infrastructure is not that good compare to other colleges

Name: Abhinash v
Review_Text: Some teachers are good enough but some are bad But getting into this college make us to know real competition  There is no proper ground in this college

Name: Harshan A
Review_Text: For fresheres there not much flexibility  College is too far from the town 😭😔😭😔 Good infrastructure teachers are friendly they teach fabulous

Name: Mohammed Sinan K
Review_Text: Nothing should be improvemrnt in college  I like the college because it has large football cricket ground swimming pool is also there  The fee structure is not affordable  it should be reduced

Name: PURUSHOTHAMAN B
Review_Text: Girls are lesser than boys it should be equal  Canteen is not good not hygiene and comfortable  Things I like in vit is its main facility called FFCS (fully flexible credit system) allows students to opt their own intrested faculty and subjects

Name: Ramkoti naik ramavath
Review_Text: Campus has large amount of trees which is more cooler in summer and it have best spots to chill with friends during free period  It provides shuttles inside the campus so it'll be easy for students to move from one place to another inside the campus  For every period you have move from one class to another class

Name: Pavan Ramesh
Review_Text: Vit has too much crowd, that is uncontrollable when there's an event or any special day  Students should be inside the hostels before 9pm which is a bit disappointed  New friends, teachers, infrastructure was good

Name: Kalle Hemanth Garuda
Review_Text: Labs were maintained, Air conditioning was good One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: Kaisfe
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: Shaik salma
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Campus area is big and shuttle are available in the college faculty are good . There is no raging happen in the college or hostel.  The academic block and men's hostel have a railway track chennai bangalore main line. There are only four tunnel to cross the tracks these are at particular point . So personallly I am not liking it

Name: Logavinayagam M
Review_Text: I liked most the FFCS system here in which you can select your faculty acc to you and can set your time table according to your convenience  The faculty is nice and not much irritating all the teachers are friendly  Campus is very green very greenery here and many cafes are there where food is good and mess food is also good and hostel rooms are spacious and ventilation is very nice weather is also good

Name: Arushi Srivastava
Review_Text: The campus is not much developed campus is in under construction and there are strict rules here  Night life is not very much in campus as you are not allowed to go outside the college after 9pm Hostel restrictions are also there as you can not go to other rooms but can do if guard doesn't catches you but you can do that guards doesn't much have complaints

Name: CHITTEM PRAVEENA
Review_Text: The college is not very overpopulated like others. FFCS feature is one of the good thing. as well as syllabus is not unnecessarily big. fests are frequent here, which is good for refreshing mind.

Name: JASH CHORDIYA
Review_Text: Every events require to pay some amount of money. Hostel to academic block is very far and no bus service is available. rules are unnecessary and bad which is very irrirtating.

Name: Dhruv
Review_Text: I liked the campus size, it is about 370 acre huge campus with a lot of greenery and fresh air The campus has a lot of food stall starting from Dominos , Lassi house Nescafe etc to cover up your hunger The class rooms are clean and well maintained

Name: Dinesh
Review_Text: The number of students in the campus are huge. Almost 40,000 students are in campus. 8000 students in each year can cause a huge problem in the time of placements We have to travel 2 km from hostel to academic building everyday , almost 10 km in a day There is mainly a huge rush in the time of placement as there is huge number of students

Name: Manan Chhikara
Review_Text: Apart  from a generic undergraduate programme in mechanical engineering, the-school  offers specialized UG  programming in all core areas of the mechanical engineering  Vellore institute of technology has a large number of faculty members with approximately  3,000  professors,associate professors, and assistant professors  The vellore institute and technology (VIT) has several initiatives to engage students and the community, including

Name: B SAI TILAK REDDY
Review_Text: Some say the basic amenities and infrastructure at vellore institute and technology (VIT) could be  improved  The extra push the placement. VIT actually pushes  you and makes you work actually and worthy for being recruited by companies unlikes  other colleges they care for placement Opportunity. I think this is very  important asVIT is an  land of  opportunities. You will get an opportunity to excel  in any field you like let me give an example if you excel  in which ever field you like

Name: Arthi Surisetty
Review_Text: Infrastructure and the technology used is completely up to date  The classrooms and teaching methods are up to date as well with good ppt and whiteboard teaching  The teachers are all qualified and very rare occurrence may happen where the teacher is clueless himself as to what is going on

Name: Isha
Review_Text: Population. There are way too many students enrolled in the college due to category system Alot of competition, due to the heavy population, we need to compete against alot of people for a good job Too strict in some ways such as hostel in times, guy girl distance, etc

Name: Aryaman
Review_Text: The college campus is in the heart of the city. The railway station is just 4km from the Main gate. Also the local market and bus stand are in close proximity. The campus is very beautiful. Have lush green beauty and lots of in-campus facilities like multiple stores, food stalls, stationary stores,etc. The campus is internet-enabled. Also the sports facilities are very good. With every kind of sport possible available to play.

Name: ARYAN TALAN
Review_Text: The internet speed sometimes is very poor. The wifi have been locked to a speed of just 10mbps. The rules here are so strict that it feels like you are in a secondary school. With every other thing leading to fine or disciplinary action.  The men's hostel are very distant from the academic blocks.

Name: Vamsi
Review_Text: I think taking test in every 1-2 months is very good idea for the goodness of students so that student learn and improve after seeing  results they can improve. many clubs so that the students take part in and improve their skills and increase social interaction. Number of students is very high and compact here strength of students is about 40000 of all branches.

Name: Vaishnavi mishra
Review_Text: Some teachers distinguish between students of North and South. Seriously in checking paper they gave low marks to north indian students. University Infrastructure, campus life, clubs and chapters, sports facilities, hostel infrastructure are really great! The faculties are highly qualified and the syllabus is apt for the course learning

Name: LIZLEY CLIFFERD
Review_Text: Thr hostel rooms are quite comfortable if you get the right roomates and the infrastructure of the hostels with gym and sport facilities is also great! Some of the faculties have trouble understanding english and mostly speak tamil. Mess food could be improved and would make it convenient

Name: DHANIYALA VASU
Review_Text: A bit populated especially at night, it feels a little conjusted. All amenities are available in the hostel premises. But most of the good ones come at a price. On the other hand there is a free gym and considering all things is the best amenity provided for free Quality of the infrastructure, campus amenities and learning facilities are all good

Name: VISHAL SHARMA
Review_Text: Boy to girl ratio in the entire college is about 4:1 but the ratio skews depending on the course. Very costly and less time to enjoy these amenities  Food quality and quantity both are very lacking for the price.

Name: Mayukh
Review_Text: Placement services is very competitive and cut-throat. But with enough preparation should be doable. One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: Priyank solanki
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: R SANJANA
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Campus is very good and accomodating for students FFCS is offered so we can choose which subject we want for the semester

Name: Taniya
Review_Text: The courses are very good, both theory and practical Weather at campus is unpredictable, making it tough daily Some teachers are taken on contract, they dont teach well

Name: Monisha
Review_Text: Everything here is based on ranking, from hostel to fees I liked in this college is environment and food streets and garden arrangement and placements are also very good here so that's why Ive  joined to vit ap Campus is around 100 acres and they are building more buildings for student facility

Name: Sumaiya Kulsoom
Review_Text: Some faculties are not good in teaching and outing related things And another main thing is there is a city after 18 kms of the college surroding area full of villages Diverse group of people. People from all walks of life come here.

Name: DEBANJAN ROY
Review_Text: The scope and support given to research. Crowd. It is extremely crowded and there's barely any space to walk around. People have 0 civil sense. Washrooms are filthy.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Food quality is poor. Contagious germinated food. I liked the infrastructure the most and the campus Life is good as it's a very big campus  I like the sports facilities here as well like they have various courts for tennis, badminton, basketball, volleyball,etc. as well as the gymnasiums so the physical health remains good

Name: Jeyashree
Review_Text: Girls to Boys ratio is also very good .I think it will around 0.8  I don't like so many of the strict rules  There is no night life in the campus as we are said to enter the hostels before 9 pm every night

Name: madhu
Review_Text: I also don't like the number of students as it is very high  New hostel blocks are good and spacious and time to time cleaning facilities are available  Lush green campus with different types of sports ground available

Name: Sriram K
Review_Text: The in time for hostel is too early for both boys and girls  Outing time is very less for weekdays and weekends, it should be atleast 5 hours Hostel rules are very strict, students are not allowed to enjoy their hostel life properly

Name: Brinda Parandama
Review_Text: Diversity Of India, students from all over india. Very big campus size, spawning in 300 acres All teacher are doctorate holders and have great experience.

Name: samrat surya
Review_Text: Too much student intake almost of 5000 students per year. Boys hostel and academic block is too far and takes time to walk. All extra curricular activities and events are paid .

Name: Piyush Kumar Mishra
Review_Text: College campus is very big and you cannot explore everything within a week also. Transport facilities are very good inside the campus Faculties are very good and cooperative in nature

Name: naisha mishra
Review_Text: College outside atmosphere is not at all good The cab drivers  are very rude in nature  Too much crowd is in the college this year

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Educational Facilities and Academic Accompaniments Infrastructural Services and Transport within the campus Natural Beauty, Cleanliness, Maintenence and Waste Management

Name: KARTIK SHARMA
Review_Text: Excessive Crowd leading to clogging of subways and usage of facilities Quality of mess food and cleanliness maintained around mess areas Strict restriction timings cause lack of visits out of campus limiting sources of recreation

Name: Preetham Bhagya Raj
Review_Text: the campus institute provides is very good and auspicious . well organised and up to date lab systems . good servise and staff . teachers are well experianced. also good placements

Name: Aryan Kulkarni
Review_Text: crowd! there are literally lot of crowd in vit . Most of the faculties are very helpful and knowledgeable. They can make learning fun .  Lots of exposure to various events, and provides a space for students to learn, grow and build themselves for a better tomorrow. Has a good international reputation too.

Name: DHRUV GUPTA
Review_Text: Decent placements. If a student works hard he can get pretty decent placements.  Too many students. Hence a lot of crowd can be seen. Can be quite suffocating at times.  Management can be a bit incompetent at times. Especially hostel management.

Name: VAIBHAVI UGAM SHET GOVEKAR
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech

Name: Rishabh
Review_Text: I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des

Name: Vardhan
Review_Text: University infrastructure whatever is there, is good Both Indoor and Outdoor sports facilities is decent Course curriculum is mostly updated with real world based application questions being asked in exams

Name: Kshitij Pathak
Review_Text: Intake has increased drastically in last few years, not just for AP campus but for all VIT campuses.  Mess food although decent, can be improved a lot Extremely hectic time schedule and very high academic pressure due to 2 mid sems, a lab finals, End sems along with quizzes, assignments, etc.

Name: Sai chandana
Review_Text: The campus is huge and also has great infrastructure The girls to boy ration  depends on branch, in cse it is less The college provides shops for all needs , which are also affordable

Name: Kushal Giduturi
Review_Text: The academics some times feel a bit hectic and burdersome College has strict rules, which can feel problematic at times  You might have to walk a lot, the average steps is about 15000

Name: CHEREDDY JYOSHNA
Review_Text: campus area is really good and course structure is really good we can select our own timetable and faculty sports facilities are good and food street is also well organised

Name: Ayush Shrivastava
Review_Text: hostel facilities are very bad and mess food is horrible campus is under contruction so lot of disturbance some of the faculties are very bad in teaching

Name: Edith
Review_Text: Campus is really big and nice and has a really good infrastructure. Here you get a change to create your own time table and select faculties according to your choice The gender ratio here is really good compared to other engineering colleges. The gender ration would be about 2 girls per 3 Boys

Name: Raju
Review_Text: The campus is not yet fully accessible as construction work is going on everywhere  This college lies in outskirts and is about 70 km away from the main city The hostel rules are kind of strict here

Name: Sahil Khan
Review_Text: The teaching methodology (again depends on the faculty). Resources provided for the course, academical support for the weaker students from the faculty with some personal touch and quizzes a d frequent class tests for improvement of subject. Fully flexible credit system, a type of program where we have the flexibility of choosing our own courses in the particular programme where we can pick what we want to study and design our own time table. Other resources like labs with advanced tech and the library with a wider range of collection which updates every month. And the technical teams in vit which also unlock your inventor passion and helps in improving skills in the field you want to be

Name: Aryan Singh
Review_Text: The commerciality in every aspect in vit. Sometimes if we mess up anything the fee layoff is too high and the behaviour of the basic staff sometimes really pisses out Infrastructure of my college is very nice. Students are from different parta of india.

Name: Harini
Review_Text: Social interaction is very nice. I get to learn new things from everybody. Fees is not very much affordable for many people . There are many students in college so competition is high.

Name: K VENKAT CHARAN REDDY
Review_Text: As this college is in chennai so it is very hot here. The thing I liked the most which comes to mind first is the Campus, its very large has tons of greenery and provides everything you need from shops to food inside the campus grounds leaving you with no real necessity to go outside. There are people from all over the country so it gives you a multicutural experience

Name: Arpit Ambastha
Review_Text: Hostel facilities for me have me more than satisfactory. The intake is a little too much and it seems to be increasing every year making the campus congested despite its size. The weather in the area can be quite unforgiving barring the winter months.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The food given in the mess is comparatively better when taking the mess of other universities in regard. The ffcs system with the help of which we can select teacher and class timings according to our choice  The campus environment,nature and greenery

Name: Yadhu krishna
Review_Text: Active organisation of events and programs  Strict rules and regulations makes different lifestyle  South Indian dominant cultures inspite of being in central india

Name: siddu teja
Review_Text: Grading system in semester exams depend on the overall class average  Campus is big, overall infrastructure is good and hostels are also quite decent and have AC.  Academics overall are good. The curriculum was updated a few years ago so that's good.

Name: manoj vamsi nayak
Review_Text: Lab facilities are really good and there are a lot on events going on daily.  Hostel Intimes are 9PM for boys and 8:30 for girls. They are very strict with this.  High student intake means the campus is overall crowded.

Name: panduranga
Review_Text: I like the fact that there are many people who weren't able to get into iits or nits due to the reservation there and have come here and study very well. The course structure is also good as it helps you gain a lot of knowledge that will be useful in the future. Extra-curricular activities are also encouraged here as there are a lot of clubs to join in this university. Also diverse group of people.

Name: Abhishek SM
Review_Text: Fees structure. Feels like some people pay too much per year and in the end it isn't worth it at all. The number of people studying here is way too much and needs to be reduced by a LOT. Teachers are very strict and give a lot of assignments and work and in the end don't even give full marks.

Name: Rajat Pal
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech

Name: Mithilesh Angal
Review_Text: I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des

Name: Tej Gokani
Review_Text: Good faculty and neat buildings and a nice playground  Great infrastructure and a pleasant place for a student And all the equipment is avaliable in the labs

Name: Arjunn
Review_Text: The security it too tight for a student to emerge  The food in canteen needed to be improved and prices are too high Some faculty need to be changed some fo them are lack of subject

Name: sushovon
Review_Text: Good amount of social interaction with the number of people around Very good curriculum, electives are industry relevant Infrastructure is top notch, labs are good.

Name: D HITESH NAIDU
Review_Text: Hostels are miserable for seniors (ultimately us later on) People and management are rude and don't listen to us Mess food is bad in a lot of messes, we often end up buying food

Name: Manisha
Review_Text: Hostel rooms are good, well mentained bathrooms Flexible credit system, you can select your teacher Playground is spacious and Badminton court are well maintained

Name: V HEMAL
Review_Text: Cramping is rampant due to high intake of students Too much restrictions, especially girls. Cant roam outside after 9pm if your fresher

Name: Saara Anand
Review_Text: I liked the hostel at my college the rooms are clean with functioning fan light and good quality bed and cupboard  I like the academics it is not too diverted from what we need to study we study everything related to our branch The campus life is also good there are lot of fests and events

Name: Bhanu Sreekar
Review_Text: There are a lot of students and the rules are pretty strict The hostel intime is pretty early and campus intime is also very early Some teachers are really good but some teachera are really bad and blacklisted

Name: TANMAY GALAV
Review_Text: Boys to girls ratio was around 1:3 I think.and there are many good things like we can interact with different people every year who comes from different places across the world. The main good thing here is ffcs.which u can only choose ur subject and teacher u want There are many fests happens in vit.the biggest fest was Rivera which will happen in Feb. Ending or March starting for 4 days .many celebs will come for that fest also.

Name: Harsha vardhan
Review_Text: There is no big auditorium in vit Vellore There is no garden area or something to just chill with frnds The faculty is very professional and well-learned. Many of the faculties have also taught in numerous IIT's.

Name: Chirag Mv
Review_Text: The infrastructure is great with amenities like Gyms, Swimming Pool, Tennis Court, Basketball Courts, Badminton and TableTennis inside the Campus itself If you want to research then this college is a great pick as VIT publishing more Research Papers than some of the top IIT's Even though VIT has a large population from Northern India still I felt a sense of biasness towards North Indians.

Name: Vanadhi Magendiran
Review_Text: Some of the hostel blocks are not up to date and don't have clean washrooms. Even the mess food is not that great It is very very strict on in and out timings and they oppose a fine on a regular I like the teaching of the subject . And the classrooms also looks good

Name: ABHISHEK JHA
Review_Text: I like the campus because it looks very clean .  The infrastructure of the campus is soo good and there is soo much freedom for sports  I sometimes don't like the nature of the people in this college

Name: VETRIVEL
Review_Text: I don't like the prices in the campus . It's vit expensive when compared to outside  I don't like sometimes food in hostel taste  Things I like my college it’s very big college we can explore if we want and there are sort of playgrounds to play games

Name: Anushka Gupta
Review_Text: I also like our lab facilities in classes and I also FC’s which is known as full flexible credit system First of all there some which I dislike very much in this there are some strict rules for hostellers where they can’t go outside 9pm It provides numerous research and internship opportunities.

Name: Ankit Kumar
Review_Text: The campus is way too beautiful. One can enjoy sunsets. It provides students multiple opportunities in sports and other cultural activities. The clubs are very active and keep organizing events. It has some very strict rules. You dont have a night life as u expect from a college. Gorls must enter inside hostels lastly by 8:30 pm.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The outing time is very restricted. We can go out only for 2 hrs on weekdays and 4 hrs on weekends. Campus is surrounded by lush green lands which results in a good and fresh environment. Hostel Facilities and Mess food quality is better than many good colleges too.

Name: SUDEEP MUKHERJEE
Review_Text: Many faculties are good and supporting and are also highly qualified (Some of them are even from IITs too) Campus is situated very far from core cities (approx. 75 kms from Bhopal and approx. 125 kms from Indore. Campus is still under development so we lack in many facilities like proper sports facilities, swimming pools etc.

Name: Ritesh Panda
Review_Text: Campus life is not that great as there are many restrictions for outing. One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: Shreya pandey
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: Parvesh
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Exposure to the outer companies, club activities, student faculty interaction, unique events Way of learning.They allow us to choose our own class timings and we can select extra courses to study during the sem.

Name: Arun J T
Review_Text: Fun Events and club activities. This makes every students to get a refreshing mind and have some fun. Hostel facilities. The food and room facilities is not upto the standards of the academic blocks Stress. Too much workload than compared to other colleges

Name: Arun J T
Review_Text: Classroom facilities. It could be improved like making more digital classrooms Campus Life is very vivid and there are many clubs to involve with. The exposure and the connections we get is good. There are many events happening everyday and we get to participate in the ones we like through clubs. We get to watch them in our free time too

Name: Alaqmar karampurwala
Review_Text: The faculties are well experienced and teach good. They have in-depth knowledge of the subject and provide with industrial visit and guest lectures. The hostels have very hectic rules. The hostel intime is 9 pm which is very strict.  The class timings are hectic and there are many assignments to submit. We have tests every now and then.

Name: Haji Mohamed
Review_Text: College is crowded. There is competition for almost anything. Lift,food shops,prints shops and it's time consuming  I like my class so much. Each semester class changes and classmates change.I will miss them I like my hostel very much. It is very good and sanitized

Name: Juhi Vathsalya Kothapalli
Review_Text: I like my surroundings.In vit there are many things you can enjoy. I also like my roommates I dislike the fact that i have to go 15 floors down as i am in 15th floor in hostel I have exam each month. I dislike that so much

Name: Setu
Review_Text: I dislike the fact that there are less holidays Hostel rooms are very food and food is also good Roomates and friends are very friendly and motivating

Name: Bharat Patil
Review_Text: The water of the hostel is worst and the maintenance of washroom is also bad The drinkingwater of hostel is also not good It is a place with lot of people who speak different languages,this introduces you to socialize to more people

Name: Vanshul Lalwani
Review_Text: The campus is vast and there's a lot of places to eat  I like the classrooms and the environment in the campus  Hostels can be made a little bit more good

Name: Vsvv Karthikeyan
Review_Text: Most places the cost is affordable but still for some places it's a bit expensive  There is a lot of monkeys coming inside the hostels  All the faculties are Phd holders and doctorates, they're very skilled and they give the best guidance to every students in any matter possible.

Name: Abin Renjith
Review_Text: The lab facilities and comfort and the environment is very suited for learning and the facilities allows me to explore different things. All the notes and given in PPTs and the teachers provide us the best notes which is sufficient for the exams. There's exams every month and more than 5 Digital assignments and Lab practise assessment tests and these seems to be over pressuring.

Name: InbaNiranjan
Review_Text: There are some faculties who do get on your nerves and sometimes seems to be very rude. Crowd. The college seems to be overcrowded cause ofc there's more than 50k people in here and waiting for lifts in Academics blocks are hectic . the placement facility is new but hardwork is important.

Name: Jiby  Benny Jacob
Review_Text: faculties are nice but few faculties in higher post have a rude attitude. college is okay campus is okay it's developing year by year. strict rules and regulations of the college.

Name: Tej Ajay Gandhi
Review_Text: they don't organise things well at times. many problems has arrived in the college atm. College is good for study for both Boys and Girls but the campus is worst beacause of developement this campus is in underdevelopement

Name: Sujith Chennupati
Review_Text: Good Teching Staff and all faculties are dr. tacher are help to build projects and reaserch paper  campus is worst campus in all VIT no anything like as university

Name: KETAV SODHI
Review_Text: hostel are not properly managed by the management authority  they do not provide the much Facilities as compared to the fees In our college they are so many facilities like sports.

Name: ATHARVA VERMA
Review_Text: The mess food was good here they will maintain a diet fruits will also be available We can choose faculty and class timings here The hostels in CB are bad compared to mh hostels

Name: Pote vishal shahaji
Review_Text: There is no proper dress code here it's uneasy The costs of food items available here are expensive compared to outside in canteens and stalls The things I liked is campus , it is lush green campus and have greenery around

Name: Pournami
Review_Text: The hostel facility is also good for living  The placement team is working hard to get the opportunity  The management is very worst at VIT Bhopal

Name: Dhanur Bhardwaj
Review_Text: Boys have to walk 2 km from hostel to academy block daily for classes  They don't allow students to get outside food in the campus  One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Navneeth
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Anu
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des The aspects  of college that should be appreciated is that they give students many chances to improve there academics but there management needed to be improved as many students are facing problems regarding paper work and all.

Name: Mridul jha
Review_Text: Currently i am in cultural club and technical club and doing my best in both of them and about campus life here is very strict rules which you have to follow and after 8 p.m. no one is allowed in the campus all should be in there hostel rooms . Teaching method is world class we have FFCS system in which you have choice to choose your own teacher for a subject from which you want to study. Managment of the college, rules of college.

Name: PIYUSH PRAJAPATI
Review_Text: Attendance system, Timing of college, campus constructed area Hostel rules and code of conduct are very strict. Some of the faculties here are very supportive.

Name: Tarni Jain
Review_Text: The food here is very hygienic and clean. Most of the time the food has a bad taste. There is no proper field to play outdoor games

Name: Aryan Singh
Review_Text: Infrastructure is brilliant here and studies got its value  Brilliant in the Tamil Nadu I can say , regularly there will be events It's bit tricky they don't care about you if u have doubt u have to ask them and teaching wise very good

Name: Vaibhav Sanghani
Review_Text: To be honest I don't think anything I disliked here  Vellor institute infrastructure are osm( larg and beautiful campus) Surrounding Beautiy and greenary in campus

Name: PURNENDU TIWARI
Review_Text: Vit placement is very good and maxximum student place very good package Vit vellor fees structure is very high many student not afford high fees Institute have many branches and specilization

Name: Priyanshu Yadav
Review_Text: many specilization and vellor institute is crowded Good teaching , supportive faculties , happy environment Lot of extra circular to find your passion, lots of competition will be organised

Name: Shubham Gupta
Review_Text: Fun college living experience, infrastructure and other facilities 10/10 at my point of view Maybe hostels need to build more hostels with good interior design The food here is amazing and also sometimes home made like.

Name: B Francis Nitin
Review_Text: The faculties respond to all the doubts and the questions related to any of the course materials.  The campus is big and still under development so that is a plus side of having new things regularly. The campus is huge but there are avoidable things that can be removed to make it a bit easy.

Name: Vasu
Review_Text: Some faculties are rude to the questions asked and students rarely do mention it to the head of faculties.  The hostel food sometimes is not up to the mark. Most faculties are helpful Regarding any project and academic help.

Name: S RArpith
Review_Text: The course material that most faculties provide is good enough for you to study on your own as well. The campus interaction is enough to ensure that you can get help from most the students. The campus is under construction and this obstructs the campus life.

Name: Shubh S
Review_Text: Just some faculties are arrogant enough to score you on their own basis. The co-ed interaction between students is less as their is PDA on even handshakes. Campus is so beautiful and green with full palants

Name: AJEET SINGH
Review_Text: Faculty and quality of study and infrastructure All facilities like library canteen and fully modern lab and class room The campus is too big... You will be tired roaming

Name: PAVURAYALA SAI NITHIN
Review_Text: Exams are tough you need to study hard for grades  The rules of college are very strict... All time be in discipline  huge campus and lovely infrastructure, much facilities and lovely sky

Name: Vinoth Kumar
Review_Text: aesthetic skies and clouds and lovely sunsets along eith the beautiful weather and lovely but random rain  had free gym, paid gym, free chess room inside hostel, multiple hostels, badminton court and in all hostels, big library food was a problem in the start but then people get used to it

Name: Om Ramchandra Jadhav
Review_Text: huge campus had huge distances to walk which made us walk around 12k steps per day it was a little costlier as food was not good everyday, had strict rules against PDA and smoking The campus the campus is so big and faculty are ok

Name: Sudha
Review_Text: The faculty teaching was so bad and the ground One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: Utsav
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: ALBIN T SANOJ
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Infrastructure is world class, the lab equipment or the overall system that they have in place  The greenary and the overall beauty of the campus is really something

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: the academics might be rigorous but are really good the faculty to student ratio is really low The hostel facilities of the older hostels is not that good

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The campus is beautiful and has everything inside There is dominos and a hair salon too here We don't need to go out for every single thing

Name: SANIDHYA GUPTA
Review_Text: We need to get permission for going out everytime  Girls' in time for hostels is 8 pm at night V Mart is closed on Sunday when everyone is free

Name: Ansh Ansh
Review_Text: The best thing about our college is the huge diversity all people from all around the country which makes the campus life fun and increase social interactions. The faculty here are highly educated from the prestigious institutes of the country like IIT's and here all faculty have a doctoral degree in their respective fields. There is a concept of FFCS (Fully Flexible Credit System) here i.e. all students can make their own timetable and choose their faculty according to their relevance, which provides enough free time to explore their passion and to learn new skills.

Name: Garvit Singla
Review_Text: Due to very large diversity, there may be some groups formed of North people and South people or others, which may sometimes feel awkward to interact. As the college is made on the outskirts of Bhopal, there is somehow less connectivity to bhopal, as the uber services do not work here, but we can book cabs and even go by regular buses. Some people may find this odd, but the use of electric kettle and induction is banned in the hostel and may be confiscated if found. So you can't make instant noodles in the hostel.

Name: prashant singh
Review_Text: The college provides the best environment for studies.where there is a big library where we can refer 1000 above books  Provides everything needed for one's personal developments and education.But only useful if you utilise ot They have a great infrastructure in both academic and hostel

Name: Adarsh Kumar Singh
Review_Text: There is a huge gap between girls and boys like that of a school life .But it's fine as long as you obey rules and doesn't do anything weird  Some faculties just reads their ppts without even giving a explanation  Sometimes even friends who are of different sex are made to walk far😂

Name: Akashneel Neogi
Review_Text: The area of college is huge, very open surrounding Faculties are good and interactive with students, tries to clear all doubts Hostels and academic block are made prity good

Name: Mukul Choudhary
Review_Text: Food here is not that good, some times its over cooked, some times its under cooked Stationary and other packaged food are sold at high price  The placement here are likely to be ok, not that good not so bad

Name: Golagani Uday Charan
Review_Text: Supportive faculty members and knowledgeable  Great opportunity for research as labs are very good Great infrastructure and diverse people .

Name: Sanjay vijayan
Review_Text: Vellore is a town not city so nothing to do Language barrier may be faced sometimes.  A lot of students so high competition and overpopulation

Name: Rajashekar Aleti
Review_Text: The curriculum is upto dated and can be compared with top prestigious universities. Great infrastructure, and diverse culture as people from every place are present You will get ample opportunities to prove yourself

Name: Soumil Chaurasia
Review_Text: Too much crowd, sometime feels over competitive. There are good faculties u can find if u want to do some research  The issue of any important documents is convenient and quick

Name: Anshuman Pandey
Review_Text: The hostel is free from ragging, drugs or any other substances. They maintain what they claim, ragging free and drug free campus.  Hostel management is very poor when it comes to room allotment, even the hostel registrations are bad. The course registration is first come first serve and they give you a choice to make ur own timetable and choose ur own faculty. But the website to host this has a very bad design and it can't handle the heavy traffic, affecting course registration

Name: SHRINATH
Review_Text: The university should add a bit more area for extra circulars and sports The diversity of the many students enrolled The friends I made along the way. Good company.

Name: Sashank Singh
Review_Text: Flexibility to choose teachers and courses. Too many people on campus. Places are always crowded. One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: shaik sameer ahamed
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Yokkeshwaran K
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des A group of students having a mentor (teacher) who they can reach out to for anything

Name: Karkulali
Review_Text: Engagement with campus life is good. Hostels and all There is an app in which we have everything we need like when the next class is, etc. Fees is high if you go through viteee exam and fees is low if you go through ap-eamcet

Name: Nitesh Kumar Mishra
Review_Text: Food is sometimes good, sometimes bad. And also the network is slow sometimes  The campus is great with many facilities for most of the commonly played sports. Placement is great when compared to other collages

Name: K Mohammed aasheef
Review_Text: FFCS helps us choose the course and faculty of our choice but can be messed up easily The schedule is hectic and we had to do a minor project along with our regular sem Campus is lush green and there are many places to walk around and explore .

Name: Sravan
Review_Text: PhD teachers are there so explanation skills are awesome  The flexible credit system that is there which provides us the power to choose teachers  Strict rules that may be annoying some times

Name: Fathima
Review_Text: The infrastructure is bit incomplete and the hostels are not in a very good condition  I like the college campus and Greenery  everywhere  Hostels are also good 👍 nice infrastructure

Name: vidhya
Review_Text: The college is little strict and they high fees for any punishment  VIT has good infrastruture and opportunities. It is equipped with best campus and great cultural events like vibrance, technovit etc and hands on experience in areas like ai and robotics  There are various clubs in VIT chennai, which help you to improve social interactions and find time to do other things outside of academics

Name: PRASHANT
Review_Text: Most of the faculty in vit chennai are experienced and have great competence in the subject they teach But during first year they might force you to do a lot of stuff at the same time and the pressure might be a bit more for you The hostel food i not upto the quality and many hostellers have complained so.

Name: Ish Venaik
Review_Text: The gender ratio for girls is less compared to boys Our campus has ffcs which stands for fully flexible credit system through which we can design our own degree  Our campus is completely ragging free and anything of such may lead him to suspension of 1 semester

Name: Manan jadam
Review_Text: The boys to girls ratio is almost 1:1 in our campus Campus is so far from any near town which makes it difficult to reach campus Campus usually starts late for first year students when compared to other vit campuses and to cover this holidays are reduced and the syllabus is rushed in the first yeat

Name: Rinaazunnisa
Review_Text: VIT hosts a diverse student population from all over India and beyond. This brings exposure to different cultures, perspectives, and languages, enriching the campus experience Many faculty members are highly qualified, often with industry experience or significant academic credentials. They focus on practical applications and skill-building, which is appreciated by students Ffcs system: It is the program that is we should select our faculty and slot timings we think it is good but it is very tough

Name: Tanmoy Goswami
Review_Text: Rooms counseling: Rooms are alloted on the based of cgpa ,if our cgpa is low then there is a chance to get non AC block it is too hot here and if we get non AC it is very hard to live here Design your own degree programme helps to choose the career path Course registration like choosimg faculty and courses.

Name: krish
Review_Text: The quality of the infrastructure, including campus amenities and learning facilities is so good.  the placement services and the support provided for career advancement is way poor.  engagement with campus life and the quality of social interactions is poor.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Dealing with faculties will be quite hard.  The Campus is absolutely beautiful ~400 acres of campus size with lush green trees and engaging life of clubs and events happening on daily basis makes your campus life better eventually you'll start loving campus more than your home! Faculty over here in VIT is top notch completed their education from top institutions around the globe and there are many research scholars under them too + the material they provide PPTs and PDFs of modules are decent

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Since it's November while am writing this review placement season is on even during the recession in tech market around the world still placements are happening decently good if you are skilled enough with good cgpa maintained you won't find it tough VIT is known for restrictions which initially make us feel as if we are trapped but later you get used to it freshers are not allowed to go out of campus without proper permission for first 3 months City Vellore is not that great in terms of city life and food but once you start exploring you'll find good options to hangout with friends

Name: Varshini
Review_Text: Hostels are top notch but the food is not that great hostel food is average (again I don't like it but few of my friends are happy with it) One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: SUBHANKAR HALDER
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: Nithya Shree
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Most of teachers are good. They also have 100% doctoral faculty There is no ragging in the hostel even my roommate is my senior

Name: Hitesh Sharma
Review_Text: Very good course structure and facility of FFCS Construction work is still going so a bit problematic  Most of classes are Non AC so harder to attend lectures

Name: Borole Mayur Sandip
Review_Text: Hostels to Academic block distance is approx is 2 km and no shuttle buses for students  Modern infrastructure like lab and research facilities  Innovation in every curriculum, eco friendly campus with amenities like libraries, sport complex and etc

Name: Priyansh Kumar Singh
Review_Text: Phd faculty with strong academic and industrial backgrounds Remote location: located far from major city Bhopal or Indore It take much time to travel from city to college we have travel by bus or cabs

Name: Pranav Sharma
Review_Text: High costs compared to basics : students get scholarships in vit through VITEEE exams, we get category 1,2,3,4,5 in which category 1 students fees is 200000 and category 2 students fees is 300000 and increases by  The level of technology they have inside the campus is really great  The greenery spread across the campus is good sight

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The cultural fest is a must to go event in the world The student strength is too much for an average college The amount of pressure per student is tremeoundous

Name: Kevin Luke Mathew
Review_Text: The rules inside the college regarding the hostel people is too much I like Campus size. its huge 110 acres campus and green over the campus  with proper shelters over footpaths for students to transport from heir hostel blocks to college block There are enough sources for students to do their projects or increase their learning efficiency.

Name: Sanjana Dhanasekar
Review_Text: high on exposure for students great opportunities and lots of placements  Faculty is very bad. even for first year their negligency fears us.  Crowded class rooms and old buildings. Infra for old buildings is very bad

Name: Likith chowdary
Review_Text: The first thing that I liked is the good infrastructure that VIT-AP has provided, good and well ventilated labs and classrooms. A good overall crowd. VIT has students from all corners of India, making it an emersive experience. Friendly people and staff. They help you alot and will keep helping for the next four years of your college.

Name: Prathamshree Kumar
Review_Text: Very rigorous time table. We have so many subjects and so many classes somedays that you feel very tired and fatigue , leaving no time for your extra curricular activities. Language barrier. As I am a north indian , I sometimes find very hard to communicate with security guards and the mess people as they don't understand English and I can't speak Telugu , leaving no common link of communication. Very strict rules and policies. VIT has a lot of rules and regulations which you have to follow or otherwise you will get a big fine that you have to pay no matter what.

Name: Atharv Roshan Shah
Review_Text: student safety is taken seriously at all times sports facilities are fantastic at all times clubs are amazing and cultural events are the best

Name: NEER MALIK
Review_Text: hostel facilities are worse. complaints aren't taken seriously the examination system is ridiculous. 3 times in a sem courses are a bit tough. and classes are hectic

Name: Goutham Krishna
Review_Text: the exposure is really great, people from different part of the country come here to peruse their courses. Mixing with different people gives us exposure to their knowledge and we can share our thoughts with them , gain knowledge etc. Faculties really want the best of students future, they work really hard and provide quality education . Campus is really enjoyable and spending time is a joy here.

Name: Devansh Behl
Review_Text: competition is a bit more here but after all we have to work hard so it's fine over time. The environmental here and the infrastructure that is way too amazing with an acre of more than 200 acres  Library with all kind of Books and the Indian's biggest book is found here. We can study peacefully with AC and borrow books here or download their E-Books. We have an option for both. This is amazing

Name: Nishanth J
Review_Text: The faculty and their interaction. We are given faulty details like their cabin and staff room, with room number and details in their App. So it is easy to find them. And the faculties are soo good. They solve our problems within the day. The washrooms in SJT which is an academic block, was disgusting. But now they have constructed new onces recently. The restrictions girls have here. We are allowed to go out only for 2 hours and on holidays for 4 hours. The security guards are also strict.

Name: Depangi Suresh
Review_Text: All the akkas, the people working in the hostel know only tamil and not hindi. So language is a problem here. It is difficult to speak to them and understand them if we have any work Good Infrastructure, neat class rooms with good fan and lights Restrooms are clean and neat, flushable and cleaning often results neat restrooms

Name: Tridip Lala
Review_Text: FFCS system, which is the system which allow us to select the faculty and slots which allocated for us which will be selected on out convinces Too much crowd, always being in a rush to toilets, lifts and biometric Inside the Campus all the shops are expensive. DC named restaurant which is too costly and they have expired cakes...

Name: TALLAPALLI HEMANTH
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech

Name: Jaivardhan
Review_Text: I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des

Name: Teerath
Review_Text: Academic facilities are really good here. You get plenty of course options to choose with and the faculty is also top notch most of them come from good college like nit or iits Clubs and Societies play a big part in this college you'll see multiple events and parties throughout the year in this college. Infrastructure is new and great nothing like old govt colleges every thing is modern architecture and the campus is lush green

Name: snehanshu chakraborty
Review_Text: Strictness is something you'll struggle with at vit ap in including gaurds, cctv cameras, In and out timings in hostels and restrictions over outings. infrastructure is very nice of this collage.that include varietyn of accomodation sports facility is also provided here both free and paid facilities are there.

Name: Naman B
Review_Text: library is nice with plenty of book to be issued and can take to hostel the campus is very crowded as per its size of campus  north Indian student might have difficulty if their english is not that good

Name: VARRE RAJU
Review_Text: the campus is slightly costly as per the rate of city but outside the campus it is good inly Cultural clubs and social clubs are most interesting to participate and socialize with others  Faculties are helping and if you are good in studies definitely they are going to help you alot.

Name: Mitul
Review_Text: Library is good . There place like gazibo, north square, clock court and gym khana to eat and sit. 75% attendance policy is not good. They consider you on leave only when you are admitted to hospital, otherwise you are marked absent. Exams and quizzes are conducted frequently. So many assignments are given every week.

Name: NEEHARIKA NIROUP GUPTA
Review_Text: 50% marks required to pass the semester. Cleanliness, except few places... Other places are well cleaned and maintained by respective staffs Safe and secure. Guards are everywhere in and around in VIT , so no worries about safety measurement

Name: Diya Raghuvanshi
Review_Text: Ragging free community. Seniors are welcoming junior by conducting various cultural events Crowd. No matter whether it's Sunday or Monday... Student and scholar are everywhere. If it's a exam time, you will see mini T.nagar (Chennai) here. Outing issue. We girls are allowed only for 2 hours outing in weekdays and 4 hours outing in weekend. But for boys, no limiting hours for outing. Their outing starts from morning 7 am to night 9 pm

Name: Malvika Sinha
Review_Text: Not having a good bond between professor and students. They come, teach and leave. That's it It's pleasant with the environment with every step you take Trees and greeneries everywhere you keep your eyes on

Name: moksh doshi
Review_Text: Tidy and good maintained places including roads Too crowded for a place like this college Buildings are getting old , and the renovation works are slow

Name: Parth Jain
Review_Text: As constructions are going everywhere , the place seems polluted The faculty at VIT Bhopal are knowledgeable and dedicated especially in specialized fields like cyber security and AIML. They make an effort to ensure students understand the subjects well. I've formed a strong, close group of friends here, which has made my college life more enjoyable.

Name: Akarsh jain
Review_Text: VIT Bhopal has a good track for placements with several companies visiting the campus. The placement cell actively helps students prepare, offer training and resources.  The college is located a bit far from the main city, which can be inconvenient for students who want to explore or need access to city facilities. While the hostel food is decent, there are times when the quality could be better. It's not uncommon to hear students wishing for more variety of foods.

Name: Khushi Tripathi
Review_Text: The university enforces strict rules regarding hostel timings and attendance, which could be an improvement if attendance wasn't that important. Firstly I like the campus’s architecture and all the hangout spots inside vit Second I like how students from different parts of the world socialise and interact and engage so vibrantly.

Name: Vardaan Narang
Review_Text: Lastly I like the faculties here in vit. I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40 I also feel that since 30000 plus students study here , individuality is less.

Name: Ann maria
Review_Text: Lastly I don’t like the timings of the college. One day it is 8 am and other day it is at 2pm The first thing that impressed me in my college is the campus and its environment. VIT had one of the best campus atmosphere with many really good architecture and vibrant facilities. The second thing is the the amount of clubs and chapters available for students to participate. The college always looks so engaging so that every student can show their own talent and excel in it.

Name: Divyansh Khanna
Review_Text: Lastly the faculties. They the pillars for real. I know no faculty who has been not approachable throughout my college life. Mostly all of the professors hold solid academic credentials which makes the quality of the teaching amazing. The amount of students in the university still scares me , there are 30000 plus students studying in vit vellore alone which I feel will make the hidden talents of many stay hidden. The faculty and student ratio also is bad. Which leads to larger class sizes which again affect the personalised attention to each and every student.

Name: Manideep
Review_Text: Lastly the girls-to-boys ratio, it is roughly 40:60, boys being the highest . This imbalance can be easily noticed while someone enters the college itself. College often host various students clubs like literary , cultural, technology and community services clubs that give students a chance to explore interest outside their curriculum such engagement enhance creative teamwork and leadership  Regular sports tournament festival and social gatherings promotion a community among students breaking their monotony of academic and creating a balanced environment

Name: Sriram
Review_Text: Effective placement have established strong ties industry leader leading to high placement rates and attractive salary packages for students  Limited resources or inadequate academic support can leave students without the guidance they need leading the guidance they need leading to lower academic performance  Rigid course structure can limit students ability to explore their interest or pursue electives which can hinder holistic development and career readiness

Name: DIVYA PRAKASH
Review_Text: Not all college priorities community engagement which can reduce students exposure to real world challenge and limit the development of their social and ethical awareness  The study environment is good and competetive.  The seniors are good and helping in nature

Name: Druva kumar Reddy Muga Venkata
Review_Text: The teaching techniques of the faculties is good The college still has some infrastructural work going on One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: T SRI HARSHA
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Study culture:Every student is studying something and they're keeping themselves busy in studies while also doing other curriculum activities

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Good and friendly seniors:Seniors are mostly very supporting and helpful which is very rare Good batchmates:Most of the batchmates are not self centred but instead they are very helpful Hostle management:Some unnecessary rules are there but the strictness is maintained but there are many unnecessary rules

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Distance between hostel and main college building:The distance between main college building and hostel is very far it is almost 2 km so going to do class and coming back is very tiring and frustrating There are many clubs and chapters in VIT where you will get chance to take part them and also increase your i=network which will definitely help you in future Talking about academics , so you will get lot of chance if you are interested in research ,you will get funds from VIT.

Name: Siddhardh Kattamuri
Review_Text: The best thing is ffcs which stands for fully flexible credit system by which you can create your own time table and also choose faculty under whom you want to complete a specific course. There are many exams happening in VIT so you will get less time to focus on extra things like development , or any field whom you are interested and want to do. There are many restrictions in VIT like you have to come before 7 pm in VIT if you are girl and has to enter before 9 pm if you are a boy.

Name: Yashasvi Verma
Review_Text: Even you can't go to your friends hostel after 9pm The first thing I liked is the syllabus of the course which is easy to study. And the syllabus is very relevant for the future  The second thing is the infrastructure of the college they provide variety of amenities like free wifi they also provide laptop for students via scholarship

Name: BONGI SURYA MANI
Review_Text: The faculty are also very friendly they are expert teachers with good helping mentality  Things I disliked is the hostel food Some of the students doesn't like the hostel food but for me it is ok The second thing is most of the building in the campus are bit older.

Name: Darshan S
Review_Text: Social activities in this campus is below average compared to other campuses campus has lush-green environment and it has very much peaceful and much less disturbance compared to urban areas. campus is good and hostel are too good along with 24/7 security and cold and hot water supply. infrastructure is excellent and faculty are very much experienced as they are IITIAN'S they are calm and supportive. the canteen is very nice and you can enjoy every type of meal and it is pocket friendly.

Name: Swapnil prakash
Review_Text: here you can interact with every people of india as students belong to different cultural background and cities helps you to develop socially. most of the things i liked and are matching my expectations but mess food is somewhat messy. as the campus is in remote area the weather condition is unpredictable which makes you sometimes tired .

Name: Prem
Review_Text: somewhat it the university lacks in sports facilities but it is trying to improve day by day as more students are coming. The class romm they provide a goog space  Nice canteen and foid for students in the college

Name: SRIJANA SINGH
Review_Text: Good faculty o all of them have doctorate and have a great interaction. The distance between hostel and collage is far  Not a good city near from the collage ..

Name: Puvvada Devesh Chowdary
Review_Text: The hostel wifi sime times it goes down and but it come back  Academic block is really good and amazing  Infrastructure is so good and awesome for students

Name: Sanah
Review_Text: Class rooms are really neat and gives good ambience Academic block is really far from hostel  All buildings havent been fully built yet

Name: Rithik Bala
Review_Text: Class rooms are so big,Teachers wont use mic , so we cannot hear everything clearly Veey good and experienced teachers. New types of studying. very modern type

Name: LAHARI VANJA
Review_Text: Classes are so clean and nice. well designed Outings are very less compared to other colleges Vacations are too short to go to hometown

Name: pulkit maheshwari
Review_Text: Classes are very far from hostel.we get tired by reaching there CAMPUS INFRASTRUCTURE IS GOOD  LOCATED IN THE MID OF FIELDS. FACULITIES ARE REALLY GOOD ALL HAVE GAINED THEIR DOCTRATES IN THEIR SUBJECT.

Name: Revanth Srinivasa Reddy
Review_Text: THERE ARE MANY REGIONAL AND NON- REGIONAL CLUBS WHICH HELPS TO INCREASE CONFIDENCE AND DEVELOP SKILLS. OUTINGS ARE LESS AS WE  ONLY HAVE ONE OUTING IN A MONTH. LEAVES / VACATIONS ARE REALLY VERY LESS.

Name: Sukitha Kothuru
Review_Text: The infrastructure and the campus is beautiful and very well maintained  Faculty although some are not that good most of them are really really good Mixed cultures make it easier to have nice exposure

Name: Sri Ragavendra
Review_Text: The price for stuff inside the college are kinda on the expensive side  The wifi system for students are slow and mostly dont even work The mess food is not that good for the price we are paying

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Infrastructure, very highly maintained campus Food in the mess is very good unlike other colleges All good doctorate faculties, they help you well during semester exams

Name: Madhu Kiran
