Review_Text: Network connections are not bad but can be troublesome sometimes Canteen food prices are a bit on the higher sides but atill if you can pay it's good The distance of boys hostel to academic block is too much so one can consider keeping a bicycle

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech

Name: MedaVenkataNagaHemanth Kumar
Review_Text: I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des

Name: Bhavya
Review_Text: Ffcs system is good u can choose techer and timming  You can add or remove course in your branch  No ragging and senior are frank with you

Name: Shubham Sharad Chemate
Review_Text: Poor infrasture building are still in construction  Lrge no. Of assignment is given in clg and work load Less holidays and more no. Of tasks and work

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The best thing about the VIT Bhopal University is the diversity in the courses and structures. A very diverse environment in a field, enables students with different likes and dislikes, to select courses based on their own characteristic features. The diversity also gets reflected when we talk about the students. Students from different part of India with different economical and cultural backgrounds are found under the same shed. The lush green campus ensures the good health of the beings residing in the University.

Name: Tushar kumar Singh
Review_Text: Sometimes the paper checking and grading system is too strict. Good amenities and clean campus . Faculties are good Hostel has everything needed for day to day activities including sports and gym

Name: Aditya sharma
Review_Text: Labs are well equipped with good technology  Lab staff only speak in Tamil and broken english so it is hard to understand  Washroom in hostels are pretty dirty compared to academic blocks

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Have to travel long distances to take different classes university's emphasis on innovation , particularly in engineering curriculum is appreciable. Faculty members are knowledgeable and dedicated , often incorporating real world applications into lessons and offering mentorship outside the classroom.

Name: Ananjay Thakur
Review_Text: campus life is vibrant , with active clubs and frequents events that provide a great balance to academics. The girls-to-boys ratio could be more balanced , it's approximately 1:3 , which is common in many engineering colleges. The labs could be better equipped to support cutting edge research.

Name: RIDDHISH GUPTA
Review_Text: The campus is quite congested and sometimes not a pleasant experience due to noise and blockages because of construction Teachers teaches to the point and it's understandable too Building infrastructure is nice, but no AC, like with the fees this is really a big issue

Name: Madav
Review_Text: Lot of work to do, but it's exciting to do. Hostel management, the management team is not supportive  Student tends to be friendly but they are not

Name: Medha Mansi
Review_Text: Lot of crowd, like literally soo many student Availablity of Amazon & Flipkart or other stuffs Good Faculties and Fine Subjects curriculum

Name: Kavimalar S
Review_Text: Variety of people so that you can find friends similar as your vibe Not much appealing infrastructure wayy too small No such Dedicated football or cricket ground

Name: KANURI TAGORE SAI
Review_Text: Very less campus area , not as mentioned in their official site. The campus is very big, eco-friendly and greate infrastructure  The placements are very good and high chances of getting placed

Name: AJITHA
Review_Text: All the trainings are very clear and motivating Some students bully other students and create problems Only some amount of staffs teaches clearly

Name: Shubham Tiwari
Review_Text: Some of lab componets were not proper and students faced difficulties  Courses that are allocated and provided to the student  Teachers and the faculty who teaches are nice

Name: Rudra Pratap Singh
Review_Text: Good infrastructure even though its populated there is still space Overpopulation and competition is huge and enviable  I really liked how there is discipline factor and almost every person is studying. The boy to girl ratio is 3:1

Name: Venky S Reddy
Review_Text: there are awesome faculty who studied from IITs and NITS and have their Phd's completed The infrastructure is a work in progress and needs time to complete the hostels have lifts which have a problem functioning every work

Name: Rohith Venkata Sai Sarath G
Review_Text: the distance between boys hostel to academic block is about 20 mins i.e 1.5kms and one can only use bicycle or walk. Whereas girls take hardly 10 mins to reach academic block I like the startup pre incubation centre, its very easy to get started with I like the importance given to mental health by the college, we have many counsellors.

Name: Rahul Kumar
Review_Text: The placements are above average compared to rest of the colleges in India. The mess food is average in most of the messes, some are decent. Some faculties are very rude and straight up inhumane, dont take their classes

Name: Inder Kumar
Review_Text: The student welfare department does not support or stand for students welfare, you will be fined for small things One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: Harsh
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: Praneeth
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Faculty members are quite good and well experienced  Campus is quite massive and well equipped.

Name: siddhant gupta
Review_Text: Mess timings are not that ideal and also that food is okayish and menu being almost the same Academic block and hostel are 2kms apart and no transportation facility the expanive campus allows a vibrant environment conductive to learning and socializing.

Name: Jaiguru Narayanasamy
Review_Text: the state-of-the-art lab facilites are a stand out feature of the college the faculty members are highly knowleged and are very approachable the demanding working hours causes fatigue and interupts focus on the academic preperations

Name: Aditya Kommoju
Review_Text: Exams every 30 days causes increased and unecessary stress on the students reletive grading system can sometime feel unfair since it emphasizes the competition among students The camus is good like not perfect but yes it is good .

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The faculty are awesome , the way they teach is perfect , beutiful collage campus. I believe the hostels are well made and are well cleaned twice a day . Electricity cuts are too often but they are for shorter period like 10 minutes

Name: Manas Joshi
Review_Text: Mess food , i will say is not good but not that bad, but everyday you will get daal . No electric things like induction , kettle, iron , heater are not allowed and they are a bit too strict about these things. The course curriculum is rigid yet flexible that is student get to choose what course they have to study at any semester they want, any time of the day, with any teacher of thier choice, there is a total of 162 credits (27 credits per sem max)

Name: Pratik Pawar
Review_Text: Infrastructure is too good, from good hostels, to academic block, playgrounds,pasture grounds,well equipped labs with all modern amenities, in campus eating outlets and shops, there is greenery everywhere, canpus is clean   The campus is everly filled with joy and enthusiasm, There are a lot of activities conducted round the year for student having interest in any field, photography, plantation, speaker talks, there are clubs which promote cultural activities The population of VIT is very high, each year there are around 3000 admissions in CSE (overall from all courses: 30000 students), this increases the competition to a while new level, to get placed to really need to have good skills

Name: Abhay Mahantesh Zalaki
Review_Text: Due to so much population the value of each indiviual during the course is neglected, for them its like if one student goes no matter we have 50 to fill his place, though they treat 9 pointers well  There is a lack of freedom, we have to enter hostels by 9 pm anyhow, and we can be out of campus for  4 hours and 6 hours on working and non working day respectively, it sometimes feels like bondage but again it is for the safrty of students University provides complete freedom for both boys and girls

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: There is no restriction among dress code between students and we have friendly faculty in our university  University provides easiest opportunity to improve our academic performance  University offer students to choose their slots as per their wish it is not possible for all those students who wish to choose morning or evening classes some students feel bad and struggle to travel over distances if they have chosen evening shift

Name: Aryan Sharma
Review_Text: Without id card students are not permitted sometimes students forget their id card in their home so its difficult  Restrictions for vehicle usage in the university  Interaction between student and faculty is good

Name: Divyarth Jain
Review_Text: The campus look very clean , I didn't find any waste ,if someone throw any waste the department members will clean it ime8 There are huge number of opportunities to showcase your talent like dancing, singing etc The university will not allow student to go out within university timings

Name: Shirshendu Ghosh
Review_Text: Will not get mobile signal within university premises  The university wi-fi fecility is very poor , we don't get atleast 5mbps Strictness that hepls in character building.

Name: Sannidhya
Review_Text: FFCS where we can choose subjects and teachers by ourself Hostel Facilities are pretty above avg and the mess food as well extra Charges for everything if u get backlog or extra course u need to pay 6000

Name: Sanjay Chauhan
Review_Text: too much load and very less holiday..and restrictions on going out side u need approval from parents on college portal Academic stress is there no time to work on personal projects VIT has 650 acres of Campus and the campus is covered with 60% greenery

Name: DEBJYOTI MITRA
Review_Text: The infrastructure of VIT is very good the academic blocks the hostels all are well maintained and are in super condition The placement record of VIT is very good as compared to the other private Institute of India VIT has a huge crowd of up to 30000 + students for all the four years of BTech

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Which makes the competition very high inside the institute in terms of Academics and other co curricular activities The end time of hostel is 9:00 p.m. which is comparatively very less I like the infrastructure of my collage.

Name: Saketh
Review_Text: The facilities it provides here is incredible. The faculties are very well experienced. There is no campus like ,very strict inside the campus.

Name: Anand Chaturvedi
Review_Text: Hostelers have in time and out time to go outside. The campus is very crowded, especially during fests. Good opportunity you will get the good opportunity for your future . Tecahers are very supportive and cooperative they will help every time whenever we need and campus is green lush good environment in campus you will make new firends

Name: Colin K Thomas
Review_Text: Chance to grow,represnt your slef in various field  Your communication will imporved and your life style  Hight fees for middle class and we can say little but expensive

Name: Lucky Samant
Review_Text: It is full time program so you have to leave your home  Some times you feel too much pressure and anxiety  One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Nndhaparvathi K
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Time table, we can choose our teacher and slots according to our convenience

Name: Kolli Lakshmi
Review_Text: Classrooms are well equipped with projectors Pleasent nature with full of different plants Traveling, it takes a lot of time to travel from home to college

Name: Tushar Dagar
Review_Text: Lifts are less so we have to claim 5 floors in emergency  There is no certain place to sit after classes I like the infrastructure of college in vit

Name: Aniruthan
Review_Text: I like the faculties behaviour and their way of teaching  I like the environment of class rooms in college  I have to pay 6000 for each arrear which too high

Name: Krishna agarwal
Review_Text: The foods provided inside college are not good North indians are too much priority inside campus  Huge campus with great infrastructure and facilities

Name: ALOK SINGH
Review_Text: Over crowded and domination of north indians The enormous campus and the infrastructures The attendance system and the course registration methods

Name: Yashwant Parihar
Review_Text: Extracurricular activities that provides on-duty attendance which made students to focus more on extracurricular activities  Sometimes the securities can be rough and rude Sometimes day scholars are not provided with the resources they need

Name: Kartik Navnath Narare
Review_Text: Vit separates day scholars and hostlers on festival times The infrastructure, especially well-equipped labs or libraries that supported learning. A vibrant campus life with clubs and events, which encouraged social interaction and skill development

Name: Maddireddy Sasi Preetham Reddy
Review_Text: The faculty's expertise stood out, with some professors offerings mentorship beyond teaching Clubs lke dance singing etc and opportunities are given to everyone  All local festivals is been celebrated by the college

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: And all the faculties are very good and excellent  Too much attention to people from north Indian is unceasing  Maintain 75 percent of attendance is not good

Name: Reddy Charan kumar
Review_Text: Too much donations are been asked to be given by students  I like the infrastructure in our campus. It's very peaceful  I like the atmosphere and seating area in our campus because it's too spacious

Name: Aribah Armin
Review_Text: There are some garden areas in our campus filled with trees those are very peaceful  Good Infrastructure and clean environment The ffcs system which vit provide is very effective…we can choose the class timings

Name: Rudra Shrivastava
Review_Text: Every thing is pretty systematic,there wont be any lag in exams or publication of results  Vit have a security system called “red tag” / the discipline committe Too Overcrowded hostels ,couldn’t even stay there peacefully

Name: Arjun I
Review_Text: Strict rules and they have set an outing timings for hostelers The environment is a bit cold in winters and hot in rest, there is no greenery in the campus. We do have walkways for the pedestrians and the cyclists can move in the road coz the university is a green campus and no vehicles are allowed inside university except for the construction workers, goods vehicles, college buses, higher authority.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: There will be a less hostels and low infrastructure compared to other colleges but it's still a developing university where construction will be done all time. There will be no greens like trees compared to other universities  The distance between boys hostel and academic block and food courts isnapmost 2km and almost every boy walks 8km a day

Name: Sujal Buniya
Review_Text: There will be a dirty lake infront of academic block 1 and near all the food courts. The education system of VIT is best . Faculty are best and the education policy are best Vit has always ranked among the top private engineering colleges in india and its a best place to study in.

Name: Jay Vardhan Singh
Review_Text: Computer science and engineering is the best of vit The college is bit strict to its rule and regulation. There are very less holidays given in VIT

Name: Sreeparvathi
Review_Text: There are less faculty member for courses. One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Good faculty to approach for any queries  Good atmosphere to study like libraries for students

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Good placements and events during any festivals  For dayscholars travelling for 3hours daily During summer it's very hot and unable to go to classes

Name: Neha Khadeeja
Review_Text: No ac classes which will show more impact during summer Full flexd credit system is available in our college  There is no ragging in the campus or any fight

Name: Aadesh Kumar
Review_Text: There may be long distance for each class The college campus life is decent as it consists of a lot of events, fun clubs in which students can take part. The faculties in the college are literally knowledgeable, clarifies every doubt. Not only theoretical.

Name: Dishant Tekrawala
Review_Text: The placement year students are banned from almost every event, recently we couldn't join the garba event. the people in vit are very good and good communicators staffs are friendly too and be available in all times

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: college is ecofriendly and can see all the beautiful sunsets and skies the campus is bit lengthy and have walk very much the lifts are insufficient and have to walks on steps to many floors

Name: Kaushiki Ghosh
Review_Text: there is no break time for all the people in the university ata time expect lunchtime Nice campus area and their is  very greenery provided in the campus. The flexible credit system of my college is very good.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: There are so many sports facilities available in the campus. There are girls to boys ratio is around 8:1 Faculties are decent and we have a lot of oppurinuties

Name: Vivek Mishra
Review_Text: College is crowded as hell fees is high for cat 4 and cat 5 The gender ratio here is good.  .its like 70 students 70 students in a class out of which 40 will be boys

Name: T Aswin kumar
Review_Text: And remaining 30 will be girls the gender ratio is good The crowd in vit is so much so it is a bit irritating We have to wait for lift for like 10 mins

Name: Katherapalli hari Prasad reddy
Review_Text: And eee teachers are nit teaching properly Teachers are well qualified and competent. Placements are good, all kinds of companies visit.

Name: Pindiboyina Geetha Shankar
Review_Text: The campus is big and beautiful , with plenty of students and chances of social interactions. Few students might find the rules a little strict and binding. The campus is located in a town, so there isn't much to do around.

Name: shivansh singhal
Review_Text: Located in south, some North students can find it hard to adapt. The campus is very scenic and full of greenary. The seniors are very helpful and no ragging takes place.

Name: Rohit Dreamer
Review_Text: The professors are well versed in their domains Everything is very far from the boys hostel  There is a curfew after 9 pm so the boys can not leave the hostel block

Name: Tangella Naga Charan
Review_Text: The mess food is decent but needs a little time to get used to The exposure and diversity that is available  The set of opportunities is very vast ..

Name: Raamesh
Review_Text: It’s a very technical and culturally appreciative college The discrimination between boys snd girl The stupid idea of red tag Annas aka pda gaurds

Name: Phanishwar J
Review_Text: They give absolutely zero holidays and college is there on Saturday  One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: Shanmukha
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: Aashish Moond
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Really good and engaging fests with a huge exposure and industry relevance.  Great campus, with lot of campus facilities and services important for the stay. Well equipped labs and academic buildings, great infrastucture and greenery along with close proximity to railway station.

Name: Anish Kumar Jaiswal
Review_Text: Fully flexible timetable that can be selected by students based on their preference on timings and number of credits. Allows us to engage in other campus activities. Strictness in terms of campus in timings   interaction with opposite gender isn't flexible.

Name: Snehil Srijan
Review_Text: Some professors are not upto the level and experience. Good course outcomes present for each and every course Faculties are supportive and encourage research papers and projects under their guidance

Name: Vidhi Jain
Review_Text: great culture of clubs and chapters which are extremely essential  excessive crowd which makes it really annoying  extremely strict rules and regulations by management

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: pda guards that pester you for the smallest of opposite gender touch  Campus is good, Very big and nothing to complain about Faculty is really good if you choose them wisely which you can do through ffcs system that the college provides

Name: Suryansh Jeet Srivastava
Review_Text: The college has centralized placements which means all major companies visit here and you get enough opportunities  Sometimes the administration is strict and is ignorant of students needs A lot of restrictions, we arent allowed to go out without taking the permission of a lot of people

Name: Ayush Arora
Review_Text: We are not allowed to roam in the campus after 6 pm which is really annoying  Library is big and also infrastructure also Boys to girls ratio is also decent not great

Name: Puneet Chandna
Review_Text: Online application that helps to track everything  The strength is very high making difficult for placements Rules are quite strict not allowing to go out of hostel after 8 pm

Name: Kishore
Review_Text: Hostels are little bit more congested and sophisticated  Fully flexible course registration for our semester  Best safety in the hostel for both boys and girls

Name: K KRISHNA CHAITANYA
Review_Text: Good behaviour of faculty and workers around us Quick exam (with in one month exam)cat1,cat2 Intime of girls and boys are not same...

Name: ANIRUDH GUPTA
Review_Text: Infrastructure is good. Good for sportss Have flexible timetable. Values time for everyone Takes good care of students. Hospitable  and gives freedom

Name: Hevindh Surya
Review_Text: Faculty is not always that good as expected for such a good college Overpriced food in canteen and unhygenic at times  Mess food is messed up. It gives you food poisioning

Name: Aryan Singh Bisht
Review_Text: The thing I like is there arent many distractive elements in the uni itself and some of the faculty are actually helpful in extracurricular activities aswell. There are events every other week and attending them reduces stress a lot. There isn't any ragging aswell. There are many people from different cultures and the college respects and celebrates every single one of them.

Name: Tirtha Nandy
Review_Text: The architecture could use some work. Whenever there is a slight rain, some of the classrooms get water in them. There isnt any planning on the management part, whenever a new batch of students come in, entirety of the college feels packed I like the diversity that i feel here.You can meet student from various background and culture

Name: Madhunikha
Review_Text: Its location is in central state of our nation so you have lots of neighbouring state to visit and enjoy the most there is greenry around the campus far from tense city like that you will love sports facility in vit bhopal is not up to marks as compre to number of students studing here.

Name: Gayathri Sunil
Review_Text: It is very far away from a major city so transportation is very lengthy and tiring Its whether is very random and unpredictable and you'll never know what will happen Very nice natural surroundings like greenry.

Name: Stuti
Review_Text: Quality of infrastructure and learning facilities very nice views of skies and quality of architecture location of campus is very remote and cut off

Name: Tarun Bharadwaj Annepu
Review_Text: management is quite bad and not up to mark Examination system of the college is very bad The quality of the infrastructure including lab buildings

Name: PRAVEEN RAJ K
Review_Text: The internships provided by the college. The experiential learning provided by the college. The location of the university far from the Bhopal city

Name: Kanakamedala Kankshith
Review_Text: Some of the faculty and their way of teaching The semester division and examination system of college One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Narendra Varma K
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Badana Vasist Hari Hara Naidu
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des They offer us flexible slot choosing. You can choose your own class timings

Name: Shibam Pobi
Review_Text: They have credit systems where each course has a credits and are to completed at the end of the course  Have really good labs required for all courses with all facilities and equipments Have strict dress code for girls. Can’t wear sleeveless and dresses above your ankles

Name: MEDA SAI THARUN
Review_Text: You gotta walk a lot in the campus from hostel to other buildings  The moot court society and the placement cell has seen an improvement from when I joined. There are better placement opportunities and a lot of moot courts that encourage us to participate. The debate society is also very active. The college has a good infrastructure. All law classrooms are air conditioned. All basic amenities are also available within the campus like shops, salons, etc.

Name: LINGA MOORTHY V
Review_Text: The boys to girls ratio is pretty good with most classes including my batch seeing more girl students than boy students. I see this as a positive aspect of the college. Engagement in college life and fests could be better. Engineering students have a much better social life and more activities. However comparatively fests and college social life could be better. There exists very good and approachable faculties but at the same time there comes up a shortage of faculties which is often filled up by research scholars who are not well versed with the subjects and creates a lack in the teaching quality.

Name: Jaganathan S
Review_Text: Although the moot court society and debate system is active. There is no push or support by the faculties to participate in the same. There is no encouragement to do the same. The college campus placement offers are very good  The college campus construction and architecture are good

Name: Varadharaj S
Review_Text: The college style of teaching is very good  The college fees for students are too high  The college computer system are too slow.

Name: Varadharaj S
Review_Text: The college placement are not much more like other the campus is huge and green and beautiful  the opportunities are NUMEROUS and you can explore tons of options

Name: Kaviya venugopal
Review_Text: really helps you work on your field, many clubs that add color through culture and fests mess food is not the best altho edible, options are there the favulty is not very good, especially for freshers

Name: ManojKumar
Review_Text: air conditioned classes not available, could use that The campus is large, green and beautiful, it has many garden areas, playgrounds, all sport facilities, a lot of trees, etc.  The college has very strict rules and regulations for students, especially girls, which make it safe and reliable for all students.

Name: Dharmaseelan M
Review_Text: The cources and curriculum is distributed in such a way, that it covers every necessary subject thoroughly and follow step by step learning.  Too hectic schedule for hoatel students, especially sometimes classes end at 7.30 at night The campus is diverse; it has people from all across India. People here are honestly humble, and i did not see any sort of ragging around the campus, so i can say that it is well behaved and sort of mannered college.

Name: Aranganathan
Review_Text: The campus is like way massive in terms of area. It has different blocks( Academic Block, Architecture Block, and Lab Complex, along with Multi Purpose Hall). The college is equipped with enormous amount of expensive equipment in Labs, which most of the college lacks. Being a massive campus, there are many parts of the college which are still under construction for a long time now.

Name: Rakesh D
Review_Text: Also the college lacks sports tournaments to larger levels, like mostly one cannot participate in college-college tournaments of other states big colleges in sports. the college is situated in very outskirts of the Bhopal, irony is it is names as VIT Bhopal, but it isn't any close to bBhopal (Bhopal is around 60-70kms away) Versatility , networking opportunity, many clubs are available

Name: YARAMATI PAVAN SAI
Review_Text: A lot of trees are there in the campus ,the campus is beautiful  The campus is well equipped and satisfies most of the students needs The distance between hostel and school buildings are too much(3km)

Name: KARTHIK N
Review_Text: The class rooms are not very ventilated. The rules implicated are extremely strict. Academics, campus life , infrastructure etc

Name: BALAJI R
Review_Text: Campus environment , companies visiting the campus  range from mass recruiting to high paying jobs .  Modern class rooms, cleaning , research labs and ample extracurricular activities FFCS freely flexible credit system choosing course and facultiez

Name: Madhan S
Review_Text: Student to faculty ratio and high costs of over crowding in some cases Gender ratios is skewed with fewer girls compared to boys.  I choose this college because of its strong engineering program particularly in computer science and information technology which aligns with my career specifications in tech

Name: KUMARAN R
Review_Text: I was drawn to the collaborative atmosphere and the variety of student organizations where I could g egg involved and develop outside the classroom’ The college’s reputation for producing successful graduates in my field was the main factor for my college selection One challenge I faced was that some of the administrative processes, like course registration was bit complex

Name: Sitrarasan S
Review_Text: The course registration system could be more streamlined. Thiugh flexible, it is sometimes difficult to plan the schedule The workload was intense some times and sometimes difficult to handle the pressure The course syllabus and exam schedules, project works and facilities regarding the same, punctuality

Name: NAVEEN KUMAR M
Review_Text: College fests included both cultural fest and tech fests environment of the college and discipline there's nothing such thing which i dislike about the college

Name: Karthikeyan M
Review_Text: coming to deadlines its a little hectic for students content they expect to write for the exams is way too much One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: SANTHOSH KUMAR V
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: SELVANATHAN PD
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Teaching are good,some teachers teaches very well compared to other

Name: Tarun
Review_Text: You can enjoy the club events conducted by various clubs for every event but you need to register for it You can pass time by sitting in garden with your friends It is far from the bhopal nearly 60kms even you have some place nearby

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Campus and hostel are to long you need to walk nearly 1.5kms, if you have cycle it's okay If you are a sportsmen it's hard to okay games becoz of the crowd the teacher is friendly the lab are fabulous the hostel are neet and clean

Name: VARAD BAGUL
Review_Text: the college many food court like gymkhanna,dominoisand many other the college campus is small as compared to other vit campus boys and girls are not allowed for any type of hugging and holding hands

Name: Siddharth Kalla
Review_Text: outside food is not allowed inside the college Wonderful research opportunities for all students interested. Thriving campus life and college culture when it comes to clubs and chapters.

Name: R Preethi
Review_Text: Streamlined and systematic approach to academics. Slight language barrier for Non-Tamil-Speaking students. College outing procedure is very safe but arguably can be little strict for girls.

Name: Prakhar Kumar Singh
Review_Text: FFCS is difficult due to net issues, very tough to crack. The Academic And professors are all PHD holders and they are very good at teaching and they introduce a ffcs system which is fully flexible credit system They have a great club culture having 50 clubs in a college and managing them fluently

Name: Abhi
Review_Text: The Lab Complex and architectural buildings are well built in thier accordance Walking Distance is comparetively larger Campus life here is awesome you get people from each and evry state with vibrant and different culture

Name: SAI JITENDRA T
Review_Text: Boys and girls ratio here is 3girls and 10 boys(10:3) The placments here are literally good with almost 95% placment rate. The hostel is too far away from college its like 2km

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: University Infrastructure is not good , its still under construction  The college is pretty good the good thing is we can choose faculty of our choice. we can have a lot of freedom in the campus.

Name: Soumyodyuti Ray
Review_Text: there will be many evens going on in the campus so everyone can enjoy their college life. there is no proper seating arrangement for the students in the leisure time. many clubs are present in the university but there are no practice areas for students. we don't even have a room for dance practice.

Name: Pabolu Karunya
Review_Text: the infrastructure looks old and there is no ac in the campus expect labs and library we cant find ac anywhere  Facilities available : Wacom tablets, Audio suite, Industry standard pcs, AC classrooms, Adobe CC access VIT Vellore Campus : University life, sports, events, clubs and chapters

Name: Swayam Mukherjee
Review_Text: Hostel life : Gym, ground, AC rooms, Greenery Some faculties are new and lack industry knowledge Very strict time table, although it is being changed. This course was a 3 year course which is being converted into a 4 year course now.

Name: Nishita Gupta
Review_Text: Campus restrictions such as hostel in timings, red tag security guards everywhere I liked the interactions with my batchmates and my teachers  All were very helpful and coordinating and celebrating

Name: Aryan Gajjar
Review_Text: Faculty were also good , they try to make things clear  Studying 📚 was hard because of construction and all Low level system design wasn’t being taught

Name: Utkarsh Vats
Review_Text: VIT Bhopal has a good placement record, with top companies like Microsoft, Amazon, and TCS visiting the campus. In VIT Bhopal, academics are prioritized and faculty is nice. VIT Bhopal has huge and lush green campus.  Hostels are very good which provides gym, AC/NAC rooms, single or sharing room based on one's own preference, sports area, clean washrooms, room cleaning services, laundry services, courier services and supermarket. Academic block and hostels of VIT Bhopal is equipped with Wi-Fi enabled and each student can connect any two devices at a time. Hostel consist of Anti-Ragging policy where no seniors or batchmates are allowed to do ragging of anyone.

Name: Biswajit Ghosh
Review_Text: Even after having such a huge campus, VIT needs to be improved by expanding the library and adding air conditioning to labs and library.  Though supermarket is available all the time but products are very expensive here that is almost double the prices of the product. In VIT Bhopal hostel, you dont get to choose your roommate as they themselves allot it to you. sometimes its disturbing when roommates don't sleep early and make noises whole night.

Name: musab
Review_Text: It is a moderately big college and has a very green and well maintained environment  There are new buildings being made and the girls to boys ratio is not very gud The faculty is nice not all the faculty but few are very good at teaching

Name: Balamurugan
Review_Text: There are teachers who just hold grudges  There aren't enough lifts to travel up and down the floors during rush hours The hostels also have problems like lift,ac...

Name: parth pareek
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech

Name: Prasanna
Review_Text: I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des

Name: Swarnim Jaiswal
Review_Text: It is one best for  placement and internships opportunity in ap . We have good infrastructure. We have well developed technology in our labs and classes. We have skilled faculty. Our teaching method is through projector's.

Name: KAUSHAL CHANDOLA
Review_Text: We have to pay too much money on backlog exams . We had less social communication with outside people. We have high range of challengeing in our jobs. because here there is a lot of people.

Name: subhadeep Sarkar
Review_Text: There are many events conducted frequently. Such events are made mostly by students in Clubs Infrastructure quality is very good. And the campus area is huge as well.

Name: Mehul
Review_Text: They need to manage the hostels well. They are unable to controll the limit of hostellers evey year. Which makes the hostels conjusted. They also need to learn to manage the Mess in the hostels, might need to improve quality too. College infrastructure and envinorment and faculty

Name: Arshen L D
Review_Text: Sorroundings management hostel food and other stuff And events clubs and chapters of college  Wardens behaviour and they won't takecare of students

Name: Aditya
Review_Text: No interaction with seniors we don't get any idea We don't get sufficient information about anything in college Infrastructure is the best over here , feels like city.

Name: Mahendra Kumar Gupta Potti
Review_Text: Hostels are well maintained, mainly the bathrooms Most of the professors are well qualified  Over crowdy everywhere around the college

Name: Rohit Singh Pundhir
Review_Text: Very strict rules , and many times the security people disrespect us Compartively less events compared to others The faculty are very best in vit ap University compared to ther this is the best thing I liked in vit ap University

Name: Prashant Singh
Review_Text: The events held in vit ap University were occured frequently to enjoy in the college. The projects are there from 2nd year itself to get more knowledge  The vit ap University is very strict compared to other colleges

Name: Sahid Ahmed
Review_Text: Academics is quite impressive and very well structured. There are many events happening every week around the campus and boys to girls ratio is around 6:1 approx which not that bad VIT also focuses and encourages students to write research papers and do research work and hence this college is very famous in research field.

Name: Vishnu Vardhan P
Review_Text: The hostel rules are very strict, you cant even go out of campus in your 1st semester. 2nd semester onwards you are only allowed to leave the campus once a week and that too requires series of permissions from your protor and the hostel wardens. The attendance system is also very strict, if your attendance false short even like 70 percent, you won't be able to give exams. Plus debar exemptions are given very rarely if your case is very serious

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Classrooms, Campus life, Hostel Food, Labs(especially computer labs) PDA guards are everywhere, normally it doesn't affect me but sometimes they won't even let you have a normal conversation  We have good infrastructure and good greenary garden every where.

Name: Likhitha
Review_Text: We have no ragging here .There high security for girls. Professors are friendly with lectures and support for their career opportunities. We have less space in some labs and calsses

Name: Murari
Review_Text: We have to pay 5k for backlog .which this is too expensive  Here social interaction with northside people is really bad The culture difference from a metro city as it is located in a  outskirts of Bhopal So It is quite from the noises of the city

Name: Saniya ahmas
Review_Text: The campus is a lush green campus   with lots of trees and gardens and good infastructuret There are lots good building with proper dedicated lab complex  The tight schedule of classes  and lots of assignments

Name: Kothagundla Reethinath
Review_Text: There is lots of hostel rules to follow and if unobyed you will be fined a a  good amount The campus big which makes it time taking to go from hostel to classes The campus is very vast and there is no shortage of any supplies inside the campus.

Name: Tanvi Khokhar
Review_Text: There are a lot of different types of dishes available to buy inside which promotes diversity as the dishes are from all over India. The scenery and views from hostels are very beautiful and the hostel commodities themselves are very good. The mess food is a little on the bad side but sufficient food is provided.

Name: Palak Ramani
Review_Text: The inhouse cooking rules are very bad as you cannot cook food inside your room. The crowd in vit is very high and it is like a city in its own One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Arjun Sudheer
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Varun Mehra
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Research and extra curricular activities are very well supported

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The campus is well maintained and has a good infrastructure  The teachers are knowledgeable and approachable  One reviewer said that this college was Irresponsibile in certain things

Name: Vedant  Deshmukh
Review_Text: One reviewer said that the college had 100% placement record but didn't turn up for interviews Poor maintenance and operation of vit can reverse the results  we have good opportunities in internship and placements in last two years. Faculty members support us for our career development.

Name: Renish Aryan
Review_Text: we have good infrastructure and good atmosphere here. Teachers should teach through projectors and friendly with us. we have no ragging here. There is equal ratio in boys and girls. There is high security for girls. we have limited space in some of labs and classes. we have less individual attetion with lecturers.

Name: Gayathri
Review_Text: professors doesn't giving clarity in high paying jobs and intership programs. some professors have lack of skills in teaching methods. Faculties are really good and help in solving doubts

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: FFCS in used in our college for the personalised time table  Placements are really good for CSE students  College is situated around 70 far from city

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: There is so much crowd in the campus due to heavy student intake Extra activities are not up to the mark compare to other college  I liked mostly the infrastructure of college

Name: Aditya Shrivastav
Review_Text: I liked mostly the interaction of professors I liked mostly girls in the college thier tradition I disliked about cleaningness of college

Name: Adish Ram
Review_Text: I disliked the arrear amount of 6000 for each sub I disliked college timings from 9-6pm over time Infrastructure is very good.you can make different friends .

Name: Jeevan Alex
Review_Text: faculties are good but some fculties are little strict. The quality of the infrastructure was good and the boy and girl ratio is like 4:3 fees stucture is very high.They ask for so much fees.

Name: Priyan J
Review_Text: Freedom is not there.you have to be inside your hostels after 8 30 pm The hostels are under construction.now some students are living in college campus  We have same equal ratio in boys and girls. Their is no ragging at college.Their is High security for girl's.

Name: TAMOGHNA KABI
Review_Text: We have beautiful Greenery gardens and infrastructure is good. Here culture festivals are amazing. Lecturers are friendly with students.They give lot of support for career development.we have 80% of placements in our college and have many internship opportunities for students. We have limited interraction with professors at individual attention

Name: Utkarsh Chauhan
Review_Text: Professors don't support for high demanding jobs opportunities  We have limited space in some labs and classes  the way of teaching by the professors and good quality of education

Name: LAKSHYA GOEL
Review_Text: the cumpus area is very clean and good and peaceful environment Avalability of mentors for a group students faraway from the city and transport facilities outside the campus are very poor

Name: Evanjin vetha raja
Review_Text: rapid examination and no proper time for the students to study high backlog fee for the students nearly 6k per exam which is not good The infrastructure of the college is very good ,the maintanence of the collge is very good .

Name: Kattamuri Ashmit
Review_Text: widerange of courses are available including law courses Most of the facaluty are from other states where native students can learn other languages campus is faraway from the city so students have travel a lot to get essentials and in college the expenses are very high

Name: Arisha
Review_Text: the security is very strict one has to take permission for every thing  some faculty just reads the pds and there are some low grade professors  Campus life is good if you maintain a good friendship inside the campus.There are lot of fun activities and spaces for relaxing and spent time with your friends inside the campus.This is the main thing i liked about this campus.

Name: Saketh
Review_Text: The second reason is the faculties. As most of the faaculties are friendly it is very easy to clear the academic without any tension. The faculties will provide important topics and area where the questions are coming which make us easy to score. Campus sports facilities are very good for people who love games and sports. They have a huge ground for the cricket as well as the football. Seperate area for the batminton,volleyball,carroms,rockclimbing etc The one thing that i dislike about this college is, we have to take permission from our mentor to go weekend outing and general outing. It is mandatory to see the mentor before taking  a leave or any other outpass.

Name: Saketh
Review_Text: The campus is surrounded by securities everywhere like we were in the jail, and it is very annoying to get noticed at everytime anywhere in the campus. The college fees and fines are very high. If you got a backlog then for rewriting the exam you have to pay a fee of 6000 rupees also this can be done only in vaccation time so you have to pay extra for the hostel for the stay like 15000. The clubs here are good indeed the extracurricular activities i like the most bcz they provide us od to skip the classes and enjoy events

Name: Harini
Review_Text: The placement is kinda good if u maintained the gpa like the average package is about 8 LPA for CSE student   The vibrance event which held once in a year is superb  The infrastructure of the classroom and the faculty sometimes

Name: Mothish
Review_Text: The HOD and staff members in the upper department including Dean is not much into students problem they don't care Most like to face the difference between tamils and north indians One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Sujal g
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Sayan Mitra
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.

Name: Priyanka
Review_Text: The staff at VIT is cooperative and helping in daily doubts.The labs are well maintained with latest technologies and versions.VIT also provides student license to important softwares which are quite costly Hostel Life is great at VIT.The crowd here is well mannered,friendly and well educated which helps in increasing moral values.  Freshers at VIT are restricted from going out of campus for the first sem.

Name: Abhinav CN
Review_Text: Student count at VIT is more than expected which results in unnecessary competition in every sector. The first year students at VIT are not allowed to take part in the events,clubs and chapters since the beginning and have to wait for the first sem to get over.This restricts us from achieving our goal and turns out to be a setback for some months. The campus is very nice and the study vibes hit the best

Name: Sayantika Laskar
Review_Text: Faculty and support staff are very well behaved and take care of all our needs. The use of technology for smooth operation in college is the reason it's a very distinctive college. Transport facilities aren't that good, and we need to walk a lot.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Mess food is under the quality and sometimes I skip meals to avoid the bad taste of food.  The language barriers cause a lot of discrimination in daily life. Non- Tamilians aren't respected the way Tamil residents are.  Here infrastructure is great as a large campus out there

Name: samriddhi khastagir
Review_Text: Many clubs and vast diversity and engagement  Healthy relationship between professiors and students Strict attendance policy and not even allows for exams

Name: Abhiram
Review_Text: Introverts are hard to survive here mainly Toxic relationship between male and female Vit campus is good. It's huge. Greeneries are there.

Name: Diya goswami
Review_Text: The hostel and mess facilities are also good. The faculties are decent enough. I got my physics and thermodynamics faculty very good. Others were good enough. The college is quite far from the hostel.

Name: vinit kumar
Review_Text: The rules are very strict. They will not let you go even outside of the college. Fruit shops, and groceries are outside the campus. So if you want that you need to take permission for that. The teachers and lectures here are highly qualified

Name: Ayush Kumar
Review_Text: We can select the teachers we want and the timetable favouring us Extracurricular activities,events, diverse student population  The college feels like it is over crowded

Name: Sancharini Chakraborty
Review_Text: It's my personal opinion it seems as though the college officials favour Tamil speaking students  The faculty is very good and very supportive  Infrastructure is good and provide every facility within the campus

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Opportunity given by college is very nice and is best for enhance skill the culture in vit is quite open minded you can find people from various backgrounds  number of clubs present in vit, there is a club for every interest in here

Name: Abhishek Singh Rathore
Review_Text: the main cultural event riviera which happens some time around february  the academic pressure to be relevant and need to be 9 pointer the crowd vit is really really crowded you can feel overwhelmed at times

Name: NITHIN
Review_Text: the fees is too high for 5th category ofc  Academic as well as cultural events held  People from all over the country n good groups

Name: Anirudh
Review_Text: Good teaching and academics also buildings  None as such but many exams n assignments The gender ratio is 1:1 in this campus that is one of the things I liked in my campus

Name: Saumya Agarwal
Review_Text: The campus has great infrastructure and all facilities are available here. We get very good placement opportunities here so that is also a great thing about this college The campus is very crowded the total strength is around 30000.so you will feel it very crowded

Name: Aarav Chatley
Review_Text: Due to huge strength in this campus there is a lot of competition in terms of placement you have to be on top get placed  Here pda guards will which is not a good thing we see in colleges  Firstly I liked the social environment of college the friendly nature of other students and Here students came from different part of world also.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The campus is not very large but it is good and Specially our campus is ragging free campus there is not a single case of ragging is here. And the ratio between Girls and Boys is good there are nearly equal number of girls and boys and the curriculum of college is also adjusted according to future requirements The mess food ohh it is disgusting, they should really improve the taste and quality of food.

Name: Joshua Banchamin
Review_Text: The faculty is also not friendly they sometimes release their frustation of students I don't know why but it is true. Currently a technical fest is going on named TechnoVIT and the fest in VIT is kind of useless I don't able to understand what is he point of it. One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Aaron David Don
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des vit collage has nice infrastructure and good environment

Name: Lavisha
Review_Text: there will be more clubs to improve your social skills vit conduct both technical and non technical  events  the attendance policy is strictly maintained

Name: Maadul Ram
Review_Text: the collage is far away from the nearest  city  The flexibility to choose our own timetable helping us flexible to choose our best timetablle and teachers  the cultural fests and technicals fests which is fun loaded.

Name: Drona Srivastava
Review_Text: the infrastructure and all the sports facilities available the campus is too crowded, there is too much crowd whereever we go  some labs are bad and and some techers are bad

Name: ANKUSH KUMAR JAISWAL
Review_Text: the rules and regulations are strict and intime and all In my university they do balance the ratio perfectly which promotes equality in opportunities and growth in their own career They do have remarkable placements many multinational companies do visit and select students from our universities. I do know some of my seniors getting placed in top companies

Name: Toshan Jagani
Review_Text: The vibrant campus life it’s awesome a beautiful experience . I won’t regret about my decision by choosing vit Sometimes the high student population disturbs , lack of more lifts in the case of classrooms on upper floors Need to focus more on technologies but it’s good though .

Name: Vishwaraj Singh Shekhawat
Review_Text: The administrative process are bit slow such as registering course choosing hostel rooms , such things The campus is really good. The canteen food is also good. The message food is really not upto the mark.

Name: SIDDHARTH YADAV
Review_Text: Interaction  with  other  state peoples.  Good Infrastructure with big campus of 200 acres Too high fees structure, Its affordable if ur in catogery in 1 or 2

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Good skill enough to get good placement in vit Plethora of clubs and chapters and festivals like Riviera (cultural fest) and Gravitas (technical fest) Excellent placement record and companies like Amazon, Microsoft, TCS and many others recruit from the campus

Name: Shashwat Awasthi
Review_Text: Fully Flexible Credit System and research opportunities Campus rules and restrictive curfew timings for hostellers The Girl-to-Boys Ratio is skewed with more boys then girls on campus. A common estimate is around 70:30

Name: Shivom Shrivastava
Review_Text: Placement opportunities are more favourable for CS/IT students than for core engineering branches The Campus is so great and the blocks are so good. Faculty are so great over here.Also the facilities at the college are so good

Name: Shankhadeep Debnath
Review_Text: Overwhelmed by the facilities and beauty of the college  Great placements and really good opportunities for excellence  Very fascinating events and interesting events .

Name: Vinayak Menon
Review_Text: Good foreign opportunities and the academics blocks are so great. The campus is lush green, with swimming pool ,gymnasium , outdoor stadium, etc. Also it boasts of a vast expanse with an in-campus Dominoz food joint stall. Also the campus is fully secure and a great attention is devoted to the student safety. Anti- ragging policy is a good move to protect freshers. Also the campus is smoke free and drug free.

Name: Akhil Kanagabalan
Review_Text: The boy- girl interaction is strictly monitored but at the same time they give immense opportunities to grow in a coed education ecosystem. Too much strictness regarding the on-time for hostels , especially for girls. Freshers are not even permitted to leave for the first three months. This is at times a curb on the independence of a student. The institute should allow Arrear exams for Students which makes them save their time from studying the whole course again from the scratch.

Name: Joel Leslie
Review_Text: The institute should also allow male students to roam about within the men's hostel wing after dinner. The rules and regulations made for student's safety and focus is academics are awsome. Library facilities , personal proctor for guidance and caring faculty as well.

Name: Khushi
Review_Text: i liked the campus which is a huge one 200 acres  the college fest named vitopia and vitapp which are cultural and technical fest respectively  the codding culture is very good here regular hackathons are conducted

Name: Arnav Tripathi
Review_Text: very much strictness in the campus here securities guards are every where you need to have several permission to go out of the campus if any mishaps happens udc will be charging and investigation will be done udc means university disciplinary committee

Name: Aditya Singh
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS.
