Name: Jagannadham madhulika
Review_Text: The facilities are good and quit nice in behaviour towards teaching  Campus is little small so there is nothing much like to explore rather social life is good here  Infrastructure is quit good as they have high maintenance and everything works smoothly

Name: SANISETTY YAASWEJA
Review_Text: I don't like the local people like guards they are rude towards students  I don't like the food much here also from outside because they have their one comman way to make which is boaring  I don't like the weather here it's very hot during summers

Name: Aman
Review_Text: Atmosphere of the college is really good , every aspects are clear , no ragging , very disciplined college activities , more technical based events so that students could get int technical work No studies pressure , everyone can choose their own timetable and study their own subjects  Good exposure towards everything , Could conclude that Vit is better than any other college in chennai after IIT madras

Name: Srujan Reddy
Review_Text: nothing much to dislike , everything is comfortable  only one negative is for dayscholars , we need to wake by 5am to board our bus by 630am ( just kidding ) Vit has a great and beautiful infrastructure

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Vit has a curriculum which is useful for industry  Vit's fee structure.If you are in category 1 or 2 then it's affordable  You need to be skillfull to get a good placement

Name: Abhinav V
Review_Text: Good campus, Technical Labs with good equipment Foreign visits and  abroad study prgrammes Experienced Faculties with great knowledge  Strict rules and restricted freedom not allowed outside hostel after 9pm

Name: SIDDHARTH UPADHYAY
Review_Text: the aspects of the college that I am appreciating is well discipline and well teaching methodology my campus life was really enjoyable and worth our infrastructure is awesome and good atmosphere

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: everything is good but they are strict in timing  rules and regulations are following by the supporting staff also some time book materials will not available

Name: Shyam
Review_Text: You get to meet more different people like people from all over India. Because in this college both locals and non locals from different states come here to study. You have more opportunities if you utilise them and plan properly. No ragging I can proudly say that my senio8are my best friends.

Name: Santhosh
Review_Text: There is so much security it takes so much time to get approved for outing or any other things like that Sometimes the course registration server doesn't work well. You will get a lot of stressed during your course registration  Girls don't get to play much in the ground. Mostly boys occupy it.

Name: LVDS VARSHITHA
Review_Text: Faculty is highly educated and they teach nicely. High number of clubs and extra curricular activities happen in campus. Poor management when it comes to selecting courses for the academic year.

Name: Aditya
Review_Text: High number of students present on campus. Campus construction is going on they must finish bit fast Yah it’s gud with college interaction  quality is gud

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The sport circuillim is far better than other clg Food I am bit disappointed they should change  Strict rules and regulations they should reduce

Name: Akshat Kumar Singh
Review_Text: They should progress more cultural activities  Good infrastructure and doctoral faculty Good internship and placement opportunities

Name: Sathyapriya Srinivasan
Review_Text: Mordern way of teaching and good mess food It is over crowded and full of students for computer science engineering  college is located far from the city bhopal

Name: Harshit Kushwaha
Review_Text: Management is poor of this college in terms of living in a hostel One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: Yashas Sen
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: Khyati Pareek
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Sports and daily activities in our university  Huge infrastructure and also  good facilities

Name: Pranjal  Ghosh
Review_Text: Fests and co-circular activities and events are provided  More sort of permissions required for anything  Theory classes are  lack of air conditioning rooms

Name: Jaya Kishore
Review_Text: Disturbances due to constructions in university  The faculties are very helpful and teaching is very open and communicative  Facilities are provided correctly that helps very much

Name: Kartik Tomar
Review_Text: Hostel is a little strict in their rules  Theirs no discrimination between boys and girls that’s one of the best things I love about the college Various clubs provided to improve your skills

Name: Anurag preetham
Review_Text: Hostel rules are little too much as hostellers need  to go through certain permissions to go out The faculties and facilities provided for your studies The clubs and communities that enhancing your various other capabilities

Name: Pralisha Tripathy
Review_Text: Hostel rules and restrictions are little bit too much Excellent infrastructure and greenery. Management is top notch, and strict rules are maintained, especially for first years.  Wide range of facilities available for studies. Labs are up to date and modern.

Name: Kevin
Review_Text: Lots of options for sports enthusiasts like cricket, football, tennis, chess, badminton, table tennis, volley ball, basketball, swimming pool, and much more. Strict restrictions for first year students.  Strict rules for attendance and classes.

Name: Sarthak
Review_Text: Frequent power outages, can expect minimum once a day, although they have generator, which turns on immediately.  I liked the vibrance of the campus with alot of labs  Lot of different clubs that can help boost my resume

Name: Harsh Kumar
Review_Text: lot of oppurunties to study abroad such as exchange programs and mtech Wifi is not the best with low speeds and some dead zones Non-AC classrooms are a hassle in the tamil nadu heat causing a lot of distractions amid lectures

Name: Abhinay kumar
Review_Text: lot of importance on attendance and marks The amount of opportunities for going abroad for exchange  decent campus life with lots of events going on, campus and hostels are very clean

Name: Abhay
Review_Text: a lot of sports and clubs are present for which kids also get credit  wifi is a little slow in hostel and strength is low in certain rooms  lack of cellular strength in a lot of areas

Name: Swetha
Review_Text: non AC theory classes in certain academic block Infrastructure: Buildings, Blocks, overall campus is so beautiful Course structure: flexible, we can choose on our own timings and professors

Name: Boyilla Poli Mokshith Reddy
Review_Text: Atmosphere and opportunities: So lively place, everytime something's happening around campus, some kind of functions or workshops happens almost every other day Too much crowd. Feels like they've over booked The weather of Vellore in summer, you need to walk a lot as the campus is huge.

Name: Vansh
Review_Text: The dress code rule, security guards for PDA, strict hostel timing, cannot roam around at night, feels like jail at times The campus area is big and there are more trees. Many more opportunities for getting internship

Name: Aastha Singh
Review_Text: Many more clubs and get chances to explore There is not enough equipment of sports for playing To much crowded and competitive environment

Name: Bonthu Sreeja
Review_Text: The management is to strict and many more restrictions. Interactive Classroom sessions where students are extremely active Various project opportunities, where lot of research works are carried out.

Name: Shubham Kumar Das
Review_Text: Hostel rules were very strict for the female students Outing timing is only strict for the girls and not for the boys One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Murari Varma
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: B Tanav Reddy
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des I like the whole campus,it is very large and full of greenery

Name: Varun Donthi
Review_Text: I even liked the labs,VIT almost has every expensive machinery and instruments to work with in the lab as a biotechnologist it is very helpful to me I even liked the hostel rooms which are very accommodating  I didn't like the overstrictness in case of girls and boys sitting together

Name: Geet Avaneesh
Review_Text: I did not like the bathrooms that much as it is mostly unclean I didn't even like a little bit racism when it comes to tamils and north indian A lot of cutural exchange takes place as students from all over india are here and also a lot of international students

Name: Pokala Gopi Lakshman
Review_Text: A lot of clubs and activities help you find qhat you want to do withyour career Faculty are well experienced and they have to publish research papers regularlybecause it is mandatory Rules are very strict breaking them will often lead to heavy fines and misconduct will lead to expeulsion or suspension fs

Name: ABISHEK KARTHIK R
Review_Text: To leave the campus for anything you will need your parents permission and your proctors permission At the end of the day you will be exhausted as the campus is very huge and you have to walk a lot in between classes It college have Clean and there are good teaching and more skills can be provided to students

Name: Kannan Shukla
Review_Text: It college can be provided by miss you anyway to provide your feedback  The professor are good but one thing u can be  beware is more dangerous  There are more strictly can be teach students

Name: Vinay vyas
Review_Text: The more strict and very directly provide the notes  The provinces of this college be the strictly guess Most of the faculties are very supportive and knowledgeable.

Name: Hardik Oberoi
Review_Text: Girl to boy ratio is surprisingly better than most of the engineering colleges. Mess food is also good, at least manageable. Campus is mostly overcrowded and most of the facilities are not enough for this strength

Name: Vivek Saha
Review_Text: I really love the infrastructure and the greenery here. The public transport is pretty affordable  The campus and the hostels are very clean

Name: Neellohit Dasgupta
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really. There are not many fests and events. Less fun. Everything's just too far away from the boys hostels

Name: Qurat ul Aaein
Review_Text: The FFCS i.e Fully Flexible Credit System which allows you to take classes from the Professors of Your wish and also allows you  to  make your own timetable. They do conduct a  mock ffcs for freshers as it might be difficult to fill it correctly. Faculties are pretty helpful and all the faculties are either Post graduates or Phd holders knowing a lot about their subject. Also another thing which is not related to academic discussion could gender ratio among the faculties is  50 50 percent. Placements are really promising in compur science engineering. Companies like Google, Microsoft ,Wipro , Accenture ,Amazon, Ebay, Amazon,  Intel, Infosys, etc . have come. Google offered placements to 14 students with super dream offer.

Name: Shanmukh
Review_Text: Campus is huge and so is the distance between the hostel and the academic block though  there is a shed but it still is far.  The campus is new hence is under construction  which is sometimes annoying and the campus might feel overcrowded. Talking about girls hostel the room are good, there is cleaning staff but you need to call them and make then sweep nicely and the washrooms might not be clean as the working staff is pretty lazy.  The gender ratio among students is 7:3 (Boy's : Girl's) like any other engineering college which is fine with me but the problem comes where there are different rules for both. Girls intime is earlier than boys and there are clothing restrictions.

Name: Surya siddharth
Review_Text: Faculty are good all faculty are PhD holder from some IIT,nits and other good colleges. great gaming facilities and seniors are cooperative good clubs culture in college great cultural and techfest are organised by community members. Good labs

Name: Manasvi Kushwah
Review_Text: Big campus due to which you have to travel a lot . Hostel room in older block are not good and small Attendance criteria is too bad they not consider less than 75 percent attendance.

Name: Sidharth
Review_Text: Fully flexible credit system is available which means that you can select the teacher of your own choice and time to study the subject as well. Avg placement is decent as compared to other universities which offer 3-4lpa. The campus is too large and there's much space to giggle around.

Name: Doma sai Sri Harsha vardhan
Review_Text: As the college is out of urban areas, there's issues with mobile data. College provides with wifi but connectivity is low and you can only connect 2 devices with one id. The food of one of the mess is of poor quality as compared to other mess.

Name: BHARATH T
Review_Text: First thing which is liked the most is Fully flexible credit system Diversity like in campus there are students from all over the India Faculties are too good and every one has done phd

Name: Sravani Gullapalli
Review_Text: In this college there are too much restrictions  College is in remote location so traveling is an issue  Fully flexible credit system offers us to create our own time table according to our needs.

Name: Azhar Bukhari
Review_Text: The faculty is supportive also the practical session are up to the mark. The hostel food isn't up to the mark. In the morning breakfast they always offer south indian food and north indian students face difficulty The college management is not up to the mark. The processes are delayed as well as whenever any short problem happens

Name: Dasari Vikas
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. Name: chirag suri
Review_Text: Campus Life is great. Everything basic needs are available within campus in hostel blocks itself. Security is at its peak. Everywhere security guards and cctv are installed for 24/7 eyes on security. The basic needs that all parents need is discipline intheir child is very strictly followed here in VIT.

Name: BALASA HARIBABU
Review_Text: There are less dislikes as compared to likes  Mostly I feel that every fresher feel is outing which is not allowed for us for initial 3 months which is again a good thinking but sometimes it becomes overhyped Else everything is fine here with no dislikes

Name: Kumaresan
Review_Text: VIT has an impressive campus state of the art infrastructure. VIT is a diverse college, you'll find students from different states and countries. Most professors in VIT are well qualified and have a phd degree

Name: Nirmalya chakraborty
Review_Text: Due to large number of students enrolled each classes sometimes can feel crowded While the hostel are well maintained, some students find hostel a bit pricey There will be pressure for CAT exam and FAT exam from the Professors.

Name: Tanisha saha
Review_Text: The timimings of the are liked by me and we can oir owm time table There wiĺl be  o dress code we can wear our oun culture  Instead of giving Saturday as holiday oir taken a good dession giving holiday on Monday

Name: Moka Lakshya Chandrika
Review_Text: Hostel timings are not liked by me there will be limitation of  hostel time Cantin stalls are less and i dont like this type of behaviou in university Its it there are no more dis liked yhings

Name: Sania
Review_Text: Sports facilities are nice can take any sports equipment if is less crowded  Every facilities like haircut and necessary things are inside the he campus You can order from Amazon,Flipkart or any e-commerce platform and recieve package

Name: Raj Kumar Reddy
Review_Text: There are less girls. There are 3 hostels for boys and 2 for girls Hostel is bit too crowded. During class time rarely get to use lifts. ground is also crowed  In first semester freshers cannot go out of campus unless parents pick you or it's holiday(with proctor and parents permission)

Name: Gowtham M
Review_Text: Diversity is great. You get to know a vast number of cultures and mingle with them. The campus. Its huge and beautiful. The greenery is well maintained and the infrastructures is amazing. The fests. Fests here are really grand. A lot of fun activities and really famous celebrities as guests.

Name: Porselvi N
Review_Text: Old school thinking. Very strict dress codes and rules. Different lifts for girls and guys, separate seating arrangements, etc. College and hostel intimea... College intime is 7 30 pm and hostel intime is 9 pm for guys. Its pathetic. Its even worse for girls. acedemic department is very nice and strong

Name: INUKONDA JYOSHNA
Review_Text: its very decent and have basic arrangements, and we have a decent college life here all faculty here are doctoral faculties , all have phd degress from top colleges of india the campus of college is under construction and it also lacks in providing pleasures campus lifee experience

Name: Muddarsu Harshitha
Review_Text: during the summers , vit bhopal has a mojor issue of facing water shortage in hostel . the non acedemic staff is not good , they are very rude with the students Infrastructure of college is good with greenery too

Name: Vempa Queeny
Review_Text: Too much crowd, students strength is high  Good environment,green and digitalized campus  Academics are really good and lab facilities are also good

Name: M praveen
Review_Text: We'll get great exposure because students are from pan India  More crowded campus and class strength is high  If you need to buy something there will be crowd

Name: Vishwas Ramasani
Review_Text: The infrastructure is very good in this campus. The hostel rooms are also good.They are cleaned everyday. All the teachers are also friendly and qualified and knowledgeable

Name: Bingi Sai Santosh Srivatsav
Review_Text: The schedule is very busy for all the students. Wifi facilities could have been better than this. They should have Air conditioner in all the classrooms.

Name: Aysha Noushad
Review_Text: Space full campus with silent environment Pollunted free college and good maintenance Infrastructure, design, learning facilities are good

Name: S Nadeem

Name: RITWIK
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des The college has cool environment. Gives friendly vibes. Lots of good events are conducted frequently

Name: Amarthya
Review_Text: Students are very friendly and there is NO ragging or similar culture Too many students in the campus and it feels like a town. There's construction going on inside the campus most of the time

Name: Abhishek
Review_Text: The massive well maintained environment insidr college Giving job opportunities to many native peoples Good infrastructure and it keeps on grtting better.

Name: Sai Manohar Reddy Manda
Review_Text: Poor faculty for first sem as they are either guest lecturer or beginner Lack of manners of some students in the college Liked the infrastructure and the facilities offered

Name: Muttaluru Mahidhar reddy
Review_Text: Liked the people and the diversity present  Liked the clubs and the events organised  The population here is way too much man like too much

Name: Rishi kiran
Review_Text: the curriculum is tough and people often fail work load is heavy but still decent. Just need to study  Located in Chennai, we get perks like one day Amazon delivery, any type of item can be found in the city

Name: Samarth Pathak
Review_Text: Faculties are very experienced and highly qualified, some of them are also in the top 2% of the best professors in the world labs are equipped with powerful processors, and wifi speeds upto 1 GBps No AC in the classrooms, although it is available in the labs

Name: Fahmi shafeeq
Review_Text: Quality of mess food can be improved, also the serving staff are rude often Gym timings are too short(5 am to 7am and 4pm to 7pm) for the free ones Have a great campus and lot of amenities

Name: EDAPALAPATI HARSHAVARDHAN
Review_Text: Have a vast network of alumini for future help Have a good infrastructure for studying and extracurriculars  Does not allow student to use their own vehicle inside the campus

Name: Aaryaman Modi
Review_Text: Has a lot of restrictions for freshers for the first 3 months Campus is too larges so you have to roam around to get to classes The infrastrucure is very good. It has a number of clubs

Name: PARITOSH KATIYAR
Review_Text: The teaching faculty is nice. They upload all the relevant material The exam is held very regulary , loaded with a number of assignments Well established labs for every sibject and field

Name: Farhan Khan
Review_Text: paid canteen and grocery stores are good. You can find everything of your need in those The infrastructure is nice and the greenery is good There is too much crowd in the college itself

Name: Yashwanth
Review_Text: Everything is too costly (those with no mrp)  Mess food is not that good and hostels are not up to the mark There campus is very huge and beautiful ,,.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: There is a railway line in the middle of vit They are very strict there rules are very strict Teaching Style as like teacher are very friendly they welcome you anytime if you have doubt..

Name: Pradeep Kumar Shukla
Review_Text: Acadamic study design as  duration of semester. Holiday duration are short. So you don't have more days to spend on home. As it is under construction so some time students are send for online semester.

Name: Vempadapu Ponny
Review_Text: The diverse crowd. You will find many people from your background, age and community. Helpful seniors. No incidents of ragging at all. Very safe campus. No safety incidents have ever occurred.

Name: S Revanth
Review_Text: Lack of facilities. Many facilities, such as swimming pool and tennis court are not available. Frequent wifi outages and power cuts during exams. Poor college management. Very convoluted and long leave process. Too many campus restrictions.

Name: satwika chitra
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. Name: SIDDHANT DHAKA
Review_Text: I like how the enviornment push us to give our best here at VIT. There are some of the best Faculties one can ask for with all having PhD's from reupdated institutes even from IIT's. Quality of study and the style of teaching in the classroom is quite good till my experience.

Name: Krish Singh sengar
Review_Text: The chief warden wouldnt permit you to go out if you have a bad impression in front of him, he is the biggest fool in the world. So just be in good terms with him. Hostel facilities are very poor and the mess food is barely good enough to be eatable. The College is still under construction in some aspects while makes pollution a disturbing factor, also a temporary lack of infrastructure.

Name: Anshul Arohi
Review_Text: Knowledgeable teachers and also they are friendly Neat and clean surroundings in the college Big library and high priority for sports

Name: Tushar
Review_Text: The college is very near to a factory which releases gases Road way to college is some what bad. The campus is very environmental friendly it’s so big aswell as properly maintained

Name: Sri krishna
Review_Text: there’s various restaurants inside the campus such as dominos, pizza hut etc the staff and professors are very friendly and nice many of my friends mention that the red tag security doesn’t understand hindi so it’s a problem for all my north indian friends

Name: Aarav Shah
Review_Text: Quality of education and faculty expertise.VIT is known for having a strong faculty base. campus infrastructure and facilities.The campus is self sufficient with hostels and all basic needs. Placement services and career support most of the students get good placement opportunities

Name: BONIGALA ABHISHEK
Review_Text: High student intake and large classroom sizes which leads to overcrowded classes especially in popular courses cost of education vit is a private institute with high cost of living. placement opportunities are uneven across all the branches cse is the most popular

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: To set out own time table called ffcs in which we can set our own time table They organise good fest ,events and any one can join Provide decent placements if anyone knows decent coding and having cgpa above 8

Name: Venkateshwar rao
Review_Text: Proctor system in which you have taken permission from your proctor after their approval then you can go outside the college Completing 3 semesters of 4,4,2 months which is very hectic for students College is not in city it is too far from city around 70km

Name: mendu venkata sivaram
Review_Text: the environment around here is good as it is far away from city and no traffic noice the campus size is big and overall it is not far from the railway station and airport the faculties here are good and experienced

Name: GANAGAPATNAM VENKATA KARTHIK
Review_Text: there is lack infrastucture and other things there are a lot of people which increases a lot of compitition there are many catering companies which has a overall of confusing mess for different block

Name: KADALI SASANK
Review_Text: VIT Vellore is renowned for its high-quality education and state-of-the-art facilities. The institution offers diverse courses with experienced faculty, and its strong industry connections facilitate excellent placement opportunities. Additionally, t The fees at VIT Vellore can be relatively high compared to other institutions, which might be a burden for some students. The competitive environment might also add stress, and the institution’s focus on commercialization can sometimes detract from a Labs are classes are same for M.Tech. i.e University has provided us with our personal powerful systems in the classroom.

Name: NUTAKKI JOEL SAAHITH
Review_Text: The university encourages us to get into research from the first semester for M.Tech We have FFCS (Fully Flexible Credit System) so we don't have to follow a rigid syllabus Hostels are almost mandatory. You will need special permission from your parents to stay outside.

Name: Abhinav polaki
Review_Text: It is very far from the main Bhopal City The campus is very good like the infrastructure is nice and very good facilites all over The incubation cell helps you if you have any startup ideas etc.. it will help with team and funding

Name: Sidadrdha
Review_Text: The education exposure is good like we can explore real time projects in academic courses parking space is out of college . so you have to walk overall college or else you have take shuttle bus which is full everytime no bikes are allowed into the campus by the students

Name: Kaustubh Bramhe
Review_Text: The exposure you get in this college is soo good in which we meet a lot of people from different cities and culture. The placements are so good and the CTC are normally high than other instituions. The staffs are soo good and well educated and well trained staffs

Name: Sai dharma charan
Review_Text: The expenses surrounded by vit is very high There is very less public transportation for the college thus increase in rickshaw too much high price Cost of living is too much around the college which i think is bad

Name: Harshith
Review_Text: The ambiance and its location in the city Transport facility is good I like the space of class room Fees is little bite higher. Transport charges is little bite high.

Name: Shaik valijan
Review_Text: Lab fee is too high and function fees is lttlte high. Infrastructure is good and well maintained. Extra curricular activities are available

Name: Charan
Review_Text: Personal and professional development provide. Environmental conditions of Vellore is not good. In and out timings of campus for hostel students

Name: Chenna kesava rao Palli
Review_Text: I like staff and friends The management also nice and the canteen food also nice I dislike the management rules the rules should strictly fellow otherwise punishment is their

Name: Deepak
Review_Text: The exam schedule they give the time table very late Education is good and faculty is very supportive Placement is good if we do well we can get job

Name: S HEMANTH
Review_Text: Bus fees is too high present they increased fees Some of infrastructure is not good but overall is good VIT is a very good college for those who could not do enough in JEE

Name: Mamidi giri naga venkata ranga
Review_Text: You will get a great bunch of people from different cultures to hang around you The sub way will be closed on Sundays u need to walk a few minutes vit offers world class education and ensures that graduates have many skills and learning.

Name: G Vinay
Review_Text: vit offers top-notch infrastructure  amenities. vit has a strong placement record, with many students starting their own businesses and getting higher-level jobs. in 2024, the NIRF ranked vit vellore well in the engineering category, based on faculty quality and employability. high tuition fees making it financially challenging for some students.

Name: Mamidi ramyasri
Review_Text: the main campus of vit is located in vellore, which is relatively distant from major metropolitan cities. vit has a rigorous admission process ,with a high level of competition My university is the best university in btech

Name: karthikeya raghunadh
Review_Text: University avg package is best good package University environment is best  fornfreh Class room ac is not available hhjjjjkjbh

Name: Dindigala Manideep
Review_Text: In class have ac or mic problem they hauve not ac and speaker We cant hear teacher  voice that why we cant understand topics The FFCS System helps us to study at our own pace. The Fully Flexible Credit System allows us to choose our own subjects, with our own teachers and time slots.

Name: Sai charan
Review_Text: The faculty and professors are very helpful and you can go into their cabin anytime to ask for help. The lush green campus provided by the University is very good and makes us feel the nature even more. The campus is under construction, therefore some facilities are still not available.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The campus can feel very crowded at times due to many students in each batch. The campus life feels restricted due to strict rules and regulations of VIT Bhopal University I liked that students of various states are there means fully diversed culture

Name: NEELI GANESH
Review_Text: Various club activities were there, moreover one of the greatest cultural fest ADVITya Fully flexible credit system is there in university means you can create your time table and choose your own faculty in each semester Campus is being situated 70 km from the main city Bhopal

Name: Bhagya Sree
Review_Text: After 8.30 you are not allowed to go out of hostel The food here is appreciable and everyone are happpy The maintenance of hostels are simply appreciated

Name: S Haricharan
Review_Text: Faculties are highly effective and educated persons Course registration process is little headache for all Insufficient rooms for the hostels are the new problem this year

Name: karthikeya
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech

Name: Ramisetty lakshman
Review_Text: I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des

Name: Abhishek
Review_Text: All teachers are well experienced and knows the basics. They know how to push you above and beyond Facilities both in class (Smart Board, Labs, Table and Chairs) and out of the class (food, bus service, mess, hostel rooms) are great. Hostels are equipped with everything (AC, Good mess, 24*7 electricity, Security)

Name: VELAGA MOULI
Review_Text: Rigourus Schedule. Each semester consists of 3 different tests (2 cats and 1 fat). this along with 3 assignments and quiz for every subject every semister. Teachers have communication problem. Some of the teachers are partial. Too many rules. Rules like everyone needs to be in their hostels by 8:30 and in the campus by 7 pm are harsh

Name: Mohan krishna A
Review_Text: Faculties are awesome hair and 10 to 20 years of experience Campus life is great here as there or some places where student can meet each other like foodys The view from the hostel is like amazing everywhere there are mountain trees greenery

Name: CHALUVADI VENKATA MADHAVA SOURI KRISHNA
Review_Text: We have to walk a lot 3 to 4 times from hostel to class and it which is about 1 km 1.5 km every time Lots of competition inside the college itself Auto rickshaw insert campus is very expensive.

Name: Prathipati Suseel kumar
Review_Text: The campus of v I t valour is very large, it's around three hundred acres, and its will lush green camps a you can enjoy your life here Few of the teachers highly qualified and are able to teach the concept very well, and they give problems to solve, which helps to increase knowledge The timings are flexible and the credit system is flexible.You can choose the timing when you want to attend class at the start of the semester

Name: Devisrikarthik
Review_Text: Few of the professors are not very good, and their teaching skills are very bad and they are not able to teach us You don't get much time after college.Because the schedule is very tight The faculties, the research facilities, the tie-ups with other international institutions, academics overall was a huge strongpoint of VIT

Name: samana john
Review_Text: VIT prioritizes the safety and security of its students.  extremely strong anti-ragging procedures are followed The infrastructure. The lawns, the buildings, the hostels, other facilities. Overcrowding, too many people everywhere. The intake of students can be more controlled.

Name: YR rahul
Review_Text: Communication problems with the locals, security guards, shopkeepers Nothing much to see in the city apart from a few restaurants, a fort and a temple. Students often spend their leisure time by playing sports, going on walks, or simply trying out new places to eat. Good about the College that I have studied is there are very good placement compared to other colleges in Vellor

Name: Spoorthy
Review_Text: I have joined this college on my teens so there  will be great interaction between all my senior and at the same time When I tell about teacher it's good compared to other colleges in Vellore and to encourage the students they will conduct the seminar I would say about the infrastructure and they need to work on that the hostel is too old building and toilet which they have to focus

Name: Sk Md Rafi
Review_Text: And one more thing that they have to improve the  quality of mess food and taste of mess food it is not upto the mark that Professor did not come to the class on time so it causes time waste that things need to change and Frequently. The teaching faculty are good to learn advanced education.

Name: Jeevan kalla
Review_Text: The campus environment is very good and cleaned Sometime the class time were changed for a reason. The teaching method is liked so much and I understand clearly

Name: KONTALA RAMANA
Review_Text: My reading skills are improving very well and staffs give extra curricular activities I learned easily staffs are most effective to teach them Sametime staffs are very strict and contact with students parents for any mistakes

Name: Reshmi vinod
Review_Text: Six days are working days any emergency situation not granted a leave Very strict with time to time lunch time is just 30 minutes only Placement cell is very active, they provide training, help students in placement preparation

Name: Noopura Pentapati
Review_Text: Infrastructure is not completed, campus life not very extracurricular Too many restrictions on leave, can go out of university only twice in a month. College campus is too wide and its nature is awesome

Name: Narasimha Prasad Pappuri
Review_Text: College got 7-8 rank in India in lab facility There is not so much to dislike but one thing can be is fees is littile high Also intake of students is in large number

Name: ABHILASH K
Review_Text: Lush  Green  Campus,  Good  Infrastructure Library, Extracurricular activities & AdVITya Well Equipped laboratories, Good Faculties

Name: Vikram
Review_Text: Distance between boy's hostel to academic building Too far from cities like bhopal & indore Sometimes  wifi  and  electricity issues

Name: SAHIL SHAIK
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech

Name: ALLADA HEMANTH KUMAR
Review_Text: I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des

Name: Akhil
Review_Text: The environment here is very positive with respect to studies and all the other activities so yeah you can find many new stuff to explore for your career. You'll discover a very great coding culture here and that would help you engross into healthy coding competition All the hackathons and fun events everything helps us in personal development

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Sometimes the professors focus a bit too much on mugging up rather than teacher actual concepts You can something feel stressed out due to excessive academic pressure but that is what shapes you I dont really find any other negatives,its a good place to study

Name: PAWAN DINESH PILLI
Review_Text: personaliAspects I appreciated in this college were A1 academic facilities and teaching moreover the class size is of 70 students. Campus Life at VIT is very hectic and stressful everyone is into too much pressure moreover the location of the campus is very Faculties are exceptionally talented and hardworking all the faculties at VIT Bhopal hold a PhD degree in their area of expertise teaching

Name: Sidhatth
Review_Text: We came to know due to recession there hasn't been any single placement since last 6 months for the 24 graduating batch Infrastructure is not fully developed moreover the hostels are of poor quality and lack of services, mess food is also very bad apart from that water is highly unfit for drinking. Course curriculum and Training are the positives of VITB, their rigorous grinding for placement training and directors and PAT team always busy

Name: CHEPPALI CHANU
Review_Text: I like that they follow a flexible credit system. The library is solid with a lot of material for studies. The campus is very crowded. Even though the campus is big, I feel like it can't properly accommodate all the people comfortably.

Name: ALLADI JAMES PAUL
Review_Text: There is a lack of liberty inside campus and there is a disciplinary committee deployed with red tags inside the campus The environment of the campus is really appreciative and is maintained very neatly. In my personal experience, for the fashion technology course we are needed to go to different classes in different blocks

Name: Subramanyeswara
Review_Text: The infrastructure of the college .vit Ap has great infrastructure The infrastructure of the hostel of both men’s and women’s are very lovely blocks.the rooms are very beautiful The campus is lag behind in infrastructure and it’s going on improving day by day

Name: GANESH GOVIND K
Review_Text: It is to far from the city.we have to travel 20km long to Vijayawada I like hostel security, UG norms are followed properly. They have got great variety of books in library

Name: abdul
Review_Text: the teachers are well educated and teaches good i did not like the high security all over the college . we dont like paying fines fines for breaking silly rules like not wearing id card,roaming late at night campus

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: we dont like the hostel food we can just eat them the taste is worse and nutrition value is low. Subject of coding and extra curricular activities and good placement offers Canteen food and mess food and hostels rooms

Name: KONDA HARI KUMAR REDDY
Review_Text: Good internship offers and good placement offers Distence between college to hostetis 2 km New architecture building is too hot to survive

Name: Jayadeep
Review_Text: Not good playground for football and cricket and no network near hostel the college is great and beautifull i love everything in the college the labs are acc and i love them because of the good pc

Name: Grandhi srikar
Review_Text: the hostel are very beautifull and they have good rooms the bad thing is that their are guards everywhere students required permission to go outside everytime

Name: Bala Sathwik Nagothu
Review_Text: the hostel security is verty tight you cant even have fun The education system is so unique that i have never found it anywhere else in the country. After the first semester you can choose your subjects The events held in every 2 months and apart from that small events are also held. Too good to be a private university.

Name: Vyshnavi
Review_Text: The campus is unique with different cultures and so many activities. If you are planning on an educational exposure this is the best option. There are rules and regulations which is sometimes  too much but then comparing to other universities they are too flexible. There is PDA in campus and too many rules for women students.

Name: MANIDEEP
Review_Text: Good research oppurtunities in the campus Have a good student to faculty ratio so better learning College follows ffcs which means you can choose subjects and faculty as per your choice

Name: Thrilok chaitanya
Review_Text: There are some restrictions in moving in and out of campus Syllabus of the subjects that we study looks some out dated One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Gowtham Sai
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Boda Nandagopal
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des The culture of Vellore Institute of technology is very good

Name: Naresh Sarathy
Review_Text: The placement cell of Vit gives good training The Fully flexible credit system helps a lot There is no much of a class interaction here

Name: Anil vemula
Review_Text: The relationship between faculty and students is not great always Very crowded when all the students have class at the same time I liked my college environment,hostels , food in the mess and the greeny environment provides an peace'full study

Name: Rage Bhanu Kiran
Review_Text: The labs are very devloped and authorised to our needs and its provides AC and 24/7 wifi facility to ensure a better connectivity The faculty in our college is very well trained and good at teaching I like our faculty teaching and grabs so much of knowledge from them College Got a better campus life safe and enjoyable

Name: Srinivasa Rao
Specialization: Computer Science and Engineering + Data Science
Review_Text: College provide a lot of exposure to make you aan along with engineer Teachers of the college is one of the best and most cooperative Intake of students very high effecting the class size

Name: DHARMANA GNANANANDA
Review_Text: Gender ratio is also not too good compared to other private colleges Fees becomes too high to effort in comparison to the average placement results in difficult ROI The campus life, the university the teachers

Name: Pavan santhosh
Review_Text: We have to walk to the academic block from hostel which is very time consumption Campus is very greenary and beautiful. You will definitely love the campus area It is good college with good placement it has big placement chances because it is a branch of VIT vellore so the placement in VIT is centralised for all four campus

Name: Jyothish
Review_Text: It is 70km away from the bhopal city and it is located in the village and the campus is still under the construction and does not fully completed The campus is really big, really well maintained and clean, first time entering the college was a sight to behold. The hostels are clean and some of the messes have really great food.

Name: Arch
Review_Text: Some of the faculties are really great and helpful. The HOD is also quite helpful. Social life is not good as vellore does not really have any places to visit. Some of the facilities really make our lives difficult for no reason.

Name: Nirmit Srivastava
Review_Text: Some of the rules are very strict and make no sense. Students dont really have much freedom, but it might be great for parents as they know their children are in safe hands. The hostels in the college are very good…they are really neat and clean The campus has sports to play and the food outlets are good…you can celebrate birthday parties too.

Name: Sai praneetha
Review_Text: Overall we can have fun…there are lots of events going on which you can enjoy  The college is not completely built yet…so that's a slight issue  The management is a little poor…problem for North indians

Name: Abhinaya
Review_Text: I like the campus first and the environment in the campus is very good I like the infrastructure and greenery of the campus I like the way the faculty trains us in a good way

Name: Keerthana chintada
Review_Text: In between college timings students are not allowed to go outside of the campus Another dislike is maintaining attendance properly Almost 97% of faculty have doctoral degree in their respective field.

Name: V Jaya Naga Adithya
Review_Text: Anti Ragging policies, and the seniors are very friendly. The infrastructure, The university was started in 2017 still it is not completely constructed. As of July 2024, One academic building is still under construction. Do not have sports facility completely build.

Name: Vinuthna
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech

Name: Maddikayalalakshmireddy
Review_Text: I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des

Name: BOBBILI AKARSH
Review_Text: open book tests which doesnt just test your memory but your in depth understanding of the subject beautiful, huge and aesthetic campus life along  with supportive faculty for our future . tough practical exam evaluation which tests the practical knowlege of every curious learner.

Name: Srikanth Reddy PVJ
Review_Text: too competitive of an environment,could lead to stress. need for extra hardwork due to tough syllabus . high concentration required to analyse and reimagine concepts due to tough practical exam evaluation

Name: MBunnyeswar
Review_Text: This college has provided us good hostel facilities The syllabus is quite updated and at par with other colleges Teaching is a little lenient here. Often we are found studying on our own

Name: MADDI YAJNAVALKYA
Review_Text: As it is new, it is still quite under construction. VIT has very good study environment, students and even faculties out there are awesome and ready to help you anytime. Library is one of the best thing you will get. 3 floors amazing library where you can absolutely study whole day without any sort of disturbance.

Name: Krishna Surya
Review_Text: Very Intuitive related to research and development, You will able to get any kind of help from them in case you need regarding research publishing. Placements are not that good for out course MCA The college is only best for Btech Mtech student but for other branches just consider it as a form of degree.

Name: Hemanth
Review_Text: The college ha 5-6 canteen and have delicious food and also we have students from all over india so variety of food . Vit bhopal classroom which are absolutely at par with top global enginnering college Nothing is forced against the will of the students at vit bhopal at it is safe to say that college is run as per student wishes

Name: MUHAMMED  SAJJAD
Review_Text: The college is expanding and hence the constitution work is on since I have joined and God know when it will finish Faculties in vit bhopal has great academic qualifications The security of students is very much good

Name: K YOGAN BHARATH
Review_Text: Their approach for courses and focus on placements College is still under construction , so many things are getting ready Their is lack of mobile signal in the hostels

Name: Shinde Ritesh Balaji
Review_Text: The infrastructure in every field needs to be upgraded The infrastructure was amazing and the sunset and sunrise view was like wooow. Just love the sunset and the lake side view . The events were amazing every. Year there college conduct a big event of almost a month invited singers , celebrity, motivational speaker

Name: Mamidi nagalakshmi
Review_Text: The placement cell and the lab complex infrastructure in nice good Hostel mess is not that much good except that everything is good In academic aspects college is good like workshops, international seminars and hackathons.

Name: Byreddy sumanth reddy
Review_Text: College life is tough here but if you are dedicated you can easily survive. The faculty was very good. Teachers were really considerate while teaching. The ability to choose how you wish to complete your credits is awesome.

Name: Sandeep
Review_Text: The fact that you can choose your own teachers and their timings depending on the slots available was one of the biggest advantages. University’s infrastructure is not so great. The campus is still under construction. Everyone is unnecessarily strict. Hostel authorities aren’t empathetic or considerate at all.

Name: SUNKARA LAKSHMI TEJASWINI
Review_Text: PDA is a big fuss in the college. Unlike other universities, you’ll have to submit a fine and your parents will be informed. VIT is a very good college for those who couldn't do enough in jee and are willing to make the amendments now. you can do projects , research works,get publications etc. you will always be encouraged ,very good college for enjoying college life. VIT has a great bunch of people from different cultures to hang around with. 24 hours electricity , 20 hours free wifi , 24 hours water supply both hot and cold .very good college for foodies

Name: Garlapati Manikanta
Review_Text: VIT has a branch of dominos inside the campus itself which is very helpful for students very bad college for those who despirately want to show their love in public. public display of affection is strictly prohibited inside the campus. your ill-mannered behaviour will not be tolerated and you will be sent home very bad college for those who want a peaceful walk out of hostel. this place is over crowed . very bad college if you are looking for the same quality teachers who taught you jee portions

Name: Meghana
Review_Text: at times you will curse yourself after interacting with some professors Sports facility is good, you can try multiple sports and learn new skills The club's and chapters in the college are a great way to make new contacts and learn new skills

Name: Mahendra Garikipati
Review_Text: Campus is big, and overall beauty of campus is commendable Less freedom, hostel entry 9pm for boys and 8pm for girls Food is bad, mess food is not good, and in the city there is not much to explore

Name: Hari Kiran
Review_Text: Too much crowded, around 65000 students are in the college and competition is very high One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: UTKARSH VERMA
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: Peddi Raju
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des The opportunities are good and facilities are good Big campus compared to other universities. Yet some is under construction

Name: Bhavana
Review_Text: The support from the faculty and clubs that enhance your creativity. Comparing to other colleges the circullum is good. No night life. You will locked in the hostel after 8 pm Strict rules. In hostels you are not allowed to get your kettles and all

Name: HARI
Review_Text: Everywhere there are tight restrictions whether you want to go home or to an outing University life is very good. Fests are really awesome Placements are really good when compared to other colleges

Name: THELLA JOHN JACINTH
Review_Text: You can choose your own faculty and subjects and also you can frame your own timetable Subject is a bit tough and you should be prepared for exams because they are not going to be very easy Well developed hostel and their teaching with the changing syllabus according to the generation is a great thing which even IITs are failed in applying such type of things

Name: Muttaluru Mahidhar reddy
Review_Text: The crowd is the reason which feels sometime that the competition is tough here the diversity in the college and the strength of the college provides you with a lot of exposure and helps you to understand different cultures of people coming form different places in india if you choose to socialise. the FFCS system in VIT vellore provides flexibility to a lot of students as the timings of the classes they will attend will be in their hands so they,and also the hostels are really good and hygenic. can plan their daily activities accordingly

Name: Sivaram karthik
Review_Text: the placement cell at vit vellore know as CDC helps students at vellore prepare for placements and we develop various skillsets and gain some perssonality development too and if you stay in the top 20 percent you will get a good package your expenditure at vit will be a lot mainly in food and transport the food in hostel mess is 'CLEAN' and somewhat good but you will get bore of the repititive menus daily and end up eating out many times a week. The auto will rip you off like 100/km the amount of fests are a lot in number but compared to the population it is not , everything is first come first serve so you are bound to miss many of themexcept the paid ones casue people know they are a waste of money (except tech events)

Name: Ram
Review_Text: the population is a lot so everything is soo competitive and it does kinda feel like an island full of people for an outgoing person (not if you are an introvert) as you live in a town and there arent many place you can go enjoy and party . Engagement with campus life and the quality of social interactions Quality of infrastructure, including campus amenities

Name: Kumar
Review_Text: The faculty who are very dedicated to their job The campus sometimes feels very very crowded Few of the faculty are a bit partial to the students

Name: Mamidi giri naga venkata ranga praneeth
Review_Text: Uhm nothing more than that actually. Everything is nice. The faculty, The overall maintenance of the university  The online portal system is well maintained

Name: E Harsha vardhan
Review_Text: Library and labs are well equipped with good pcs and books academics are a bit stress for few students  no proper transport to the clg from vijaywada, guntur

Name: Hemanth
Review_Text: climate might be an issue because it's very humid  College Environment with good faculty, libraries It is overall good. If we study hard we can definitely get good placements so there is nothing i disliked

Name: Bhargav
Review_Text: At VIT , you can have a great exposure.There are abundant opportunities and ways for you to communicate with others and improve your communication skills. The clubs and extra-curricular activities have direct advantage for the scholastic development of our personality. The curriculum is more inclined toward the placement order making it easy to get higher packages.

Name: Shaik nazeee
Review_Text: There are more number of people studying in vit ,which may make u feel disturbed. The overall Fee structure is higher compared to other colleges .So you have to pay more for studying in vit. Vellore is small town .So the students which prefer urban locality may find it not interesting.

Name: Satya prakash
Review_Text: Way of living in the college and the free rules and regulations There is no outing time for boys so its good We can flexible our own time table and we can select our own teachers

Name: ENUGU ASHOK
Review_Text: Mess and food it is only preferable for north indians It is so crowded over there and the population is so high Discipline and Well Developed Architecture, Eco-Friendly Space

Name: RAJABOYINA BHUVANENDRA
Review_Text: Nice and a well Educated staff full of Knowledge A stress free and hassle-free environment to seek knowledge in. Not able to roam or perform activities or play sports after 9:00PM

Name: Vishnu rohit
Review_Text: Crowd and a large teacher to student ratio Very Unfriendly staff doesn't cooperate at all One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Sriram lohith
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Balu naik Banavath
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des The infrastructure is really so good, each building contains at least of 10 floors

Name: GIDDALURU LOKESH KUMAR
Review_Text: The activities and the programs are very unique and different which actually we have everyday in our collage Most importantly students from every region in INDIA are  there in our collage , so we can different kinds of cultures in our collage In hostels we have only 4 lifts, so we have to wait for lifts for long time

Name: Koushik
Review_Text: In mess the food is good but some days its not and the on non veg day they provide very little amount of nonveg food The permission for outing is really a big process, whenever if we wanna go out we need apply for leave request and it should be accept by our protractor and parents too The faculty are 100 doctoral . They are highly qualified and teach in a best environment

Name: Narasimha reddy
Review_Text: The building and quite environment makes student learn in a diverse way and stay focused The placement is the main best thing one can consider Hostel management thing are not properly managed in hostel

Name: Samatha
Review_Text: Non ac  classroom are non ac and it becomes difficult to study in the summer conditions Lab are abit small but they are working on it I like my college library very much because there it provides very huge number of books and references so that we can easily studies and common computers are also there so the students can access the computer through there respected registration no .

Name: Likhith pavan kalyan
Review_Text: I like the park also very much because when we have free time we would like to sit there and enjoy our free time. I like my professors also because they never fail anyone . I hostel high fees I don't like it it is very high and expensive.

Name: Sai Mounika
Review_Text: I don't like the food quality when compared to the money which we had paid I don't like the strict rules of the hostel because we have enter to our hostel before 8:30. After spending one year here I get to know that this college have a really great infrastructure with good placement opportunities I guess something which need to get improvement here is the strictness for the students.

Name: PULI LOKESH
Review_Text: Social life is great here cause you will get people from all over India here with different thoughts and ideas Almost all the teachers are PhD holders here and they are really good in teaching like they really teaches us unlike some other colleges to just go though the pdf Strictness, because they doesn't allow us to stay out for long ,after 8:15 hostel door gets closed and then they'll make you call your parents

Name: Nikhil
Review_Text: The burdon of attendance is huge here because you will have to maintain minimum 80% attendance to appear for the exams Here they also take three exams cat1,cat2 and then fat so it's a bit hectic for everyone, because in every one month we will get one exam to appear for INFRASTRUCTURE - Every class is equipped with smart boards and projectors , and also 2 green boards

Name: Avinash
Review_Text: Diverse Student Community - VIT has students from all over the country like there are students from Jammu and Kashmir Location - This college is located far from the city near the outskirts, even though public transport is available to this college Internet Connectivity - There is a bit slow internet and selected places of 5G net avialability.

Name: Pranay
Review_Text: I like the college campus and how well it has been made The faculty is really good and they encourage you to take part in extra curricular The college is very systematic and has proper exams

Name: Vamshi krishna
Review_Text: The college is over crowded especially in computer science There is some language barrier in the town of Vellore if you are a North Indian The college has strict rules for girls and very strict in times

Name: GUDDIGARI SRAVAN KUMAR REDDY
Review_Text: The nature around vit is so good and peaceful. The campus is also beautiful and lovely. The academics in vit is good, like the professors here are so much qualified. Some professors are rude. Like if they dont like you they send you out of class for no reason.

Name: Shreya Vemula
Review_Text: Campus infrastructure is soo good with greenery everywhere. Many events are conducted to show our skills. The faculty were highly certified and knowledgable.

Name: Puneeth
Review_Text: Attendance is more important than interestingly attending the classes. VIT vellore holds an excellent placement record with 80-90% students getting placed each year. VIT vellore has an vast infrastructure with campus size of about 372 acres.

Name: Manoj
Review_Text: VIT vellore offers various sports facilities like cricket, football, basketball, swimming, gym The university has some strict rules regarding outings and leave. VIT vellore is located in a rural area as compared. It could be inconvenient for students who prefer more urban locality.

Name: Mubasheer Mohammed
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech

Name: Harish
Review_Text: I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des

Name: MUDAVATH KARTHIK NAIK
Review_Text: The infrastructure is really good. Better than a lot of IIT and NITs The academic environment is very competitive which will force you to study hard and get better grades They provide a lot of mess options in hostels

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The rules are are very strict when compared to other colleges. There are no ACs in classroom, chennai can get really hot in summers If you don't maintain good attendance percentage, you're going to have a hard time getting good teachers in FFCS (unless you have 9 CGPA)

Name: Jagadeeswara
Review_Text: vit ap campus offers numerous opportunities and allows students to learn a lot to advance their careers. one of the aspects i really like about my college is start up programs like V-Launch where students gain valuable experience. Students can also get admission through AP EMACET through merit  and the fees are around 70k per year only i like the faculty at vit ap, there are excellent and most of the professors being iit graduates.

Name: Gudi Ram Charan tej
Review_Text: i don't like one thing in my college is that there are no trees merely one or two large ones. campus looks greenery but with only small plants. the construction happens all the time and i don't like that sometimes it disturbs our classes too. I like the prior environment and surroundings of my college.

Name: Rohith Sai Gopal Marrapu
Review_Text: The facilities and infrastructure of the college is simply superb. The library offers every book you want and library timings are very feasible. There is nothing much to say. I don't have any dislikes

Name: Amulya
Review_Text: The education schedule system of selecting your own teachers, courses and time table The locality and atmosphere of the college is very good and it's nice to take a walk around in the evenings. The labs are equipped with good systems.

Name: Sathya prakash
Review_Text: The area is almost very hot during Summers, making it unbearable to go out. University Infrastructure is pleasant and good for studying There is a flexibility to opt faculty and slot as per our timings

Name: Charita
Review_Text: University is Ragging free campus there is no ragging in University Our university is a tier 3 university, you see heavy crowd everywhere Hostel and mess fee is very high to afford for a middle class family

Name: Rupanjali
Review_Text: Placements could be harder for an individual because of heavy competition One of the standout aspects of VIT Chennai is its robust infrastructure. The campus is well equipped eith state of art facilities, including modern labs, library and classrooms. Have sport complexes for tennis, swimming, cricket, basketball etc.

Name: Avinash
Review_Text: Faculty are highly qualified, bringing a wealth of expertise and innovative methods. We have practical learning. Placements are really good and ample amount of opportunities Too much competition during placements due to the strength. Whole throughout campus Wifi isnt available but only to certain places.

Name: Pranati
Review_Text: I liked the college culture rhe way they planned for wvery thing I liked the course curriculum and academics I liked the faculties explanation and their concern towards us

Name: N RITU MEGHANA
Review_Text: I didn't like one thing more intake of students while admissions while, course registration we only want to choose our faculty while, course registration having limited seats

Name: KORITALA SAI LAKSHMI
Review_Text: Humble nature of faculty Strictness I dont like. very strict college Faculties are good and teaching is also very good. And the students living in the hostel are very secured as students are allowed to go outside the campus only after parents permission and approval from proctor and supervisor.

Name: Machavarapu Venkat komal
Review_Text: The distance from girls hostel to college is 1.5km (from girls hostel) and 3km( from boys hostel) and students have to walk and in summer season it becomes very tough. And in hostels there is water scarcity in drinking water as well as in washrooms. Also there is possibility of no current sometimes which major problem specially day before exams. One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Bavana Durga Praneeth
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Raju gsm
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des I liked the knowledge level of professors...they have whole lot of knowlege and they always try to help us in every situation..The learning method is also good as they teach us through ppt also then explain the stuffs in blackboard..they are mentor .

Name: M Naga Vijay Rohit
Review_Text: Here there are so much clubs that we have lot of oppurtunities to learn and expose ourselves to any thing we have to learn.. Here the exam system is very good as all the thinks are well oriented and we don't have to go anywhere else to give the exam Here there is limited sports equipment and less number of grounds so we have to limit ouselves to play any sports

Name: Gunnam Deekshitha
Review_Text: Here there is lot of exams happening anytime so we don't get time to do anything else by our own Campus is little bit outside of main city... The first thing i liked about the college is their focus on making sure that student is consistent with his or her studies . Due to their strict attendance rules it almost becomes necessary to attend all the classes

Name: Jithendra
Review_Text: The placement cell is very active and supportive the club activities and fests have improved a lot over the years The sports infrastructure is under development . there are only 3 indoor badminton courts and the cricket and football ground are under development

Name: Srikar Punnam
Review_Text: The system of leaves and outings is very sophisticated which sometimes becomes a headache for students and causes a lot of difficulties when student has to travel There is no AC in 95 % of the classrooms due to which classes become hell for the students during the summer season All kinds of facilities which are necessary for growing child are provided

Name: Ajay J
Review_Text: fully flexible credit system let's u choose ur timetable It might be difficult to adjust to the food here Water for bath is hard water, which is not good for hair.

Name: Gowtham Reddy
Review_Text: Teaching staff is very professional and nice here. They take studies seriously not like any other engineering college. The hostel facility like water and electricity services are poor No transport services in campus area or outside of campus

Name: Aruna
Review_Text: The campus is located on highway so it is very deserted area not eacb and every facility is available here First of all there is quality of education which makes up for the fee.You definitely will learn something out in 4 years.The faculty is outstanding and world class and will help you if you need it(if you go the right faculty.) The quality of living in hostels is good. I would say one of the best in the colleges in the country. The quality of food in mess is also good. you will have a choice of no. Of beds room you meed so that your economic condition do not effect it.

Name: Jayesh Keswani
Review_Text: You have a lot of technical and non technical teams in VIT VELLORE where you can join and gain experience which comes handy in placements You have to be beware of taking black listed faculties for your course because if you didn't you will get screwed Good infrastructure and a very diverse culture

Name: Keerthana
Review_Text: Well trained and qualified faculties and staff A really good environment to study in and has many extra curricular programs  The ffcs method is not properly implemented

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The total number of people studying in vit is enormous  There may be a bit of language issue between students  Good aura and environment. Campus is quite good

Name: Yeleswarpu Vikas Narayan
Review_Text: We are allowed to choose our own timetable and theory time like we want theory in morning or in evening For internship also we are offered courses by the college itself we didn't have to do much research Very crowded campus. they give admission in many categories

Name: Pranathi
Review_Text: Mess is not good moreover hostels are also okay okay  VIT is a land of opportunity. You will get an opportunity to excel in any field you like. The extra push for placement. They care for placements.

Name: vyshnavi
