Review_Text: VIT is an cosmopolitan place. It has students from such various parts of India that you wouldn't have even heard of. FFCS which might be very unfavorable to students sometimes. Irrelevant rules , which are seriously irrelevant and annoying sometimes.

Name: Chaitra
Review_Text: The big campus , you have to walk too much . It's the college campus which is so eye catching that spending four years here will never be boring for sure. Two lovely canteens and luckily it serves non vegetarian food too so as a Bengali I will never die hungry.

Name: adya varshini
Review_Text: The quality of the students as all the students of CSE are top rankers and are indeed the best brains available on earth. Timings are very odd as we have presentations mostly after 6pm and it goes on till 9-10pm. Placement opportunities : this institutions robust placement cell.

Name: Sykam ManideepReddy
Review_Text: the campus life will be very good and also the infrastructure Lab facilitates provided at Vit Chennai are the  best and have every equipment required Overcrowding During peak hours over crowding in campus

Name: Rohith N
Review_Text: Accommodations and all the foods outlets inside the campus are very expensive Their mess food of veg mess is very bad  it taste very bad One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: A Jagadeesh
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Chavali Lokesh
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Firstly I would like to go with the curriculum of the course which is pretty much interesting. The computer science course along with the taste of mathematics enhance the development of student pretty well.

Name: Padmaraju Indhu sree
Review_Text: Faculties are very friendly and available to you anytime you need and it doesn't matter even if he/she doesn't belong to your course, they'll solve your doubts for sure. VIT is always known for its placement and internship activities mainly. They provide you PAT training before the placement sessions which truly helps you to get placed. Actually speaking, there are very less stuffs to dislike about the VIT Chennai campus.

Name: Tejaswi Gadala
Review_Text: It's hard to play in the cricket or football grounds when it rains and the ground get fully wet. There's water all over and that is one thing, physical education department needs to take care of. Although I am not a student who goes college by College bus but the early timings of some routes make it very difficult for students to make themselves completely ready for the college. Excellent hostels have made my life easy the college is 13 miles from main city and daily traveling would have made it very hectic.

Name: voonna satwik
Review_Text: Classes starts early in the morning and we have a proper gap of 2 hours in between so even though we have long schedule daily it never feels long. A special mention for college canteens as I am a North Indian and i thought I will not find my favourite dishes here but thanks to food Street cafe of college it has almost every North Indian dish. Most students are from southern states and sometimes it does get difficult to get along or find people who speak in Hindi as most students talk in their native language or English.

Name: Raghavendra Acharya
Review_Text: There are two canteens which are food Street and rock plaza and both of them provide almost every Indian dish from North to South. The campus is spread in 5 acres and have almost every facilities to make our lives comfortable. Placements are second best to IITs as our core branches such as CSE, IT, and others have seen record 100% placements for many years.

Name: Sai charan
Review_Text: There are only a few hostels inside the campus as maximum college hostels are off campus and it definitely doesn't make any sense as college is almost 10kms from those hostels. I liked about the infrastructure in university I liked about the faculty and progress in university

Name: w yatish
Review_Text: I liked about the explanation  of faculty in university evaluvation of answer sheets and giving tough question paper. I disliked about less income in placements and less placements

Name: VADAKATTU SREEKAR
Review_Text: I disliked about not giving more holidays and some strict rules I liked the faculties and their teaching experience. They are very interactive and really very helpful in clearing concepts. Some of the dedicated facilities helps you in intership and placement as well. I like the exposure I get here in VIT-AP. There are various students from all across the country and some NRIs too.

Name: M sriraj
Review_Text: The Hostels in VIT-Ap is something which I personally like a lot. The mess in the hostel is pathetic and food quality is also below par. The weather is very hot and humid here in VIT-AP

Name: Chinmaya Acharya
Review_Text: The diversity of the college is very rich and you get to interact with many people coming from different culture so your understanding of the real world get increased and u feel more confident while dealing with the people which can lead to increase The faculty are highly qualified and are PhD scholars The aluminai network is very strong which lead to good placement and internship

Name: Keerthivasan B
Review_Text: The hostel food is very worse and the student might get sick often I like the college infrastructure and design Very good sports complex including all sports

Name: Siddharth Ramanathan
Review_Text: It includes cricket football badminton etc Bad quality of sports wear and bad badminton courts The nets for cricket are bad football area

Name: Manas Rajkumar Bafna
Review_Text: Hate the intime and outtime and strictness I like the campus infrastructure and it's design It also have many sports complexs like badminton etc

Name: Pranav S
Review_Text: It's having a huge ground for cricket and football The badminton floor is single layered and slippery The cricket ground does have a proper nets to play

Name: Niranjan S Nair
Review_Text: It is too far from the city so hard to travelling on daily bases Mess food quality is good and hostel are clean I found the mental health resource insufficient and felt there was lack of diverse extracurricular activites

Name: Aravind Muddana
Review_Text: VIT offers verity of education in emerging trends which would be great for a student to aquire and serve the world. It offers a well hygenic enviroment for studying. It has high placement record. Which involves many international companies with very good salary. Also 90 % of their faculty have PhD.

Name: Krishnesh Mathur
Review_Text: Campus is very vast and need more energy to walk. Descipling is some what missing. One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: Mahendra reddy malapati
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: Abheeshek Varma Ch
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des The campus of VIT Vellore is vast and green. Something that you would appreciate during your stay in VIT is the greenery of the campus. The sky poses you for a scenic sunset often. There are quite a lot of clubs, infact you would be surprised that a club exists even for interests like anime. There are students from different parts of the world having similar interests, so it would be a safe and ideal environment to get together

Name: Aman Modi
Review_Text: With FFCS in place, more frequently than not you would miss out the courses that you wanna do or the faculty that you need to do under. Faculty's method of teaching greatly varies, choice of faculty influences the learning and grade by a huge amount Classrooms aren't up to the mark with the fees we are paying, it's absolutely exhausting during summers to manage with classes which are located kilometres away from one another There's too much crowd, to enjoy gym, sport or any other thing within campus, THERE'S JUST TOO MANY PEOPLE. It's overwhelming at times

Name: kalvapalli sai krishna reddy
Review_Text: Placement activites seem to be of no use, the training is absolutely useless. Opportunities are given but it is really difficult without any proper mentorship. Everyone are on their own which I understand to happen but a little heads up would be nice I like the infraustructute of the college as it has all needs like 5-10 lifts in each block I like the cafeteria in each block so that we can easy access the food and Printouts

Name: Abhinav
Review_Text: I like the pathways covered with trees so that the we do have shade while walking from college to hostel Our college is vast in area so we need to walk so much eaven classes in different different buldings so it hard to walk

Name: Saga Naga Sai Akhilesh
Review_Text: i dont like the management of the college as there are some rules like we cant talk with faculty about the marks we got VIT Vellore has a huge infrastructure with many courses to offer. It has many experienced faculties who are excellent at teaching.

Name: Jasan Jakku Joseph
Review_Text: It has diverse student body, strong industry connections for placements and extracurricular activities. Of the major drawbacks of VIT Vellore is crowd. There are many students enrolled in CSE which makes placements highly competitive. VIT Vellore is a little bit more strict in comparison of other private colleges.

Name: Priyanshu Dhapodkar
Review_Text: VIT Vellore is location in a small town of Vellore which makes it far from some big cities, hence students face difficulty in travelling. College campus is good, they gave good placement, hostel facilities are good coding culture is good, Some faculties are outstanding

Name: CHARUGUNDLA VISHAL
Review_Text: Management is good, green campus, education is good Very strict with respect to other colleges. Very hectic schedule and attendance problem

Name: Tanishk Yadav
Review_Text: The campus life is very good as the campus is very big with good people with no ragging (0% ragging). The friends you make are worth a lifetime alongwith studies you can also have fun The teachers are very good and supportive

Name: Tarun Deep
Review_Text: There is a huge crowd in the campus but you will be soon adjusted to it . The placements are also quite good (around 9LPA) which is on par with mid level NITs The campus size is around 200 acres and it's a big, green and beautiful campus.

Name: Abhiram Reddy
Review_Text: Strictness inside the campus: We are not allowed to go out of the campus without getting parents permission. Although I appreciate some of my professors for bein very knowledgeable in their subject, but the other facilities are just not it Various Job offers in different domains whether tech or non tech were there

Name: Rishabh Karjee
Review_Text: The social circle that gets formed as you will see a lot pf diversity in the campus as people from legit every state will be there Teachers are really well versed with what they teach. The existence of Red Tags in the campus, such pain it is

Name: Kowshik Guptha
Review_Text: So many assignments will be given that you will end up forgetting to upload them before deadlines good campus, still in construction but hoping that itll be finished by the next year or so, the faculty is great5 here every one is a phd holder and a vast knowleg the time table is verry flexible we can choose whatever subjects available to us acc. to our yeas with the option to customise our time slots for our classes and we can freely choose what teachers we want.

Name: Kartikey Tiwari
Review_Text: the college dosent discriminate between people of colour In hostles there is a frequent problem of wifi there clolege is 3 kms far from holtles (boys)

Name: Akhilesh
Review_Text: if student have free time they cant sit in mempty classes because the guards make them go away i like the studies and vast array of expertise our collage provides. i like the vast diversity of fellow students which allows us to meet different kinds of people.

Name: THORLAKONDA VENKATA SAI
Review_Text: i like the campus and all the benefits it comes with. i dislike the discrimination in girls and boys that is followed here. the outing system this one is the most hated

Name: Dhruv Sahni
Review_Text: The faculties have lots of experience and they teach quite well The mess food is better than rest of the colleges The placement network is quite good, the placements are centralised from vit vellore

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: It's about 80kilometers from bhopal, and in another city of sehore, but name still has bhopal in it You have to take the hostel from programme, no dayboarding allowed unless you stay with parents The sports facilities are very very bad here

Name: Shaurya Pratap Singh
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech

Name: Anchit Deshpande
Review_Text: I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des

Name: Akshaya chaluvadi
Review_Text: labs are good in the college , they are fully equipped with the elements there are good crowd, all the students are pretty good in studies hostel facilities are good in the hostel and mess is good

Name: PRANJAL MEHRA
Review_Text: there is a lot of culture difference , if you are from north india faculties did not teach properly , they just want to complete the syllabus there are a lot of restriction in the campus like hostel timings and you have to take permission for going out of the campus

Name: Tanishk Reddy
Review_Text: Faculties are good. Hostel foods are okay. Campus is also okay. The main thing is ffcs and cat system Management system. Too much inconvenience in terms of hostel staying.  Recently got water problem issue. No attendance criteria for 9 pointers (9 CGPA+)

Name: Sanjitha Sabba
Review_Text: No exclusive exam fees like some of the colleges Better placement rates as compared to other private colleges Restricted outings and unnecessary interruptions from wardens

Name: NAIDU TEJ BHARGAV BHARAT
Review_Text: Red Tag and disciplinary committee not at all understanding for students Language barrier makes it worse for moste of the north Indian students. I like the infrastructure of my campus , the campus is really huge , enough to roam throughout the day

Name: Ritika
Review_Text: Fully flexible credit system , this is one of the best reason to join vit. we can get to choose our faculty and timetable Diverse cultures , people join this college from all over india , you get to meet people from different backgrounds. there is no air conditioning in campus  , its terrifying in summer

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: less library capacity  , the capacity of library is very low compared to the students in the college. for over 10000 students the library capacity is just 500 fests are not so good . we have fests twice a year , but they ask money for every thing Trust me campus is amazing and so beautiful. I mean it gives you so elegant and fresh experience

Name: pallapothu komala sai krishna
Review_Text: Teachers! Most teachers are from south so it's difficult for North students to get settled. The College Crowd is Good. And the vibes are good too. The Coding and Clubs culture is very competitive and good here.

Name: Mitthinti keerthana
Review_Text: We can build are own time table so that's a good thing. We can choose when we want to go to classes and all There are Many Students so the Campus is bit crowdy to be honest. The Campus is bit small as compare to other colleges.

Name: Satyam Singh
Review_Text: The Campus is under construction so u can see building being constructed everywhere College provides good education and supports us for any kind of projects or research People from many parts of india are here so it helps us to know about them and helps to improve language

Name: PREM KUMAR
Review_Text: Good infrastructure and the one of the best thing here is library. Sometimes faculties shows favour to one they likes and gives marks to non elgibile Faculty is more helpful for writing research papers and many other aspects

Name: Yathnesh
Review_Text: We'll be having a choice to choose our professors ans slots By joining through eamcet we don't need to pay a single rupee of fee We need to move from one block to other block or different classrooms for each class

Name: Adarsh Kumar Jha
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech

Name: Shreyas Satish Borkar
Review_Text: I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des

Name: Laleeth
Review_Text: Environment in vit was good and the staff was too helpful at first Everything about this college felt in disagreement as the staff was too harsh after first day of class The campus life is good, and vibrant. The events are diverse and good. Vibrance and technoVIT are the best ones.

Name: RISHI GUPTHA
Review_Text: The facilities are good. We have access to essentials inside the college. The infrastructure is good, and the law classrooms have AC. Some faculties are good and some are bad.

Name: lakshitha nallapareddygari
Review_Text: The hot climate of chennai makes it unbearable at times. The food is okayish but nothing compares to home. The most beutiful thing about college is it's  campus. It is very lush green huge campus where there is very fresh environment.

Name: Singam Janaki Ramayya
Review_Text: Hostels are  quiet good and there are good facilities for students in hostels, rooms are cleaned properly time to time. study is also good. Teachers are very good, very polite, their way of teaching is very good and also management is also supportive classes are too far from each other. Their is half kilometer distance between some classes

Name: Duggisetty bindu sri
Review_Text: too much headache or  pressure of assignments, quizzes and especially SET conference sometime teachers peak Tamil language which is understand by outsiders Competitive culture in regards to programming and innovation.

Name: Prem
Review_Text: Fully Flexible Credit System in the college helps make a suitable time-table. Attending classes and having to change classrooms every 50 mins. Hostel wardens and strict policies, no proper communication.

Name: Allada Shiva
Review_Text: Environment of college is very nice lots of trees in the campus Study culture is very nice of this college Riveria and gravitas these are the main two events of vit

Name: Siddartha
Review_Text: In-Timing of hostels and campus is not good it is like before 9 pm get inside of the hostel Strictness of campus. teachers security guards and warden all are strict Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA

Name: Nirmal
Review_Text: Good lab equipment is provided with hands on experience with Industrial equipment, and also for research purpose they coperate very ell than any other college. The environment in VIT is very good especially, the way they care students is good, with a flexible timetable system, we can choose our class houurs . Good placement oppurtunities and for mechanical engineering also they come good number of Core oppurtunities with a good package.

Name: Girishma
Review_Text: The hostel faciliteies can be improved slightly, they mostly provide 6AC and they can focus on 4AC more. The transporation is really tough and the locals dont know hindi or english either. The hostel in and out timings were really bad, specially for women.

Name: Yaswanth
Review_Text: You can choose your faculty and timings of time table If you are having good faculties you'll get free marks You can have friends from all over the country

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: You have go through lot of procedures to get a leave/outing Lack of cleaning in hostel toilets and under construction Securities will start whistling after 6pm

Name: Bolla Lasya Reddy
Review_Text: The best thing we can choose our faculty and classes schedule for every semester. Always we are under security and safety management. The hospitality is very good , they will take care of your health.

Name: Sarikonda Mamatha Sri
Review_Text: They didn't allow to roam around campus after 9pm. College crowd is very huge and many no of students. The hostel facilities are good. Safety and security is guaranteed (for hostellers).

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Several active clubs are there and lots of co curricular activities and contests and fests. Course curriculum is good. Placement rate is 90% and if the student work hard in improving skills, they can easily get dream or super dream offers. The location is bad because it takes a lot of time to reach. And it's situated in an isolated area so students might feel like they are in a jail.

Name: Swapanthi
Review_Text: Infrastructure is not that good. It's enough but not good. Some faculties are not good but we have blacklisted such faculties One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Vidya Saurabh Mishra
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Riju Tiwari
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des the discipline regarding rules and regulation of vit vellore is the  best thing i can ever find in any college

Name: Nishita
Review_Text: the shops and facilities are provided within the campus itself and cleanliness of campus is very good and a personal guider (procter) is assigned to all of the students which is valuable for everyone. outing time of vit is very less according to me.

Name: Varun
Review_Text: for every night time outing within the campus we need to take the procter's permission which is very strict and not needed there are less facilities outside the campus(inside the vellore ) Very good atmosphere and freedom to enjoy and educate ourselves.

Name: Vijay krishna
Review_Text: Students from all around India and some foreign students enrich the atmosphere. Good infrastructure in labs, classrooms and library. Transport for dayscholars can be improved.

Name: PUNNEPU MEGHANADH
Review_Text: Cultural is best thing in vit as every student came from every state. Room Allotment process is also worst thing in vit. Mess food is also not that much good as menu of food is fixed. Not good as if u are coming from north.

Name: Potti Mokshagna
Review_Text: The tings i like about my college is that the college management is exemplary and very unique, consistently striving to enhance the educational experience. Their commitment to maintaining high standards are just exceptional The faculties at our college are the cornerstone of its academic excellence . Each member is highly qualified from various domains and have extreme knowledge and industry experiencing to the classroom. Placement at VIT Bhopal is just another milestone that attracts everyone. they have a great record for giving excellent number of placements every year.

Name: Madhubabu
Review_Text: I disliked the location of the campus, it totally cuts off us from the main ground, because its 80kms away from Bhopal and 120 (approx) from Indore. which makes it hard to travel , if in need of something or Finding railway station or Airport. Hostel management is not that good, like there is scarcity of water and electricity (sometimes)and the main thing is network, being far from main remote area so we didn't get enough speed for internet and wifi in hostels way too low. they don't have upto the mark sanittation here, like the cleaners usually forgets to clean corridors properly and skip cleaning rooms too.

Name: MD Sohail
Review_Text: Modern Faciliites, The classrooms are nice There are many events and activites happening Every class is equiped with projectors and ventilated rooms

Name: MATTA NAGA JYOTHI KRISHNA SAI TARUN
Review_Text: The administration is not that good currently Some amenities can be improved and worked on The campus is really pretty and eco friendly. Very calm for a walk

Name: Meghana
Review_Text: Provided with alot of food places like Domino's No dress code so we can dress prettily but it shud be modest The weather sometimes get too hot and humid but when it rains it's cold but after rain it gets hot

Name: tanmayi
Review_Text: they have fully flexible credit system that is you can choose your own faculty. the campus is green and big, and food shops are available at every corner. you can choose your subjects every semester and there is no compulsion as you have to complete a 150 or 160 credits in 4 years.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: in time for girls is 8 pm and boys is 9 pm to go out of the campus you need permission from parents hostel and proctor, and a very long procedure and you can go outing only for 6 hours. Good educational environment.We have a choice to choose our own faculty through FFCS system which is very advantageous.

Name: SHASHANK SHEKHAR
Review_Text: Social cultural Clubs .We can join whatever Club we are interested in. Vibrant mix of cultures available at the campus. Kinda strict.Campus  life must be made much more flexible.

Name: LALA
Review_Text: Outing procedures are strict and for certain hours limit. Overpriced commodities are sold at the campus. Infrastructure : The college infrastructure is very good, including the hostels and the academic blocks. Every corner of the campus is very pretty and the environment is peaceful. The academic blocks, especially the library is well structured.

Name: Anshul
Review_Text: Grading system : The college has a "Relative Grading" system, where a student's performance is assessed by the class performance as a whole. This avoids any bias in grading the papers. Clubs and Chapters : The college has numerous clubs and Chapters in which every student can take part. There is a healthy competition among these clubs and it's a wonderful environment to grow. No student body : There is no student elected "Student Body" in order to place our concerns to the management. There is absolutely no way for the students to place concerns to the management that they'll actually act upon.

Name: Naman Kundan
Review_Text: Academics is very good. The college particularly focuses on the academic and made it very strict. Students with scores greater that 9 gpa have benefits which makes us competitive to be better and study well than gooding around. Provides elective courses, languages and other social courses which makes us gain knowledge on prospects other than Btech. Have all the lab facilities and infrastructure.

Name: Nikhil kumar
Review_Text: Very strict. College is unnecessarily strict in a few things which makes us feel suffocated sometimes. Hostels are not up to the standard for the fee we pay. Boys get better facilities in hostels than girls Need to focus more on co curricalr activities and fun that we are supposed to have in college.

Name: Harsavardhanan  K V
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech

Name: Aditya Pradhan
Review_Text: I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des

Name: Ayushman Rai
Review_Text: The college is still in its developing phase as it was opened in 2017 only . Heavy expense on the expenditure and a lot of leisure activites are planned for students. The campus is full of greenery. The average class size is around 70 to 120 and for each subject there are group tasks that decides your grades so they care about healthy social interactions of the students. 100% doctrol faculty so there is no way we are taught by some great mentors over here .Everyone is mindful of their job and there way is teaching is fabulous

Name: Krish Tiwari
Review_Text: The curriculum is still developing with the years passing by but it still affects us in some way . basically it is still not fixed and it keeps on changing for every batch of students The Placement is not as good as you think but I can assure you it is better than the other colleges and at the end it all depends on your hard work The infrastructure and the campus as a whole is great, the academic buildings are great.

Name: Harsh Yadav
Review_Text: The placement opportunities offered by the campus is great The ffcs system gives you the opportunity to choose teachers and courses you like and also helps you meet new people The hostel system is very poor due to the living conditions

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Due to the everchanging classes due to ffcs, you get new people in classes everytime. Faculties Placement cell

Name: Sarmad Sultan
Review_Text: The infrastructure of the college is very nice Clubs provide a wide range of diverse cultural activities The exposure provided by the college is good

Name: Avishkar Jaiswal
Review_Text: Sometimes there are too much restrictions regarding the timings Techno-Cultural Fests Every Academic Year Good Faculties and Relative Grading, Able to Make my own Time Table

Name: Aryan Bhardwaj
Review_Text: Selection of Students for ranking is random sometimes Study environment is very good and healthy All facilities are doctorate and good teaching

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Collage life is not so good here. Many restrictions are there. As the right now is in construction phase so there are some problem to be faced in hostel or in campus Placement are not so good here. Super dream package is about 15 lakh.

Name: College Ninja
Review_Text: We'll be getting internships mails regularly and it's has a very good placement training wing Courses for the freshers are not planned well and hostel food was not good Placements are great, all the faculty are very interactive

Name: Priyanshu Kanyal
Review_Text: College labs are great and easily accessible Ffcs means fully functional credit system which gives freedom to choose courses wo need Hostels are worst no proper drainage in block 5 boys hostel the water flows openly becoming breeding ground for mosquitoes

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Water is big issue drinking water is very big issue Food quality changes if no official is present in college Faculty is good they care about students and most of they teach well

Name: Yashwant Sahoo
Review_Text: Hostels are nice they are new build and clean manitance Food is like below average and in some hostels it is worst Infrastructure is not upto mark it may take time to build nice.

Name: Subhra Bhattacharjee
Review_Text: The fully flexible credit system which really helps me to choose my teachers and slot so that i can make my time table according to me College fest are really nice which are organised by different clubs specially the annual fest advitya Their category system through which students which did not perform well in thier competative exams can also take admission in the college

Name: Parmeshwar Rajan
Review_Text: The fines as they charge fines for almost every single small mistaked and the behaviour of the guards The campus as boys have to walk aprox 1.5 km from hostel to academic block each time which roughly takes around 20 mins as we expected One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Yash Verma
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Anurag choudhary
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des College has ffcs means fully functional credit system which helps students to get their choice of courses and teachers and also the time table

Name: Thomas K Joshan
Review_Text: They use CALTech which means collaborative and active learning teachnology which is great as classes will be interactive not a one man speaking Boys walk almost 15 kms every day as boys hostel is very far from academic blocks Our hostel block boys hostel block 5 is beside dump yard of our college and here drainage flows out and as I stay in ground floor atleast 40 to 50 mosquitoes will be in every room

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Food quantity and quality changes according to the visiting of some important people in hostels When I came here for my second year first sem we were given a hostel in which nothing is constructed fully , no proper washrooms, no water for drinking, no safety nothing. Great faculty and good environment to study.

Name: Avi Jain
Review_Text: Good amount of companies are coming to recruit freshers. Placement training is on point and each and every topic is discussed regarding the recruitment. Way more freedom is given to the students.

Name: ANIKETH KAUSHIK KRISHNAN
Review_Text: Timings of the course classes could be more flexible. Could provide more aur conditioners and good internet connection in the campus. Environment and the teachers and best is ffcs

Name: Yash
Review_Text: I liked the infrastructure of college very much. I also liked the faculty very much as they are very experienced and very friendly, they are helpful in every aspect and they also try to help you whenever possible. Clubs and Chapters in our college are very useful. They help us to mingle with many students. The weather of Amaravathi and Guntur is very humid. It is very difficult to live in these kind of conditions in summer season.

Name: Dhana
Review_Text: As we have FFCS( Fully Flexible Credit system) where we can choose our faculty and slots that we want our subjects to have them in, Some times when the website doesn't work while course registration, we are left with strict faculty who can fail us. The campus is huge and clean. The clout here is very great The college gives you a lot of opportunities for placements and internships.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The faculty are experienced and they teach well.  The curriculum is only of important subjects which will be used in places in real life. The campus is very huge which means you have to walk a lot and it is very tiring. The place where the college is located will be very hot and humid.  You can't live without an ac.

Name: Abhyanand Sharma
Review_Text: Most of the super dream companies which come for placement take only one or two students from the college. The best thing about mechanical Engineering is very less number of students Infrastructure is good and hands on experience facilities available

Name: Roshmik
Review_Text: 100% Placement for mechanical engineering You have to leave academic campus after 6pm if you don’t have class , you can’t Rome with your friends after 6 Hostel in timings is 8:30PM , you can’t go outside your hostel after 8:30

Name: Prashant Singh
Review_Text: The faculty is good, they are friendly and professionals. They help with doubts and are very helpful and provide great guidance The hostel rooms are spacious with all basic necessities available. The food in the hostel mess is the worst except the breakfast.

Name: Aryan ojha
Review_Text: Very restrictive about rules and regulations Can't even use kettle or iron in the room and they confiscate 'maggi" The College is nice and supportive for the students . Institute provides good teachers who are always ready to clear the concepts even in midnight.

Name: Kollipara Monish Sai Gopi
Review_Text: The College has a very nice and beautiful campus and good mess facility for hostellerrs The College offers many opportunities like startup incubation, research etc. The Competition level is high due to large no. of students

Name: Deependra Mewada
Review_Text: The 9 pm in time for hostellerrs is little annoying Campus Life : amazing campus, huge buildings Hostels: very clean, amaazing place to stay

Name: Sathvik Guptha
Review_Text: Restrictions on outings:Restriction on outing times Campus intime hours:girls have intime of 7 pm inside the campus Number of companies came for internships, every week there is a student seminar series where student can come express their views in front of a huge audience on any technical, non-technical topic,number of hackathon conducted here

Name: Satarupa Mishra
Review_Text: Always getting support from faculties to go through different research papers and write or patent a new one Placement cell  is very supportive and they will be allowing equal opportunities to everyone as there is a transperancy in the placement process The online platform vtop usually crashes in the time when almost every student logs in it

Name: Amar biru nemane
Review_Text: Hostel mess is not that much good ,it's average Hostel fees is not constant, they can change the way they want One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Naga Sai Vignesh Macha
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Aditya Mishra
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Having a good competitive environment to study in

Name: Arnav
Review_Text: Good cultural society in the college as it has many clubs related to almost everything Too much strictness in the hostel as one cannot even keep any electronic as small as speaker Greenery, the college is very green. It feels nice when you go out

Name: Navin
Review_Text: All facilities are there, like in hostels if there is a problem they'll sort it out within a day Faculty is nice, they wanna help the student but they are a more biased towards south indian students especially Tamil The college is very strict, there are too many rules and if you don't follow them, they won't let you go easy

Name: Aditya Srivastava
Review_Text: The curriculum, the subjects that they give in a single semester are really tough. the Infrastructure of the college is pretty nice and  they are still making new academic buildings, the  size of campus is decent. If you maintain decent  Cgpa  (8.5) , you will easily get a decent package in placement and reputation of this college is also good

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: If you are passionate enough in your course and have good cgpa, then college will give you a lot of opportunities , like one of my friend from CSE core branch is going to taiwan of summmer internship , nad he got it through a collage faculty. there are lot of rules and regulations in the college and often hostel students feel suffocated as you cant go out of hostel after 8 (for girls) and after 9(for boys). you cant go out of college if you are hosteller  without permission  from your procter ( it is a faculty the is assigned to you when you join the college), and procter will call your parents before granting you permission.

Name: Rohit Pilakhwal
Review_Text: the tution  fess is very high in this college  and hostel fees is also high for a missle class student, for4 bed AC you have to pay 107000 only for room  and 78K  for beg mess, which is not worth it. Placements opportunities are too good when compared to other colleges Lot of places to eat food for all different region people

Name: Aayush Emmanuel
Review_Text: Having cultural events where we can enjoy a lot Hostel food is not so good, it was difficult to eat Too much restricted rules and we should obey them

Name: Deepika Reddy
Review_Text: Need to follow lot of procedure and permissions for outing Seniors Don'T Take Ragging And Are Very Helpful Cultural Fest When They Invited Mohit Chauhan For Live Performance

Name: Shailesh Mishra
Review_Text: The Rules For Hostellers. Even They  Are Not Allowed To Bring Home Food Some Egoistic Faculties Which Only Care About Their Reputation Rather Than Childs Career The freedom it is giving to its students is amazing.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: I like the opportunity of doing the extra curricular activites more than the academics. Greenery around the campus gives a peacful environment. Classes are well equiped with smartboards.

Name: Yogi khokrale
Review_Text: Too much crowd almost everyday the whole campus is full. Numerous courses and specializations under each departments (CSE, ECE etc) Open course selection slots for students

Name: Aayush Anand
Review_Text: Campus is clean with sufficient infrastructure and transport facilities Strict attendance criterion - 75% for exams One best thing about VIT is the environment, it's just amazing as heaven. I feel very relaxed inside my campus which lets me to focus more on my academics

Name: Kamal
Review_Text: The cleanliness inside the campus is just like wow á The faculties are very friendly and encouraging which keeps us motivated all the time One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Pravin kumar R
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Mettipalem Phani  Madhav
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des You can select your teachers for each subject

Name: Sarveshwaran R
Review_Text: Last year almost 900+ companies came here for interviews Your faculty itself will evaluate your internals, even sem exams. So you can’t mess with your faculty While selecting course we won’t get the selected courses and faculties as we planned because the slots will get full

Name: Ashutosh Singh
Review_Text: Study oriented, full focus on acdemics.  Co-curriculars encourgaed too. Focus on latest developments and fields and giving many opportunities. Various stidy abroud and semester exchange programs if you would like the opportunity.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: You need to walk a lot in the campus itself for everything as vehicles are not allowed. We can choose our teachers in our academics. There is many  clubs in Vit which helps to gain more knowledge.

Name: Sarthak Sunil ATre
Review_Text: The environment is very beautiful and natural. I'm a 1st year student so i need a more view on this, but i can say the college is good to educate, discover, and to entertain has a good infrastructure with different block designs

Name: Shailesh
Review_Text: might be the distance between many blocks hostel foods are okayish, i heard which they shld look after The security at VIT AP University ensures the safety of students, faculty, and staff on campus. They patrol the premises and monitor entry points to maintain a secure environment.No one can enter to the college with permission from the security.

Name: Rohit Yadav
Review_Text: The teachers at VIT AP University are really smart and helpful. They teach us a lot of things and are always there to answer our questions. The canteen at VIT AP University offers a variety of food options for students and staff. It serves meals, snacks, and beverages at affordable prices. It was really good. Good quality and quantity food is provided at low cost At VIT AP, there's no air conditioning in some areas.

Name: A S SRI SAI DUTT
Review_Text: If any person failed in an exam, they have to pay ₹6000 to complete supplement exam. Some students feel that the lack of air conditioning and certain amenities at VIT AP can be drawbacks. FFCS enables us to chose our course structure and teachers according to our plan

Name: Shreyash Belgaonkar
Review_Text: The course curriculum is relevant to the latest trends AC classrooms are required to overcome the heat in summers, which are not provided Food other than mess is quite costly according to me

Name: Ankush
Review_Text: Accessibility is not good, as it takes around 40 mins to get to vijayawada Behave the best architecture in the college and we have the spacious classrooms. We have excellent laboratories I am we have best library ever it's around to Acer of library we have digital library and normal library.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: We have the best campus placements on an average of we can get 6 lakhs The campus management has to improves maintenance The selfie and the hostel food have to change the taste need to be change

Name: Akhand Pratap Singh
Review_Text: The more real time projects has to improve in the campus. Overall campus experience is good. Also known as green campus , the campus is magnificent when seen from a drone point of view and greenery is observed from every corner. Smart technologies like fingerprint sensors and face detectors are used for attendance and permission purposes

Name: MD SAKIB
Review_Text: Seniors and faculty members are helpful ; clubs , chapters and special teams and beneficial for technical skills and growth . Wifi speed is below 20 Mbps , sometimes even worse , using mobile data is preferential Only for hostellers , Proctor permission is necessary for outing  which requires a verification from parents

Name: Nishant
Review_Text: Hostel in time is 9pm for boys and 8pm for girls I like placements offered in the college I like infrastructure adn all proffessors way of teaching.

Name: Sourabh
Review_Text: Nothing Best infrastructure building are good Library is very excellent and looks like a beautiful

Name: Pankaj Khilar
Review_Text: Lab facility available for all courses and subject Travel distance is too long it takes much time No cultural for specific department and source

Name: Vidit Pachauri
Review_Text: Best time but takes more time for all classes One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: Nischal Katara
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: Ketan Eknath Pathade
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Library is so good and good environment for all Fees is very less compared to other college no additional fees

Name: Devang Soni
Review_Text: Placement is very good you get more company for recruitment Bus facility not available need to travel long distance Canteen price are very high need to bring own lunch

Name: Animesh Anand
Review_Text: Walking distance is very long for one class to another Placement is very good you can definitely place if you have skills Money matters and faculty also not good and bad

Name: Namish Srinivas
Review_Text: Library which is very beautiful place to learn Labs are very good and you can learn any software in that Class rooms and gallery are available to showcase your studies

Name: Rakshita
Review_Text: Canteen cost is high and you need to search for best Travel from one block to another is so long You need to complete 10 digital assignment for one subject

Name: Aviral Singh
Review_Text: VIT is known for its excellent academic programs and faculty members who are experts in their fields. Students appreciate the quality of education they receive, which prepares them well for their future careers. The campus infrastructure at VIT is impressive, with state-of-the-art facilities including modern classrooms, well-equipped laboratories, libraries, sports complexes, and comfortable accommodation for students. VIT encourages students to participate in extracurricular activities such as clubs, sports, cultural events, and community service. This holistic approach to education helps students develop leadership skills, teamwork, and a well-rounded personality

Name: Bandi Deeraj Reddy
Review_Text: Some students may find the curriculum at VIT to be too rigid or structured, with limited flexibility in course selection or opportunities for interdisciplinary study. The academic workload at VIT can be demanding, especially during exam periods or when multiple assignments are due simultaneously. Some students may find it challenging to balance their academic responsibilities with other activities. Due to the rigorous academic schedule and focus on studies, some students may feel that they have limited time for socializing or extracurricular activities outside of their academic commitments.

Name: Sriram charan
Review_Text: Campus infrastructure and technologies available in vit. Sports and extra curricular activities are liked by me I like library. Because in Library lot of new books are available

Name: Suryansh Rai
Review_Text: Facilities in classrooms and labs very well compare to other colleges Culturals and events are happened every month We have large library . In library, It has more than 5000 books

Name: Abhijit
Review_Text: The crowd in bio metric . While going outside we used to give bio metric every day that time crowd is high Some events occur in SJT ground and that time we can't play. Campus infrastructure  is very great and nice

Name: Arav
Review_Text: Curriculum  and course structure is very good Placemenrs is very good  in vit compared to other. Have to walk to different blocks for dofferent classes

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Classes  may happen in different bloacks Sometimes the collage feels bit crowded. The thing that I liked more in vit is to do what we want in inside the campus

Name: Lakshit Doyal
Review_Text: Ther is lot of sports facilitis lik we have basket ball courts etc., I like greenes in our vit campus such a wonderful things ever Things that students my dislike is morning 8.0 clock class

Name: Ashutosh Kumar
Review_Text: May be we have classes on all over the campus Attendance should me maintained up to 75 percent Good staff and labs, good placement assistance

Name: Piyush Agrawal
Review_Text: Atmosphere in collage is very great and filled with lot of opportunites. we need to take the required things and we have to imrove overself. The library is very great , which contains more than 60000 books , also they frequently adding more and more books . Course Curriculum and faculty way of teaching is great. with advanced tools and techniques.

Name: Achal Tripathi
Review_Text: college is crowd more time. we need to wait for the lift. Some classes will happen in differnet blocks we have to walk to different blocks which is very difficult. classes in different blocks is so much difficult

Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. Name: SHAIK THOUFIC SOHAIL
Review_Text: Classrooms are very good because all the classes are smart classes only Library, which is the best part in this college Studying environment also so good in our accademy

Name: Dhanush Ram
Review_Text: Exam timings are very less because we'll write eams for 50 marks in minimum time student behaviour is good compared to other college faculty are very talented in teaching and make us indulge in technical aspects

Name: Vishnu Vardhan Reddy Pothireddy
Review_Text: you will not be in trouble for coming late to college for each class we should change the classes because of the slot maintaining college timing is very difficult

Name: Pradeep Kumar Jogu
Review_Text: there is at least 3 to 4 hours gap between lab and theory class Enormous variety of options for courses and departments Clubs and events are have you jo options to join an explore your talent

Name: Udaykrishna
Review_Text: The cultural events are celebrated as like as festivals that you can't forget the memory If you are failed to clear your subject you should pay 6000 for subject to clear. You may get some work load and pressure by by the air plans of academic calendar and for a semester

Name: Harsh Shukla
Review_Text: Fame of the college.. whenever I say I am student of vit I get good name Sports it needs more improvement and should be encouraged Classrooms well furnished and maintained

Name: Suryansh Behal
Review_Text: The buildings are Good and in Attractive manner Academic pressure given by the faculties The lake inside the campus which is smelly

Name: KONGANAPALLI SATHVIK
Review_Text: Here we will get the practical experience. Apart from course you will get the lots of good experience in college Vit will keep the college update to new technology

Name: Manoj
Review_Text: Because of college has lots of strength you will not get the course in time Arrear fee if you kept arrear in one subject you need to redo that subject again this sem We will get time to explore because of college timing class starts at 8

Name: Govind Sikri
Review_Text: Environment and Nature inside the campus Laboratory and secure resources availability Library  and accessibility of the library resources

Name: Tapan Batla
Review_Text: Parking facility is not good needs improvement No separate spaces for having lunch boxes Fee structure for extra ciricular  activities

Name: Kishore V R
Review_Text: I will like the campus infrastructure and facilities The management is very good he have any queries he taken quicks and solved quickly. And I like the faculty he friendly faculty

Name: Dileep
Review_Text: Campus, food, fests, professors, canteens Hard exams and marking criterias, strict attendance rules The campus infrastructure and  atmosphere was excellent. The campus was surrounded with lots of greenery which makes the campus cool.

Name: Keshav Sharma
Review_Text: Vit provides a lot of chances to showcase your skills in different types of Events. and they even conduct many Hackathon's and more events. The curriculum is good when compared will other colleges.    As, the college is large (372 acres) it is difficult to walk every time to different blocks.

Name: Sreejon Mondal
Review_Text: The security system is very strict in this college. The Hostel students are not permitted outside the campus more than 4 hrs. One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Aryan Yadav
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Parth Sharma
Review_Text: The sports facility were great which gave you opportunities to play various sports The library was very helpful during the exams as it had various books which were helpful during the exams. The only thing i wasnt satisfied with the college was there were no AC classrooms as it is difficult to survive during theory classes, but labs were well equipped with ACs.

Name: Samir Sahu
Review_Text: There were standard water filters which provided us with normal water in the academic blocks Everything is properly systematically arranged and operated The clubs and chapter section is very good for personal and professional growth

Name: DEV TYAGI
Review_Text: Very good and helping placement cell which helps to get the best offers for everyone The number of students studying there is huge People coming from North might feel a very lil language barrier

Name: vishayan baruah
Review_Text: the environment there which is green and peaceful library- we have books in e form and also the library is huge with all books faculty members are super friendly and help us grow in carrier wise

Name: Aditya
Review_Text: Lush and Green campus with lots of facilities like gardens, lakes, food courts etc FFCS and the faculties of college who are very supporting in nature Course structure and curriculum are fully placement oriented

Name: Bhuvnesh Bhardwaj
Review_Text: The location of university is very far from city of Bhopal Bad behaviour of Security Gaurds with students The management of the VIT Bhopal is not good

Name: Daksh
Review_Text: Every child is taken care and no child is left behind The teachers provide exceptional teaching experience to the students Vit make sures children accomplish their goals

Name: Adwait Inamdar
Review_Text: The only drawback of VIT is it is overcrowded There are not many reasons to claim vit is bad There might not be any other reason to not study in VIT

Name: Arnav Sheoran
Review_Text: Culture and connections you get with the people There are many events are curriculum offered other than studies The teaching staff are exceptional with utmost perfection

Name: Tadi Chinna Kaseeswar Reddy
Review_Text: The only drawback VIT has is that it is overcrowded Hostels and accommodation are only provided to the toppers and not for the average students The highest package may be 1.2 crore but packages above 10LPA are offered only for the good grade students

Name: Parth shah
Review_Text: Campus infrastructure well equipped labs Extensive source of both academics and extracurricular activities The campus also offers a vibrant student community

Name: Aathmika V
Review_Text: One thing that I definitely agree on is that the faculty overall is quite qualified with everyone holding a Phd I think the placement opportunities are quite good as well as all the MAANGs visit the campus The University is a bit too strict on its rules and regulations such as its hostel in timmings, outing formalities and strict attendace policy

Name: Pritish Bhatasana
Review_Text: Since the campus is still well under construction there are powercuts twice or thrice a week Infrastructure is too good ,well developed library. Teaching faculty are good they are teaching is explained with technical and partical situation.

Name: Rajarshi Somvanshi
Review_Text: Clubs and chapters are also good for an individual to develop their own perspective ideas  Always the campus is undergoing with construction. One library is not sufficient for the people of the university

Name: Amartya Ranjan
Review_Text: Sports of the campus should be developed  Supporting Faculties and friends + Events Blacklisted Faculty + too much competition + Jealousy factor

Name: Asmit bisht
Review_Text: Campus of VIT BHOPAL is too good with greenery everywhere. Vit bhopal have 100% doctoral faculty with diversity in them. Placement percentage of VIT BHOPAL is good as compared to other private colleges.

Name: Piyush Raj
Review_Text: Hostel facilities are less privileged here. Campus here is too much crowded increasing the competition. Classrooms are not having air conditioner

Name: sahil kumar
Review_Text: I like the culture and academic schedule and sports activities of the college. We can choose our faculty for particular subject. There is relative  marking in the exams.

Name: Kartikey Khanna
Review_Text: Rules of not going out after 8:30 pm of hostel. Maggi is not allowed in the hostel for students. The thing I liked most about the VIT Bhopal University is the faculty. They are really helpful.

Name: ANISH ANIL SHENDE
Review_Text: Second thing I liked the most about vit bhopal campus is the infrastructure. Last but not the least I liked are the clubs offered and clubs activities. The thing I dislike about the VIT Bhopal campus is the road during the rainy season.

Name: Udayvardhan Singh Rathore
Review_Text: Second thing about which I am bit disappointed is related to WiFi.The hostel has WiFi but sometimes they don't give very high speed. A lot of extracurricular activities are available for the students. Hostel food is very good and variety available there.

Name: Abhishek Kumar Verma
Review_Text: Campus placement is very good more than 80 percent students got placed A lot of pressure on students so they don't have free time. As this college situated in south India we have to face some difficulties.

Name: Deepank arya
Review_Text: Always more preference given to 9 pointers. i liked the placement of the college like many companies visit here and some big companies like microsoft amzaon visit i liked 2+2 year program here you can study two years here and after two years  you ccan apply for two year program our college has MOU with many reputed universities

Name: HEMRISHI BHANSALI
Review_Text: i liked the faculty here they are very supportive in every aspect they help students if they are facing problems college is far away from main city there is nothing around the college we have exams every 40  days in my opinion thats not good we get pressurized we dont get time for any other skill

Name: Shashank Dwivedi
Review_Text: I liked the overall environment of the campus, the faculties and the students. The kindness of each faculty will help us to grow I like that the college appoints mentors to train the students

Name: Varshank Singh
Review_Text: The culture of the students, they are not well in relationship Public transportation is not good in that area Some faculties are not good because they intentionally fail the students

Name: Vinayak Pathak
Review_Text: exposure is very nice in the colllege with the good  infrastructure campus life is good but filled with some restrrictions thing is hostel timming which should be not three

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: hostel timing is not at all liked  by the students strict pda rules which are not even considered no late nigth things could be enjoyed easily

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The friendly and welcoming environment of the campus Advanced infrastructure and helpfull staff Flexible and student friendly syllabus system

Name: Sai Sandeep
Review_Text: Too much crowd inside the campus and hostel Some staffs rude behaviour (mostly North Indian staffs) I like the campus, the greenery that we have here is magnificent and it is very good to see

Name: ganta teja
Review_Text: I like the ffcs system with that I can choose any slot i want to take so it is quite efficient I like the system is 9 cgpa is a person has 9cgpa he can give the attendence even below 75 % so it is quite good The food stalls that we have here have no hygeine that I hate

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Few guards are so rude to us that we want to slap them but we control ourselves Few lab assistants available there is not worthy of being there as they do not even know what they are doing I liked the placement results and CALTech

Name: Marapatla Paul Jonas Jaideep
Review_Text: Some Faculty are very good and some are worse Quality of mess food is overall better than other universities. Facilities provided in hostels and academic

Review_Text: The whole campus is in construction site Provided Water Quality and Internet/Network Issue One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: sreepathi satvik
Review_Text: The staffs help us in each and everyway possible The Hostel Guards help us with shifting and small problems The food is not cheap i.e according to quantity it's not cheap

Name: Karthik kommeneni
Review_Text: The distance between the college and the hostel is around 1.8kms There are restrictions as to how long you can stay outside your room There are very good fests that happen in college.

Name: Yaswanth Bopparaju
Review_Text: Infrastructure is very good in college. We have 6 men's hostel, 2 women's hostel, 3 academic block Faculty is very supportive of new ideas and teaches in such a way that makes up friendly with real life problems. There is a curfew timing in hostels, which is disliked by every student as it is very less.

Name: Agraharapu yaswanth
Review_Text: The college is very far away from the main city, i.e. Vijaywada. Time table is flexible from 2nd year, but in 1st year, some students have classes from 9AM in morning to 7:30PM in evening. Lot of events happen around , you could enjoy a lot get more free time od and stuffs.

Name: Adithya
Review_Text: If you are a 9 pointer u can bunk classes as much as u need Then it’s clubs , you have tons of clubs you could just join one and do stuffs if you want Feel’s restricted, the security here is like as if u are inside a jail

Name: Raj Sreekar
Review_Text: The opportunities provided like hackathons, events, tech events, sports opportunities and etc.  The social life. The campus is very feiendly and seniors are extremely helpful and friendly.  The faculty is student friendly and helps the studenrs whenever needed. They are also very understanding

Name: VARANASI SAI LIKITHA
Review_Text: The size of the campus is huge and though that might seem like a good thing, its stressful and tiring over the time The campus is very crowded and theres always competition for even the little things like taking a shuttle (bus) to move around the campus Campus is very big and full of greenery.

Name: udit narayana
Review_Text: Hostels are well maintained. Campus is very clean. Labs and library are very well equipped with facilities that are needed Non teaching faculty might not understand English. They will ask you to speak in Tamil

Name: Abhinavam Sankara Shravan
Review_Text: Some mess are not good. Good mess might be in a different hostel block so we will have to travel there for meals Outing for girls is very limited and highly restricted Faculties are cooperative and interactive with students.

Name: AHAMAD SHAIK
Review_Text: The infrastructure and security is quite good with provide a better campus loge to students. The fests are quote fun. Hostel life is also enjoyable. The management is a bit strict especially for girl students.

Name: varanasi krishna deepesh
Review_Text: The campus infrastructure is really good . Here we have various blocks CB (The most vibrant building),AB1 ,AB2, Rockplaza ,Food street, etc Sports facilities are really good and well equipped with best courts for basketball, badminton ,squash, etc. For every indoor and outdoor sports is available here and also we have coach to guide. It's location campus situated in outskirts area 20 km from vijayawada which makes less communicable between college and city.

Name: B Sai Akarsh
Review_Text: There category fee system for the same branch whether student from category 1 or category 5 will get same facilities. Campus life , gym facilities, canteens and infrastructure Construction is being carried out everywhere and everytime in the campus

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: I liked the atmosphere of the college in general. The college organises a lot of extracurricular activities Multiple sports grounds and various equipment are available.

Name: J SURYA SATHVIK
Review_Text: Academic schedule is relatively hectic with more than 15 lectures per week. North Indian candidates face hurdles as the companies which come for placements prefer Tamil speaking candidates sometimes. There are strict rules for hostel students.

Name: S Madhan Sai
Review_Text: Campus: the campus is huge with everything one can imagine, ranging from swimming pools, to gyms, to social clubs, etc Seniors: The seniors were the most friendly at VIT and guided me through everything Professors: The professors are very understanding and proficient in their respective subjects

Name: keshav jha
Review_Text: Food: the food was not always well cooked and sometimes totally blant Warden: the hostel warden behaviour is not good and is very restricted Substance abuse: a lot of students and dealers are there who are trying to sell substances
