Name: Saksham Bajpai
Review_Text: 80 percentage attendance should be there . There is still construction works are going. Because of assignments and record works there is some stress

Name: Ashwin J R
Review_Text: The curriculum is well build and flexible according to the students need There are a lot of physical activities present in our campus Annual fest in our college is organized very grandly

Name: Anshu Rathor
Review_Text: College is a bit overcrowded with 14000+ people in the campus You dont have much night life in campus . You are supposed to be inside the hostel by 8:30 Management is not that good with so many people . Weather is also very bad

Name: UJWALA RAJESH GURMULEY
Review_Text: Specially infrastructures are too good . Specially teachers are very specific and good Up to dates in technologies specialization in btech

Name: Juilee Deshpande
Review_Text: Too strict for students we can go anywhere till 5 Too much you can say securities in our college Sometime we have didn't get properly water facilities in my college

Name: Santhosh
Review_Text: Placements were the best part about this college, you would get a good package compared to many colleges in AP The infrastructure was also decent and we can find many things we need within the campus. About courses they are very best that you will find very useful about the courses that college providing

Name: Rithvik Pabbati
Review_Text: They were very strict rules . Rules are good but some unnecessary rules are becoming very problematic which irritate us very much The food in hostel was not that good and if you to eat in canteen it would be costly. The prices here are high no cost effective If student get any problem regarding any issue it would much time to get resolved it need to be improved

Name: Saravana Kumar S
Review_Text: Hostel facility is better compared to the rest of the hostels ive been in. Professors are good, most of them are good. It follows FFCS time table system. That really give talented people an edge.

Name: KRITIKA SAINI
Review_Text: This college is always under construction. This could be quite overwhelming for people who are not used to crowds Temperature makes it difficult and makes you lazy.

Name: Ekansh Sukla
Review_Text: beautiful campus                           diversity less crowded                    than  vit vellore greenery                            as well as clean

Name: Syed peer
Review_Text: dogs                                     i hate them language                              but we manage ffcs priority to day scholars but never mind

Name: Nithin
Review_Text: VIT Chennai boasts modern infrastructure equipped with state-of-the-art facilities including well-equipped laboratories VIT Chennai celebrates diversity and fosters a vibrant campus life with a wide range of cultural, sports Heavy Workload: Some students may find the academic workload at VIT Chennai to be challenging and demanding

Name: Harshul Gupta
Review_Text: Limited Campus Amenities: While VIT Chennai offers a range of facilities, some students may feel that certain amenities The bustling campuses of VIT provide students with a lively and enriching experience of campus life. Events ranging from sporting competitions and club activities to cultural festivals and events are always taking place to keep students interested  Numerous prestigious companies often hire students from VIT, demonstrating the university's high placement record.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: To assist prospective business owners in transforming their concepts into profitable endeavors, the institution provides mentorship programs, startup competitions, and incubation facilities. Class sizes at VIT can occasionally be enormous due to the high enrollment rate, which could result in less customized attention from faculty members. Not everyone may thrive in VIT's competitive academic atmosphere. Some students could experience severe academic pressure, which can cause worry and anxiety.

Name: Haseeb Zaki
Review_Text: Students are obliged to abide by specific rules and regulations at VIT, which may feel onerous to some. Curfews, clothing codes, and disciplinary actions are a few examples of this. All the faculties are cooperative, supportive. The campus is made Ragging free. It makes comfortable for fresher.

Name: Aahana
Review_Text: Classes are well designed, infrastructure is modern and adapted modern technologies. Had to walk to Academic block from hostel which is approx. 2kms at atime. Every event has fees for participation in event.

Name: Arunava Sikder
Review_Text: Campus is still developing, will develop completely soon. Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: Manjith
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Campus life. The campus life here is happening. Ragging free campus. There is zero ragging, in reality too. The seniors here are cooperative.

Name: Ashish Raj
Review_Text: Opportunities for varies Hackathons and such events. The college is 50 km away from Bhopal city. There is no place here to go for outing except Bhopal Too many restrictions to go out of the Campus. Only 2 outing leaves are allowed per month here.

Name: Hardik Singh
Review_Text: The campus is still under construction, many things are still not properly done. Like this college good frienly and extracurricular Looking forward good people añd good atmosphere

Name: Vidhan
Review_Text: Hoste good atmosphere çleaning good atmosphere Ño Dislike different attachment for women No dislikes only college memories always like this college

Name: Rajesh V
Review_Text: Dislikes I miss good  momery and friends It is a huge campus. So many things are there to learn here. Good teaching faculty It is great infrastructure. Campus life is very good. Fee structure is also not more

Name: DEVESH
Review_Text: I had made a lot of friends here . Hostel is also good I think apart from studies and clubs they should provide courses like dancing and singing and games We should maintain 75 percent attendance

Name: Bhuwan Soni
Review_Text: Hostel registration is based on cgpa we will get FFCS is their selling point, u can literally make ur own time table, choose ur own teacher, can take extra credits course too in order to reduce burden for next sem. Almost all facilities have done P.Hd from IITs, NITs & we have 100% doctoral faculty +++ we have CAL Tech learning to

Name: Arnav Gulkari
Review_Text: VIT is itself a brand, so I thought if not NITs why not to give it a try & we landed in VIT The distance of Hostels & AB, damn it's around 1.5km, for lunch if u r returning back to hostel & again going for classes is jst like nightmare Crowd crowe crowd ! If u r competitive guy then come VIT is ur place. But if u want to enjoy ur 4 years of clg life along wid quality placement choose Manipal 😂

Name: Sarvadnya Dharpure
Review_Text: Restriction, for what VIT is known for, some even say it's open prison, bcz Poctor do so much tantrums for outing & leave request  The teachers who taught me in the first semester The vibrant campus life, the beautiful spots to hang out with friends

Name: Anshuman Das
Review_Text: My club, where I can fully express my talents Authorities here are very hard to contact and very rude There is no transparency from VIT regarding many things

Name: Aarav Anand
Review_Text: You are not valued much as a student because there are over 10000 here. The infrastructure of the College is amazing The hostel accommodation and the food is wonderful

Name: Jothi Hari N
Review_Text: The placement and internship opportunities are amazong The Hostel Outing conditions for instructional days Some of the staff are money minded and can give the entire classroom and arrear

Name: Shreeansh Misra
Review_Text: The open book exams are Soo hard it makes everyone lose a bit of their cgpa The campus view is stunning and it had a 700 acres of land . There is theatres shopping complex and like everything need for a person is there within 2 km.

Name: Yuvraj Singh
Review_Text: Better environment to stay.good people especially the locals Red tag security.one of the worst people in vit . Difficult to get medical leave and for everything every single thing there is fine

Name: K Shrivathsan
Review_Text: To much to walk through the campus and the bus service inside the campus should be free Vibrant Campus Life: Diverse extracurricular activities and events enriched my college experience. Modern Infrastructure: Well-maintained facilities and modern amenities created a conducive learning environment.

Name: Narun Rajkumar
Review_Text: Supportive Faculty: Knowledgeable professors provided valuable guidance and support throughout my academic journey. Overcrowding: During peak hours, overcrowding in campus facilities could be inconvenient. Strict Attendance Policy: The rigid attendance requirements felt constraining at times.

Name: Jovan lloyd
Review_Text: Large Class Sizes: Some courses had large class sizes, making it challenging to receive personalized attention. I liked the college campus and the quality of the hostels Other than the overall placements are decent

Name: Shravni Jehurkar
Review_Text: There are many kinds of sports that happens in college for both male and female students Most disliked things are you are given room in second year according to your gpa Some of the teachers gives high marks while some very less which creates an unfair marking system

Name: Jatin
Review_Text: Attendance are extremely compulsory in this college Croud over here is good . There are good people to be with The sceneries over here are beautiful aswell

Name: Abhinav Chauhan
Review_Text: To many restrictions in the college and hostel Biased staff for north India crowd. Mostly teachers One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Tharunbala
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Vikash Baibhav
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des The greenery, classrooms,lab facilities and swcurity towards children

Name: Amrit Raj
Review_Text: The life is somewhat busy but interesting too as getting so much of the oppurtinites and extra curriculum activites too The caculty here are always ready to help even they are busy they try to help by texting also Travelling distance to college from hostel is large

Name: Nandita
Review_Text: You have to maintain the attendace above 75% The supportive faculty greatly enriched my learning experience. I appreciate the exam infrastructure for its efficiency and organization

Name: Akshay Vivek Bhave
Review_Text: I love my college's infrastructure for its modern facilities and conducive learning environment. The hostel mess often lacked variety in its menu and consistency in food quality, which was disappointing. The curfew of 9 pm felt restrictive and limited social activities, making it challenging to fully engage in campus life.

Name: Rithika
Review_Text: I like my campus infrastructure.Labs are equipped with ACs. Environment of studying is there in college is there. When holidays are given VIT drops students to bus stand,train station,airport.

Name: Yogananad
Review_Text: There could have been more time to relax. Work will be given on weekly basis.If one doesnt work they will be lagging in competition. Rooms could have 2 or 3 sharing. Wifi is a bit slow.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Campus is huge,teachers are very nice and supportive,evrything is available inside the campus only Cleanliness,very clean campus,very well maintained and discipline collage,girls safety is very nice in this collage Red tag annas ,no privacy to students,very strict in every thing,very stressfull environment due to high competition,less fun more stress

Name: SANJAI
Review_Text: I liked labs, there is no problem in labs I also liked the campus life, and the hostels are good Everything is good, Academics is also good

Name: Raajashree
Review_Text: Academic block classrooms are not having AC Most of the times we have classes on Saturdays as well Holidays are somewhat less as compared to govt colleges

Name: Abhinav Vikkram Swaminathan
Review_Text: Hostel is very good and food is also good, curriculum is updated well Classrooms are also good, labs are equipped with AC Teaching is also good, we can also choose our teachers

Name: Piruthvi Rajan
Review_Text: Academic block Classrooms are not equipped with AC Most of the times, saturdays will be working days Rules are very strict inside the campus, outing permissions etc are somewhat strict

Name: BYNA VARUN
Review_Text: The biggest thing is the placement in a effective manner The infrastructure of the university is very peaceful and nice environment to learn more Library facilities are good all types of books are in main library

Name: Vaibhav
Review_Text: The lack of transparency in the counseling process post-exam could be improved for better understanding of seat allocation criteria and waiting list procedures. Timings of the college, that is according to the course you choosing In canteen, the rates are not worth forthe food quantity

Name: Sahil Gupta
Review_Text: The college management was so good that will provide the best efforts to make students comfort The placement will be provided in top mncs in India and foregin The accomidation was so good and they will provide healthy food with minimum affordable cost

Name: Rahul
Review_Text: Campus facility is amazing, you can get almost every thing you need here.sports facilities are mainted quite impressive. Daily activities:- there is always something going on here in greenos or foodys which makes the environment lively. Course offred in vit are exceptional.  Some college just have that in curriculum bit vit teach that in detail.

Name: Swanand Yamgar
Review_Text: Too much crowded , yes there is really high number of intake and is overcrowded If you are north indian then you will face language barrier almost everyday Outing time is too short , if you are girl then is more short 2 hours on weekdays and 4 hours on weekends

Name: Harsha Dasari
Review_Text: Campus is beautiful filled with a lot of nature Flexible time table and can choose our faculty Social life is amazing in our university

Name: satwik sharma
Review_Text: There is a lot of crowd in our university. One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: A saipranav
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: Aditya pranihith Keerthy
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des I mostly like the college infrastructure and environment. I like college the curriculum and things to improve our personlity

Name: Sam Chandran S
Review_Text: In college there was long to walk from one building  to another. Our college methos is slot timings. From morning 8 clock class is there and evening 7.30 class is also there, it is difficult to students who come far away. The environment the college provides is amazing. It stays close to nature and ath same time is developing to its full potential with construction of various infrastructures

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The college spent a good amount in improving the sports and physical education sector The opportunities this college provides to meet and interact with different people is beyond comparison. A student can learn a lot of new things and get various experiences through these faculties and people visiting the campus 75 percent compulsory attendance is required for attending the examinations

Name: Saketh
Review_Text: Any leave request or outing request is to be approved by a proctor assigned to you which is a great process. This restricts the students in going out for emergencies. The way we have to maintain a balance between doing assignments, projects attending club activities and classes along with maintaing a social life is tiring at a lot of times Inside campus life is good, we have all the facilities and people here are quite helpful.

Name: Sree vardhan
Review_Text: We have a proctor proctee system in which a faculty is taking care of 30-40 students whenever they have any issues in whatsoever matter. Hostel facility is good enough and the food provided in mess is also good. Leave system and outing, even though the campus is full of energy, there are unnecessary restrictions.

Name: nithin
Review_Text: Less Greenery and plantations, I feel there should be more of that provided. Infrastructure and proper facilities like modern classrooms, well-equipped library and labs provided for learning. Hostel facilities including mess is above average within expectations.

Name: Addala Yedukondala Manikanta
Review_Text: Lack of proper accommodation in hostels due to a large number of students. There can be too much academic pressure and students may feel neglected depending on the individual. There needs to be more academic buildings for the same.

Name: Abhiram
Review_Text: i like the most part is the cultural fests and hackthons and the nature of vit. I go to walking daily evening in a cool breeze with my friends. And the the part of infrastructure. Its not up to the mark but its well in hostels atleast next coming to academics part the faculty here are well educated and all the faculties are alteast made their masters in iit's . FFCS a good pro for the students who makes use it accurately

Name: Sathwik
Review_Text: food provided in the hostels. and there is a food street here where many shops are located at a place and the cost of food is very high The overall atmosphere, with active and helpful teachers The hostel life with good quality food, always available cleaning, electricity, doctor and helpful staff

Name: Aritra Dubey
Review_Text: quality of study as collage mainly focus of CALTech  tech and non tech events ,cultural events scope and oppertunity to do different project.

Name: Srinith
Review_Text: hostel life is decent. as we cannot go out of this campus without permission food quality is sometime  bad. and food price in canteen is high intake of student in collage is very high

Name: pabbisetty revanth
Review_Text: Academic Courses Designed is one of the best across India. All thanks to it's FFCS concept. Placements that are offered by VIT is above par when compared with other private colleges. Provides Sport equipments for free when ID card is submitted.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Strict campus life with a CCTV or a guard always watching you. Construction campus with new developments ongoing which results in noise and inconvinience.(Chennai Campus) No Management member to guide you as you are on your own.

Name: Neer
Review_Text: Campus, Academic Block, Library, Lash-Green campus, scope and opportunities The hostel environment and food is far better than expectations. Quality of study and the style of teaching in the classroom is very good .

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: More academic bhuildings required as the intake of students is high student intake strength is very high as compared to the availability of the academic blocks and classrooms There is little pressure on the academic studies which is good or bad depends on the individuals.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech

Name: Anant Sharma
Review_Text: I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des

Name: Ashlesh I Gujjar
Review_Text: The Support they given for the talented people. Time table is designed very accurately that we get reasonable free time. Hostel food is sometimes bad in the mess.

Name: Rishi
Review_Text: Campus life- good gym, sports facility, swimming pool. Ffcs is very good for convenient and slot timings and good professors. If u r a nine pointer there is no minimum attendance criteria.

Name: Shivam
Review_Text: Minimum attendance criteria it shouldn't be there Too many assignments and hectic schedule Hostel in time is 9 pm andfor girls it is 8pm

Name: Abhijeet Raul
Review_Text: I liked library most in the campus. Facilities are more and we can use pc for those who don't have laptops. Anyone can participate in any clubs and sports. Maintenance in hostels are very good.  Bathrooms are to be cleaned everyday.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: It is common that in every college that some faculty are poor in teaching. In sports category there is no special mat for kabaddi College is very long to city and it is tough to go outing if we wanted to go at weekend.

Name: Roshan Biswal
Review_Text: Ability to choose flexible timetable and professors Ability to choose the number of subjects each sem Some pointless rules such as no kettles, electric items in hostel

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Behavior of some staff towards students  (Not always but a few times) The huge number of events- both technical and cultural, held in the College are great. The facilities and prompt action upon complaints is amazing.

Name: KANUBADDI KRISHAN REDDY
Review_Text: The ffcs system provides great flexibility and also there's this rule where 9 pointers don't have to follow the 75% attendance rule that's very good and provides a lot of time to follow other interests. The rules are very strict for girls, in time is 8 pm and there are many clothing restrictions. The student intake is very high due to which there is huge competition everywhere. There are crowds even for lifts and mess food.

Name: sai koushik
Review_Text: The procedures for outings and leaves, especially for girls, are really strict. Many activities other than just academics for students to grow. Cultural festival of vit is amazing and everyone should experience it once

Name: Vikash
Review_Text: The academics and exams are fairly easy here. Too much focus on exams. There is an exam after every 10 days Too much focus on English literature which students already learn till 12th

Name: SURYANSHU SAINI
Review_Text: Hostel life here is not that good as there are too many rules to be followed which feel unnecessary at times. Quality of study and the style of teaching in classroom is very good The hostel food(especially mayuri mess) is far better than expectation.

Name: Rudransh garg
Review_Text: There is scope and oppurtunity to do projects. more academic buildings required as the intake of students is more There is some little pressure on academics. which is good or bad depends on the individual

Name: Akhil V
Review_Text: there is should be a stable number of student intake every year. The academic facilities provided within the campus. It is really easy to get mentors within VIT and they are a valuable asset to your academic growth.

Name: Varsha Shekhawat
Review_Text: The people and social life in VIT especially outside class hours. The lack of freedom within the campus and hostels, even when it comes to academic matters. The subpar mess food and the occasional insolent treatment from faculty.

Name: Swayam Swastik Dash
Review_Text: The insane restrictions on personal freedom, especially for girls. One of the thing I like about my college are the technical event held by the clubs. You can learn a lot and gain a lot of experience from these events. Another thing I like about the campus are the people. You can come across different types of people here and networking is this campus is really good

Name: Shyamal
Review_Text: Another thing I like is the slot option provided by the college. Students gets to choose their class slot( either morning or evening) and the faculties The college is strict especially for hostelers. Getting an outing to go out of college is a hectic task. As they ask for parents permission, proctor permission just to go out and they have an early in time from outing that is 6pm Office order: Office order is something a student will receive if they get caught in any misconduct in the campus. Apparently if a student has more than 3 office order, he/she can't sit for placement

Name: Riddhima
Review_Text: Early in time for hostelers. Boys intime is 9pm and girls it's 8pm Hostel mess are pretty decent compared to other colleges, they offer good food. Cleanliness accross the campus is also pretty decent with trash cans fixed everywhere for ease of disposing waste.

Name: V Karthik
Review_Text: VIT offers good placements having 8 LPA average package. Less freedom, hostel in times are 9 pm after which the curfew begins. Very less wifi speed: hostel provides only 4mbps of wifi speed.

Name: Tarun Kumar Jain
Review_Text: Poor network accross the hostels is a big issue. One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: Krapanshu
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: Shubham Kumar Jha
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des In Vellore institute technology Bhopal University placement is good  placement all students take a placement  good prepared a student for placement offers students in super dream. Dream 90 percent placement are their  placement offers  good good All faculty teach good faculty  has good experience  and good qualification  every faculty qualification has b tech m  teach  PhD

Name: Sumit Kumar
Review_Text: I like this campus colloge life is good their I not like hostel life because in this hostel have many rules I dislike mess  food is not making a good

Name: Shubhankar Das Dewri
Review_Text: Huge campus and various facilities and infrastructures Nice hostel and mess services. Room management are good. Huge diversity around the world, they make better exposure.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: I liked the people at the campus from students to staff as well some lf the teachers The food on campus is great also there are some restaurants near by giving great food The club activities and events are just greaf from informative events to fun there is a event goiing on every day

Name: ROHIT SINGH
Review_Text: The rules are too strict for hostel and the punishment is just a way for them to get more money from us The language differences if you are someone from north india might be a trouble Some people are not as good as one might think so try to stay away from them

Name: Aman Jaiswal
Review_Text: Hostel facilities and labs facilities are good Food of mess is good and we have so many varieties Campus life is good and facilities are available

Name: MEGHNA DAS
Review_Text: Internet is very poor in our campus like 4 Mbps and sim network Is also poor Campus is too crowded so no place to play with friens So many restriction in our college on girls and boys

Name: Swapnil kumar
Review_Text: The campus is quite good with good sports facilities. The number of opportunities in technical and cultural aspects. The special teams are a great way to enter competitions.

Name: Suvarna dupaguntla
Review_Text: The rules are very strict and gaurds are also strict. Back checking is done always which is quite infuriating. Campus facilities provided to students are good.

Name: Ravi Shankar
Review_Text: The grading system of VIT is really good. The regular interval examination helps them focus on studies and along with events to keep mind fresh and active  The classroom doesn't have airconditioner and in summer it's very hot.

Name: PILLA RAHUL CHAITANYA
Review_Text: I final exam if you want to check if there is mistake in paper correction you have to pay to see your answer sheet officially  The timing of classes is weird, there are unnecessary breaks in between lecture which only waste time Infrastructure is really good as VIT never backs off from spending money on improving the architecture.

Name: Arjun
Review_Text: Courses offered have a lot of variety and specializations making it easier for students to choose exactly what they want FFCS- this is a system which is managed well here, 9 pointers get priority in choosing faculty and making their own time table, followed by 100 percent attendance holders If you are a hosteller then there are lot of restrictions like you cannot go outside for more than 6 hours.

Name: Chetan
Review_Text: The security guards keep whistling at boys and girls even sitting remotely close The amount of exams and tests conducted suck the soul out of every student every week you have something to attend to We can choose our own faculty and then there is time flexibility

Name: Vaishnavi kannan
Review_Text: Hostel bathroom are very clean and are cleaned on a regular basis If you have a 9 cgpa then there is no need of getting attendance Over populated ground at evening, it's very difficult to play

Name: Aryan
Review_Text: Everytime you have to give attendance while going inside the hostels and also everytime there is a bag check Ambience, infrastructure and good hostel accomodation Clean hostel rooms and time to time cleaning

Name: Surya MU
Review_Text: Good and smart friend circle coming from all the places of India and even from countries like Qatar etc Hostel timings and bring too strict for wearing ID cards Bad environment for student freedom and making the feeling of it like jail

Name: Sahit Pathipati
Review_Text: Only the road connectivity is available and distance of the cable from Railway station and Airport I like the infrastructure  their are may beautiful  places to sit and cill with friend . Their are many food shops and college also have a cafe ,dominos and restaurant.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: I also like the diversity provided by this college  as their are students from all over india and even nri students . . Some of the college  rules are very strict . You have to wear your id for all the time.

Name: Purvaja
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech

Name: Deena
Review_Text: I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des

Name: Mukunda
Review_Text: Placements offered from the college are very generous. The learning and teaching structure of our college How the college encourages cocurricular activities and programs

Name: shivangi tiwari
Review_Text: The campus area can still be very messy as its still developing Flexibility to communicate with the main authority is very minimal Location and accessibility is very limited due to the location of our college

Name: Isha ranjan
Review_Text: The campus life is only above average since there are many rules and restrictions in VIT. The course curriculum is well designed for maximum learning and easy absobtion of all the topics. VIT has a system where the take almost every student.

Name: Jagrut Pandya
Review_Text: The college environment and ambience is really mesmerizing and it is very greenish around the campus. The infrastructure of the oldest till the newest educational blocks are really eyegazing especially the architecture block. The kalpana chawla lawn is an eye catching spot that is in the main entrance. The sunsets in that place is just unforgettable.

Name: Aman Sinha
Review_Text: The out time limit for students is also too cramped and not able to spend your outside life without thunking about exceeding time limit. The partiality thats shown between students by faculties. Favoritism is also observed. I liked the campus cleanliness and the way they maintain the beauty of the campus.

Name: Shaik Mohammed Arif
Review_Text: The mess food is excellent and very well maintained compared to other colleges. I like the faculty and the proctor system which ensure security and safety for all students. I dislike the attendance system which requires us to have 75% attendance and its very hard to get a medical leave for a genuine reason.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: I dislike the strictness of the college security guards. I love how faculties here are soo supportive.Our college gives a lot exposure to real world ,so an introvert would also become extrovert here. I love the placement process here.We are provided with the accurate amount of training for super dream and dream offers.

Name: MEGHA S METI
Review_Text: I love the enets organised by different clubs specially the cultural event in which their is dance and music I dont like the in timing for girls which is 7pm where as for boys it is 9 pm. I dont teachers being very strict with the deadlines of assigments.

Name: Sanket
Review_Text: I dont like the gaurds who work ere.They are very rude sometimes. The campus, the infrastructure, hostel mess. The culture of the societies in college.

Name: Niket
Review_Text: The encouragement of the people around you and the energy that they share which can have a great reflect on you. The distance between the hostel and academic block. The restrictions on trimmings and discipline.

Name: Aleen Veronica
Review_Text: The management during the events in some cases. The mess food and hostels are really nice There is no ragging involved in this college and immediate actions are taken against any people who try to do so

Name: Kartik
Review_Text: The events taking place inside the college is very nice Some of the teachers are very rude and sometimes there is partiality and the faculties are biased The college is very far away from Bhopal city and is actually situated in sehore district of Madhya Pradesh. If you are an hospital then travelling from your home to college or vice versa is quiet challenging sometimes

Name: om nayak
Review_Text: The sports facilities are very low in this college and there is no proper grounds or fields for playing outdoor sports and there is always some construction work going on I liked the ambiance and greenary around the campus The class structure and time table for the classes

Name: Kartikey Srivastava
Review_Text: The food availability in the campus we get to various cuisines in the campus itself There is no air conditioning in the campus which is quite frustrating There will be ac for the faculty but not students

Name: Saurav Kumar
Review_Text: We have to walk for classes all classes won't be in the same block which is quite frustrating and in summers its a big movie for us It is a coed campus, with students from any places all over the world. so you can how to behave with opposite gender and learn about different cultures, and how to mingle with every one You can participate in cultural events and clubs from where you can devlop lots of skils

Name: Prashant Sharma
Review_Text: The food courts are available inside the campus it self, where you can eat fast food, ice creams, etc Frequently the lift goes under out of service You need to travel from one class to other after every class, not all classes are conducted in the same room

Name: Abhay Pratap Singh
Review_Text: All ways construction work happens in the college One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: Yuvarajan
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des I very much like the culture of this college and the social possibilities alert helping and coatings are very hard working and the events share organise are pretty good

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: the campus which is not fully built but the places with that are already provided a sufficient forest mainly the hostel restrictions which get on the nerves the restrictions which get on going out of the college campus and

Name: Soyamsidh Das
Review_Text: the availability of readymade food available for available to buy You can select your own timetable (ffcs) Hostel quality and mess quality is very nice

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Academic wise it is excellent with the faculty are very nice Hotel block and  academic block are located far away Sometimes washrooms are not maintained properly maintained

Name: Hima
Review_Text: I loved the campus. It's a beautiful and vibrant campus. The social atmosphere is the best and made a lot of friends here. The FFCS system allows me to pick my own timetable.

Name: Idukuda Praharshitha
Review_Text: The FFCS system sometimes doesn't allow to pick all the necessary credits. Everything we do in campus is of some cost The Attendance system is extremely strict

Name: Diptonil Das
Review_Text: Quality of professors and their knowledge in the field Flexibility in choosing the time table which is helpful Cleanliness, Greenery, no pollution, strict rules also regarding pda

Name: Akash
Review_Text: No student can use drugs , smoke or alcohol since there are guards every where all night taking rounds in the hostel ,even the wardens are very cautious and strict No hosteller can roam outside of college campus without parents signature and email confirmation it's great, there is a personal proctor for each student to take care of their problem If you are caught doing something bad there would be huge implications like leaving the hostel and big fines

Name: Vishal
Review_Text: Internship opportunity  is more then most collt Placement opportunities are very good and the main reason to come here. There are a lot of people. So there is a lot of competition.

Name: Utkarsh Kumar
Review_Text: Friendly faculties, recess, staffs , hangouts Friends, lab experiences, study environment, Industrial visits, Clubs Campus atmosphere, cleanliness of the campus

Name: Arun
Review_Text: Certain rules are strict in VIT such as you're not allowed to roam at certain places If some security catches you with being too close to the opposite gender he might turn up and ask for your IDs Ambience nature green campus facility etc

Name: Rahul Kumar
Review_Text: Placements must be improved. I like the faculty.They teach well.we can get knowledge. I love the mess food.It is very tasty.we have restaurants also.

Name: Akhil
Review_Text: The sports were very nice.We can play so many games. The college is overcrowded.it is very bad. There is only outing for 6hr.this should be removed.

Name: Sahil Chauhan
Review_Text: we should roam block to block.its very bad. The huge library having soo many books and journals to study. The academically oriented college that this is.

Name: Beemer Sowmya
Review_Text: The amazing faculty which guides and encourages us in every step of our way even outside the classroom. The high number of student intake which is overwhelming. The fee structure which can become more affordable.

Name: velugoti geethanjali
Review_Text: I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des

Name: Raja Jaiswal
Review_Text: well equipped labs with access to all the students. Best infrastructure and campus life for the students. Experienced faculty and availability of resources for placement preparation and higher studies. People from many places are here which improves cross cultural communication and get to know all the cultures and heritages.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Strength is a bit high in the campus which feels crowded. Doctoral Faculty: all the teachers here have PHDs and hence they are vary good their field and are able to help us out. FFCS: we can select our teachers and the slot in which we want to have classes. It helps with making the time table on our own.

Name: Rishabh Jain
Review_Text: Since the college is very new, there are things that are yet to be made. The college is under construction and hasn't been made completely yet The campus life is not very good since the college is in the middle of no where and the city is very far. Even to go to city it takes atleast 2 hours. The wifi provided ny the hostel is very slow, it diesn't work most of the time and and you also won't be able to use your own mobile data due to probably the jammers in the hostel.

Name: Himanethri
Review_Text: I liked the most is campus the campus is very big and nice to explore  more things and hang out And the other thing is canteen food which i liked the most in our campus it will be nice I liked the way they are teaching and the grading system

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The one thing is focus more on practical apart from mathematical And the other thing is afternoon batch which disliked the most The thing is disliked is they are giving more importance to btech

Name: LAKSHAY BHARADWAJ
Review_Text: Infrastructure, labs and curricular activities. Teaching pattern, many faculty don't care about your marks Strong Placements: VIT boasts an impressive placement record, attracting numerous companies and offering high average and peak salary packages.

Name: Sachin Kumar
Review_Text: Qualified Faculty: Many students report having positive experiences with professors, acknowledging their expertise, approachability, and dedication to teaching. Industry-oriented Curriculum: The course curriculum is often praised for being updated and relevant to industry needs, preparing students for successful careers. High Fees: The cost of education at VIT can be a significant concern for some students, especially those coming from financially disadvantaged backgrounds.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Mixed Reviews on Food Quality: While some students find the hostel food satisfactory, others express concerns about its quality and variety. Strict Schedule and Workload: The academic workload and schedule at VIT can be demanding, requiring a high level of commitment and time management from students. lush green campus to roam around in the evenings

Name: Amrit Volety
Review_Text: fresh air to breathe in and very safe environment curriculum as highly advanced as Massachusetts institute of technology The canteens here are very good for us and for our freshness too

Name: Tejas Chavan
Review_Text: The infrastructure of the university is a major part of its success The events and fest are a reminder that we have a lot to celebrate The English language is disregarded and is not used to describe the subject

Name: Aditi
Review_Text: The faculty is average and has been in a lot better shape than most of the time The food can be improved with the addition of the food processor The college provides many opportunities for the students to improve your skills

Name: sumit negi
Review_Text: The college also has many good food outlets inside the college The campus life of the college is good, it is very neat and clean. The college is very strict specially for girls

Name: Anurag dubey
Review_Text: The relative grading system in terms of marks may sometimes be a problem for students I Enjoyed collaborative campus atmosphere Found navigating extensive coursework challenging

Name: Sandip Datta
Review_Text: Appreciated diverse perspectives and innovative ideas Challenging to navigate extensive coursework Limited flexibility in certain course requirements

Name: aditya singhal
Review_Text: Some aspects of the academic load were overwhelming Education, teaching , skills , placement, food, environment eduaction, placement, food, games and there are many more

Name: Aman Barnawal
Review_Text: education, placement, food, games and ther are many more there is nothing to dislike , except weather conditions hot weather, water, transportation, food

Name: Chanakya
Review_Text: there is nothing to dislike except weather condition One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. Name: Abhijeet Kumar
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Events, Curriculum, Exam system, grading system, flexibility. The fact that there are research opportunities always waiting for students

Name: Manan Seth
Review_Text: All. Faculties are helpful and always there for you. Over crowded campus. The admissions must be limited to make individual experience more sound and productive The fact that the campus is still developing.

Name: Sparsh Kandpal
Review_Text: Basic necessities or city life or basic commute facilities are low because of remote location. The campus day life , freedom to stay outside campus without parents approval each time Provisiomn of Guardians to keep us secure and hep us in times of need

Name: Avinash Venugopal
Review_Text: Provision of reserved rooms for us NRI students The biast oppinion of select faculty and their reflection of it on marks The fact how connections help you get out of trouble and a lack of it causes distress

Name: Madhan
Review_Text: Lack of Flexible credit system for students opting the TCS courses : Computer Science with Business Systems the faculty is good and they teach pretty well the campus is really big with greenery all around

Name: Sujal Ghonmode
Review_Text: WARDEN RESPOSIBILTY , MESS QUALITY(FOR ME) , SORTS ,GYM INFRASTRUCTOR AND MENS AREA SIDE RESTING AREAS SOCIAL-LIFE OPPERTUNITY , CODE COMPETITION

Name: Mukul shekhar
Review_Text: VERY STRICT ENVIRONMENT ,  RESTRICTED MOTION AT NIGHT WEATHER AND WATER ALSO, MOSTY HOT HERE AND HARD WATER FOOD SINCE SOUND VERY-VERY LITTLE NORTH SPICY FOOD AND ALSO VERY EXPENSIVE

Name: Vishnu priya
Review_Text: Good relationship with all the culture of students from different places Good faculty and good lecture swii be mhre enthusiastic here Good internet good interior architecture

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: We have to walk a long distance ......... Money should be paid for the journey from our hostel to try ej main gate in shuttel Bat heta waves withou AC we can't survive here

Name: Shubham
Review_Text: Academic environment is competitive and has good competition The greenery in the campus let's you feel like you're free. The academic faculty is cooperative and seniors are helpful

Name: Samrudhi  S Ruikar
Review_Text: The gender separation and partiality it possesses The amount of travel you have to do to reach collage from hostel Not many fun doing activities and more of academic centric collage with very strict rules

Name: Harsh raj
Review_Text: Freedom, which encourages students to be more productive. No dress code, which eliminates the hazzle. Faculties who are very good in what they do.

Name: Lalli v p
Review_Text: Sometimes the classes end at 5.30 for day scholars. The faculties and the way of their teaching The clubs they have and fests they conduct

Name: Manas Maheshwari
Review_Text: The safety and security of the students and importance for the students Over intake for each year which makes students over crowded research projects that i do and chapter and club i m part of which gives me endless opportunities

Name: Naga Mahendra
Review_Text: my campus life which majorly includes the people i met and the board that i m part of the cultural fests and events that happens every once ina while my accommodation isnt too great and the system which we have to follow

Name: Pappala Likith
Review_Text: the average marking scheme and exam system which is too overwhelming the strict dress code behaviour which is not fair and discrimination in the strictness towards girls and guys One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: PRABHAV VERMA
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: Gummadi Yashwanth
Review_Text: Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Campus infrastructure and nature, also the hostels are good.

Name: Ashutosh padihary
Review_Text: Clubs and chapters where we can socialize with people and improve ourselves. FFCS , we can choose our time table and faculty. The unequal rules between boys and girls.

Name: Kishore G
Review_Text: Campus outing timings and campus in timings. Strict rules towards girls about the dresses, we are students and we will wear decently only but it not okay to put harsh restrictions on dress code. The faculty members , the job opportunities, Environment

Name: Adithya
Review_Text: Friends circle, group discussion , individual as well as group project College infrastructure, college contacts with other colleges and marking system Sometimes during rain the roads of academic block are filled with water

Name: Sampath Kumar
Review_Text: Three boys hostel block goes to one single saloon which creates a mess Three boys hostel goes to one single gym which makes the gym filled with students and no one can get proper time The campus life, sports and the placement

Name: Bathala Nikhileswar
Review_Text: Campus is pretty huge, green, foodies, greenos Woodys samsung etc all places available dominos too Too much crowd, only vellore campus has 30000 students

Name: Dileep kumar
Review_Text: Fees is on the higher side, 400000 per year Transportation issue, no airport in vellore You can explore wide range of clubs or meet different people. Makes you understand what you are fit off

Name: Metta naveen reddy
Review_Text: Campus is huge & full of greenery.  Calssrooms are superb with AC Teaching methods & grading techniques. Relative grading provides people to get good cgpa Fee is very costly & not affordable fr lower middle class people.

Name: Kushagra Agrawal
Review_Text: It is too Hot most of the year. Place filled with humidity. In summers it is hard to breath also Campus is crowded as the Intake of students Is hugee Good teaching facilities with comprehensive courses.

Name: V Harshini
Review_Text: The club activities being very engaging. The tech fest (gravitas) with all of its interesting events. Below average mess facilities and menu options

Name: Mayank
Review_Text: Lots of internal changes and politics make it hard to expect transparency of information. Very high bureaucratic system, makes it difficult to get work done. I liked the vibe of the campus, its a very huge campus and all kinds of extra circulars are available you can have very joyful stay

Name: KEERTHAN KUMAR
Review_Text: I liked the credit system here you can complete your course way earlier as well as you can choose which subjects you want to study I didnt like the way they organize huge crowds The climate of the city is too bad its very humid and very much hot and the water here is too hard .my hairfall started after joining here

Name: Gorripati Rithwik Reddy
Review_Text: Not the college but the city in which the college is located is too boring and not much things to do outside canpus The hostel life was very good, i made a lot of friends and am very happy about it The fests in VIT are outstanding, we have gravitas a technical fest and Riviera one of the biggest and best fests in india

Name: DHRUV KEDIA
Review_Text: The campus life is beautiful, though vellore is a remote place but there are a lot of facilities available near the campus There could be AC in all the hostel rooms, and in the theory classrooms The population here is huge, there is no place in campus for privacy,  whereever ypu go you find people, so dont ask for peace or alone time

Name: Dharansh Neema
Review_Text: Good cultural fests, transport availability, sports. Good faculties, infrastructure, and other facilities like Dominos, a cafe, 2 canteens and other shops. No ragging or bullying in campus, as strict actions are taken against it.

Name: Nagaanjali
Review_Text: Population is high, and placement competition is high. Some labs are very bad, systems being slow or not working at all Some faculties being too strict and hard to work with and giving too much unwanted work

Name: Shashank Asthana
Review_Text: The friends I made here and my fellow batchmates which help me anytime. I like the Gaming Lab and its facilities, where i get a good PC to do my work and projects. The class timming which we can select ourselves during FFCS Registration.

Name: Akhil Arumugam
Review_Text: The internet speed is pretty slow for a CSE Students. The distance between Academic block and Boys hostel is very lengthy. No good sports ground ( for football and cricket) aviable right now but we have good courts here.

Name: NAMAN APANNA
Review_Text: Clubs and communities: there is a vast number of both and they are very attractive Restrictions: there is a huge number of restrictions including celebrations etc One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech

Name: Karan gandha
Review_Text: FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA

Name: DISHA DAVEY

Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des The leskine campus share is extraordinary like it motivational to go to campus daily and the friendly environment

Name: Kumar Vaibhav
Review_Text: Dis like it just said that I can say Madhya Pradesh because it heated too much and a long roads we have to travel daily to go to college Campus placements are a big plus point  of VIT The infrastructure here and the campus in general is really great

Name: Ishant Dhakad
Review_Text: Faculty and seniors are also very helpful  VIT is located in the outskirts of Vellore, so there's not a lot of place to go out here Mostly the fees here is affordable, but it might get steep for students in category 4 and 5

Name: Khushi chelani
Review_Text: VIT has a little bit too many restrictions, so sometimes that can be an adverse factor The academic block is well built and provides all types of facilities for the students to excel in their respective fields. The faculties are very friendly and provide adequate knowledge for the students to be successful in life.You can learn so much from them.

Name: Ayushman Kumar
Review_Text: The hostel mess provides huge variety of foods for the students while keeping in mind the safety and well being of the students. The sheds while going to class are quite narrow and it's difficult to pass through when people are going either way. The College is still under construction in some aspects while makes pollution a disturbing factor.

Name: Dewansh
Review_Text: The quality of water is quite bad here .Its not colleges fault but still needed to mention that Curriculum, Student engagement, Placements, Events, Sports. High fees, long class hours, Crowded campus, Under construction campus.

Name: Kiriti
Review_Text: The fully flexible credit system, the fests, the dance club Exam patterns and the attendance procedure Sports facilities and food canteens inside the university

Name: Aryan Srivastava
Review_Text: Too long to walk from one block to another Pretty crowded during busy times and can be irritating Climate of Vellore is very unimaginable and keeps bothering

Name: Sachin S
Specialization: Computer Science and Engineering + Data Science
Review_Text: Infrastructure, teaching, well equipped labs, wide range of books in library Sports facilities are great. There is a very big ground and indoor sports are also too good. The college is very supportive becaus there are so many students clubs and they provide attendance

Name: Pragathes G
Review_Text: Electronics Faculty since first year the electronics faculties are quite knowledgeable and passionate Placement opportunities for Non core sector jobs Library book collection is upgraded and quite good

Name: Ishvi jain
Review_Text: Poor Management System and communication no one picks calls Hostel facilities are very poor and the behaviour of authorities is too bad The infrastructure is really weird and hard to navigate through not adequate labs

Name: Seralathan
Review_Text: I liked the academic curriculum. It helps to improve our efficiency and also make us realize what is our weakness and where we need to improve. I liked rules and regulations of college . We need to follow these rules otherwise we will get severe punishment. It also maintains discipline in college. I like our placement. I am now in 2nd year and our all 4th year students got placement.

Name: SOORYA
Review_Text: There is huge distance between various colleges. We need to walk a lot and also in afternoon it's really hot. There is huge crowd which increases competition a lot which decreases package of students. There is a lot strictness for girls and they have to obey it, otherwise they will be fined or removed from college.

Name: Manul Tyagi
Review_Text: Campus Infrastructure: Modern and well-maintained facilities, including state-of-the-art classrooms and laboratories. Faculty: Knowledgeable and approachable faculty members who contribute to a positive learning environment. Placements: Strong placement record with reputed companies visiting the campus for recruitment.

Name: Vishnu K
Review_Text: Crowded Classrooms: In popular courses, classrooms might be crowded, potentially affecting the student-teacher ratio. The faculty, ragging free atmosphere. the senior students, clubs The cultural fest and sports fest and the opportunities provided to students through these platforms.

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: The education quality of the college and the opportunities and placements provided The food in hostel is very bad and the food street has expensive food which also has very average taste The fees seems to be very expensive if you get a higher rank and its also near impossible to obtain scholarship with this much competition.

Name: Vikaash
Review_Text: The library is always crowded as the books are limited only to engineering as no other books are available. One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. Name: Divyesh Shivakumar

Name: Sudharshan Srinivas
Review_Text: The choose your own faculty and courses comes is very appreciated. The food of the hostel can be improved so much more. The course registration after the 1st semester. You get to chose tour own teacher and time slot from the second semester.

Name: Shubhojit Sarkar
Review_Text: There is a food street area where there are all types of food available and it is fun too to hangout sometime with friends The sports activities and club involvements are very good and fun to be part of Not all the class romms consist of AC and that was not what we thought at the start of admission

Name: Naman
Review_Text: The campus is still being under construction and it will take time to build it fully. The hostel just has a big block and just rooms in it not any fun activities or a garden or something in the hostels. I Liked Varous Personalitites And Friends And Their Talents

Name: harsh katariya
Review_Text: I Loved The College Infrastructure At Some Situations College Location Is Not Appreciated It Is Very Far From Cities campus infrastructure have mainly 4 blockscentyral block(cb) is kind of unique,academic block(ab1),ab2,rock plaza

Name: Hemachandra K
Review_Text: sports facilities is really great ,equipped with best courts for badmintn,squash,tennis college response regarding anything is very fast and cooperative  and specially everything here is done very systematically its location  is really bad really nearby is nothing in the range of 20km

Name: Somraj Sarkar
Review_Text: their strict rules and files for almost every punishments their timing regarding coming inside hostel is 8:30 pm .as we have claases till 7:30 so we have to do all chill and fun in 1 hr CAMPUS LIFE IS GOOD . I LIKE THE COLLEGE LIFE AND CLUBS HERE

Name: Akanksha
Review_Text: HOSTEL LIFE IS FUN HERE . I ENJOY HOSTEL LIFE A LOT . NEARBY TOURIST SPOTS ARE TOO GOOD . YOU CAN GO WITH YOUR FRIENDS.  FFCS I HATE THE MOST . I AM NOT ABLE TO CHOOSE THE FACULTY I NEED

Name: Shreeman Pradhan
Review_Text: I like the campus life and infrastructure. In addition to education I like extra curricular activities. Technical and non technical clubs and be a part of these clubs.

Name: Riya Sachdeva
Review_Text: I didn't like some strict rules and regulations. Hostellers are not allowed to takeguitar, iron boxes etc. Hostellers should be in their respected rooms before 9.00 pm

Name: Lakshay Peswani
Review_Text: infrastructure of vit is more impressive to see celebration festivals and culturals and college fests the fees structure is too high for the poor students

Name: Vedant Thapak
Review_Text: Academic Excellence: VIT Vellore prioritizes academic rigor and excellence across its programs. The institution boasts a distinguished faculty who are experts in their fields, ensuring quality education and mentorship. The curriculum is designed to Dynamic Campus Life: The campus life at VIT Vellore is vibrant and enriching, offering a plethora of extracurricular activities, cultural events, and student clubs. From technical competitions to cultural festivals, there is always something happen. Top-notch Facilities: VIT Vellore is equipped with modern infrastructure and facilities to support various academic and extracurricular pursuits. The library houses a vast collection of books, journals, and digital resources, catering to the divers

Name: Prashant kumar
Review_Text: Room for Growth: VIT Vellore has shown a commitment to continually improving its offerings. While some facilities or services may not currently meet all expectations, the institution's proactive approach to feedback and development means there's alwa Challenges as Learning Opportunities: Like any institution, VIT Vellore may face occasional challenges or setbacks. However, these instances can be reframed as valuable learning opportunities for both the institution and its members. By confronting c Perspectives: While individual preferences and experiences may vary, VIT Vellore's diverse community of students, faculty, and staff contributes to a rich tapestry of perspectives and backgrounds. While this diversity may sometimes lead to differing

Name: DARAPUREDDY NITHIN SRI SARVESWAR
Review_Text: Campus life ,clubs ,events ,hostels ,opportunities ,placements Strict rules for girls in the campus. Dress rules, PDA guards. Inequality among the south and north Indians

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: Sometimes they make our schedule very hectic like we give exams on sundays as well The competitive atmosphere , availability of library  with variouys books, food courts , good hostels and placement opportunities are very large to secure good placements the curriculum is very supportive to learn , it offers various schemes like the student itself are very happy to choose the interested courses they want to study and alos they are giving chance to choose the faculty as well according to our interest

Name: Harsh Nanda
Review_Text: the hostels are very clean and tidy , there are 360 people who always  helps in case of any emergency related to the students so that one can lead good life in hostels the over competition and strength , since the subjevts are very tough to grasp but it should be like that so that everone gives their best so it is quite difficult to competete the wifi or internet related issues are very irritating in the hostels as well as campus it is difficult to get internet to attend any online guest lectures and any educuation related queries. Sometimes it is very difficult to talk

Name: Vatsal Unadkat
Review_Text: Since there are many students , so there are various related life styles but the mess food is not that much tasty but they try to provide nutritious food but sometimes the food is not at all tasty so some students are very difficult to get habituate One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS. A study who is facing difficulty to study more, can take less number of credits and it will reduce the burden of the students. And the student can also Complete the entire course in 4 years instead of 5years  by taking maximum no of credits.  ~ Supriya R Patil, B.Sc + M.Sc

Name: Kotla Sai Harshith
Review_Text: Campus Life in Vit is simply magnificent.All types of facilities are provided inside the campus including sport complex and restaurants.The girls to boys ratio in Mechanical engineering is surprisinly high of about 1:7.  ~ Mithilesh Angal, B.Tech I don’t like how the student and faculty ratio is 60-40  ~ Praveen Kumar, BCA Lot of exams yearly 3 exams in a semester 2-3 quiz and 1-2 DA  ~ Kartik Navnath Narare, B.Tech

Name: Animesh Sameer
Review_Text: Water is really bad. 750+ TDS. It makes you go bald. Really.  ~ Piyush Prajapati, B.Des Campus infrastructure, sports facilities Cultural and technical fest , classrooms

Name: Debanshu
Review_Text: Friends, facility members,and seniors helping juniors ,no ragging Hostel facilities,  mess food with alot of oil The weather here is too humid and summer is too bad

Name: Harsh Kumar
Review_Text: The prices here at shops are too high and order food from outside is not available No harmful competition between students, every one will help you in one or the other way The climate of VIT AP campus is really amazing, you will definitely enjoy the climate here

Name: Vinisha
Review_Text: Here in VIT they encourage your ideas more than the studies, many incubation centers and labs and funds will be provided if your idea is worthy The grading system, till last sem the grading system was too worse, Even the average student can get the same grades as a brilliant get Cgpa criteria for placements and internships, recently the cutoff for internships is set for 9.2

Name: Sakshi Biyani
Review_Text: Timings of college, as a day scholar 9-6 is really a headache for students Infrastructure and greenish of vit vellore Vit life is great to enjoy and a simple life

Name: Ayush Pandey
Review_Text: To high pressure for University ranking  holder Fees structure is too high for the poor students Academic is very good and the facilities are best

Name: Sudhir
Review_Text: Robust placement and good infrastructure are good Placement 90% and mixed facilities experience I think this is very important to lack of opportunities

Name: Rumit Nagori
Review_Text: Fees is too high in this college it's not sufficient for someone the teaching here is very nice and very understanding also. the campus is very big and classrooms are very big and cleaned.

Name: Sumit Kejriwal
Review_Text: the greenery here is so peaceful and free to enjoy the campus. sometimes we have water and electricity problems. the food here sometimes was not good to taste.

Name: Aman Kumar
Review_Text: we have very strict rules for girls here. Fully flexible credit system by which we can create our own timetable and exams timetable Many clubs from which we can interact with many number of people.

Name: Diptorshi Tripathi
Review_Text: Many cultural and technical fests in which we can showcase our talent. The backlog fee is too high which is difficult to bare. The travelling is difficult from the campus to cities.

Name: Rajat
Review_Text: The faculty list will not be provided before the course registration. College atmosphere, extra co-curricular activities and opportunities Teaching, faculty experience , facilities

Name: Niladri Kuity
Review_Text: Auto fair is expensive and cabs are not available all the time Fees is bit expensive for middle class people In hostel wifi speed is too nice we peacefully do our work with out any interrupt on

Name: Souradip Saha
Review_Text: By changing from one block to another block is a good exercise for students Faculty and feedback team is good and it is a good thing Wifi is not available in academic block and phone signal also not good

Name: Anonymous
Review_Text: In time of computer based exams we face lots of diffulties Campus is under construction and there is full of dust everywhere Infrastructure is one of the best part in here

Name: Shivansh
Review_Text: Events make Vellore Institute of Technology super cool Quality Education with highly qualified professors Population in the Vellore Institute of Technology

Name: Harsha Vardhan
Review_Text: Vulnerability of classes that is we can go whenever we want Hygiene hostels and regular cleaning of the hostels Nothing much than the above two mentioned

Name: Khush Chadha
Review_Text: Different classes for different subjects Hostel rules are too rigid making them too strict Less social interaction between the students

Name: Aryan Chauhan
Review_Text: One of my senior got placed in Couch Base for 34LPA CTC another got placed in Unilever for 42LPA but this was for CSE and related branches while few of my seniors got decent package from mechanical branch too 8-12L in companies like Mercedes a Euler  ~ Anonymous, B.Tech FFCS.
